			<title>Ransomware, Phishing and Fraud</title>
			<itunes:title>Ransomeware, Phishing and Fraud</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 19 Feb 2025 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[a1be9dce-ab82-4b59-a05b-127327a5f826]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/259]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Cybersecurity isn't just a concern for large corporations. It's vital for businesses of all sizes. It's essential for companies to know how to protect sensitive data, restore from backups, and regularly test their systems with internal pen tests to keep their teams safe. Today's guest is Bryce Austin. Bryce is the CEO of TCE Strategy, a cybersecurity advisory firm. They provide vulnerability scans, penetration tests, fractional CISO services, and incident response services. He is also a professional speaker on ransomware. Bryce is the fractional CISO to many companies, including one on the S&P 500.</p> <p dir="ltr">We talk about the key aspects of cybersecurity for businesses, and how to be proactive with patching, training and strong password management. He shares his experiences with major cyber incidents including ransomware, phishing and the Target breach, and how defense in depth, backups and financial controls are key. Bryce also mentioned the use of password managers, regular vulnerability scanning and external monitoring to increase cyber resilience. We share practical tips for all businesses to protect against ever changing cyber threats.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[00:59] Bryce started TCE Strategy in 2016. It's their goal to keep their clients one step ahead of cybercriminal risk.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[01:32] He has a degree in chemistry. Technology was just for fun. He ended up working in the payroll space which was ripe for cyber security concerns.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[03:00] He was really pushing cybersecurity and then their company was purchased by Wells Fargo. It ended up being amazing training for starting his own cybersecurity business.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[05:24] Bryce shares how he was affected by the Target security breach. He ended up unemployed and was deeply affected by food stamp requirements for his family. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[07:34] He wanted to make sure he would never go through this again and started his company.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[08:19] His public speaking began in 2011.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[09:17] He was indirectly affected by the Target breach, and he also shares his indirect personal one.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:59] Bryce was actually spearfished in 2018.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:36] Incident response is when something happens from a cybersecurity standpoint and damage has occurred. Oftentimes data is encrypted. This is a ransomware attack.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:18] Bryce tells the story about how a hotel was hacked and a large payment was able to be intercepted.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:31] Phishing attacks are where someone clicks on a bad link.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:38] His biggest Christmas gift was none of his clients getting hacked.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:05] They also had a ransom demand where they had to pay a million dollars.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:02] If they would have been looking harder this wouldn't have happened.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:26] Issues with hooking up to the Internet and having default passwords.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:07] Why it's impractical to make ransomware illegal.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:12] Even criminals have a reputation to uphold and usually hand over the encryption key.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:56] Bryce talks about some of the preventative things that people can do. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:47] Be proactive and have diligent patching.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:37] Don't use the same passwords over and over. Use a password keeper. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:54] Have offline backups.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:09] Follow all processes and procedures when moving money. Use unique passwords.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:27] It's important to encrypt your backups.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://bryceaustin.com/">Bryce Austin</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">(612) 730-9897.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/bryceaustin/">Bryce Austin on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>CISOs: The Ultimate Stress Test With Jill Knesek</title>
			<itunes:title>CISOs: The Ultimate Stress Test With Jill Knesek</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 12 Feb 2025 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[10cdd7d5-a8d8-4a05-a08a-d41a8d2c7951]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/258]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">The CISO role is constantly changing. With all the shifts in cybersecurity, it's crucial to find ways to attract new talent to close the growing skills gap. CISOs now juggle complex systems managed at multiple levels and handle burnout amongst many other responsibilities.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today's guest is Jill Knesek. Jill is the Chief Information Security Officer for Blackline, a company that does financial SaaS solutions. It’s based out of the Los Angeles area. She’s been there almost three years now as the CISO, running the information security team.</p> <p dir="ltr">She previously served as Chief Security Officer for BT Global Services. She has more than 15 years' experience directing security programs, including service as a special agent for the FBI assigned to the Cyber Crime Squad in Los Angeles Field Office, where she was involved in several high-profile cases, including Kevin Mitnick. </p> <p dir="ltr">In this episode, we cover the CISO role evolving from low visibility to a C-level position, managing multi-cloud infrastructures and aligning with other teams and the ongoing cybersecurity skills gap and burnout. Jill also talks about incident response and crisis management and collaboration within the cybersecurity community to fill the blind spots and strengthen the defenses.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[01:23] She's now the Chief Information Security Officer for Blackline, a company that does financial SaaS solutions.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[02:00] She was also an FBI special agent for 3 and 1/2 years working cybercrime. She was super excited, because this was her lifelong dream.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[03:35] She loved the FBI, but she knew she could do more for the industry on the private side.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[04:21] Jill talks about how the CISO role has evolved. It's now a C-level position.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[06:26] Some of the boards were very interested in what was going on with security. There has to be a balance with funding and proving your success.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[07:39] Now complexity is an issue. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[09:03] The cloud adds so many connecting services. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:45] CISOs are getting more responsibility and need more qualified people in their teams. There's a gap with not enough people coming into the cybersecurity industry.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:30] How the idea of stress and working nights and weekends can deter some graduates from the cybersecurity industry.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:15] Boards and executive committees expect the CISO to be right in the middle of things. They want real-time updates and to know what everyone is working on right now.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:47] The importance of keeping a calm level-headed view when something goes wrong.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:41] We learn about the flow of straightening out curves or incidents. Learn during the small incidents and practice the process.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:57] The importance of not scolding the team for being too quick to react. It's better to have a false alarm than to ignore a serious problem.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:10] Jill does a one-to-one with everyone on her team each quarter. She tries to Mentor them with some of the things that she's learned.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:29] We hear about a couple of incidents where ransomware got into the environment. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:01] When someone else reported that something weird was going on in the network.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:27] To help with the talent gap, we need to start introducing cybersecurity at the high school level.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:15] It's important for CISOs to be connected with other groups and events.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.blackline.com/about/leadership/#jill-knesek">Jill Knesek at Blackline</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/jillknesek/">Jill Knesek on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>AI, Automation, and the Future of Cybersecurity With Mike Lyborg</title>
			<itunes:title>AI, Automation, and the Future of Cybersecurity With Mike Lyborg</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 05 Feb 2025 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[8607ab68-ad0d-4683-83bc-58c5c1a22b9e]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/257]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">With the increase in targeted cyber attacks, it's more important than ever for organizations to quickly identify and respond to threats. AI is helping security teams by acting as virtual analysts, handling much of the investigation work. However, human oversight is still essential for the final steps and judgment.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today's guest is Michael Lyborg. Michael is the Chief Information Security Officer at Swimlane. Prior to taking his current role, Michael was Global Vice President of Advisory Services, a highly sought-after expert by the world's largest Fortune 500 companies and global government agencies to advise on the creation and operation of industry-leading security operations.</p> <p dir="ltr">In this episode Michael shares his experience and wisdom on today’s cybersecurity challenges. We talk about the balance of automation and human oversight, the risks and rewards of putting AI into security operations, and defense in depth strategies. Michael also covers how military style threat assessments can help with cybersecurity, how AI is evolving for threat prioritization and analysis, and the need for continuous testing and monitoring to prevent automation failures. If you want to know how to stay ahead in a complex cyber world, this episode is full of practical advice.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[01:06] Michael has been with Swimlane for about 7 years mainly focusing on larger enterprises, government clients, and partners. He's helping with the automation journey and experience. He also built security programs for other companies and was a Marine.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[02:07] Prior to the Marines, he did IT and network security. Michael is originally from Sweden.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[04:22] Operational risk management or conducting a limited threat assessment. He's always thinking like a hacker and looking for gaps in security.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[06:29] Michael tells a story about his wife's recent experience with a cybersecurity scam.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:11] How a company decides what level of friction is appropriate to implement proper security.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:59] Michael talks about balancing what is and isn’t automated.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:16] Michael shares the story about his early days of automation.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:23] Continuously review and monitor your automations.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:41] Starting with documentation is a good first step.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:45] Michael talks about how awesome it is being able to work in security and automation and help businesses grow and achieve outcomes. He believes in automating the mundane tasks.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:26] We learn about AI being involved in the defensive side of cybersecurity. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:50] AI can also bridge the gap between the security team and non-technical people.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:33] We discuss places where AI probably shouldn't be used.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:58] Find where AI works for you and then think about incorporating it in your security services.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:01] The importance of having controls in place when using AI whether it's for security or data analysis.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:00] Risk can be reduced by training on specific tasks.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:18] Michael shares the value of mixing human and artificial intelligence through Swimlane. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:08] The importance of bridging gaps and getting rid of silos.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://swimlane.com/leadership/michael-lyborg/">Michael Lyborg on Swimlane</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/michael-lyborg/">Michael Lyborg on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Cybersecurity Training from Boring to Engaging With Howard Goodman</title>
			<itunes:title>Cybersecurity Training from Boring to Engaging With Howard Goodman</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 29 Jan 2025 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[dfed991b-f594-4531-b6c6-640759b3f0f8]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/256]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">The landscape of cybersecurity training and collaboration is changing, interactive education sessions and cross team communication is key. Building a security culture and staying ahead of the modern threats has never been more important. Today’s guest is Howard Goodman, Senior Technical Director at Skybox Security.</p> <p dir="ltr">With over 20 years of experience Howard has become a well known figure in the cybersecurity world, he combines strategic planning with hands-on application across many industries. In this episode we talk about; security culture, the evolution of cybersecurity training and how Howard got phished during COVID. We also cover organisational challenges, best practices and the future of cybersecurity.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[00:48] Howard has a doctorate in cyber operations from Dakota State University. Besides working for Skybox Security, he's also an adjunct professor teaching graduate courses about cyber security.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[01:48] Howard shares a phishing experience when he and his wife were selling on eBay during COVID.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[03:34] If the pros can fall for something, regular people can too. We need to be on our game 100% of the time.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[04:53] We talk about opportunities for adversaries to get in when companies have large cybersecurity teams with a lot of moving parts.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[05:29] A lot of people ignore phishing attempts instead of reporting them. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[06:04] It comes down to organizations training their people properly. Cyber security training is becoming more interesting, because the boring stuff just doesn't hold people's attention. </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:13] When talking about threats, they focus on the exposure side and the exploitability side. With most businesses, functionality comes before security.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:47] Formal testing is required before upgrading security patches to make sure that they don't break down the whole system.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:47] The importance of being able to leverage other security controls while testing patches. Teams need to be able to communicate and act fast.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:52] Knowing about potential risk is the only way to be proactive.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:36] Looking at costs and gaps in technology. Failures are often due to a breakdown in communication.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:33] The approach of starting out security first.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:08] Best practices include cross-training. Working together and training together. Organizations need to run simulations and see how they react as an organization.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:06] Skybox talks to organizations about gaps in security.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:57] We discuss the loss that can happen from not having proper security measures in place.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.skyboxsecurity.com/author/dr-howard-goodman/">Dr. Howard Goodman - Skybox Security</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/howardbgoodman/">Dr. Howard Goodman on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Next-Gen Account Security with Christiaan Brand</title>
			<itunes:title>Next-Gen Account Security with Christiaan Brand</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 22 Jan 2025 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[ae8911c6-0d08-4217-a276-73f6466bb67f]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/255]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">With phishing and password breaches on the rise, passkeys could offer a more secure, user-friendly solution that could reshape how we protect our online identities. Today's guest is Christiaan Brand. Christiaan is the co-founder of Entersekt, a financial services security firm and a key player at Google in their security and identity teams. </p> <p dir="ltr">A respected voice in cybersecurity, Christian co-chairs the FIDO2 technical working group focusing on standardizing robust online security protocols in advancing the use of passkeys. He has been at the forefront of the shift toward more secure, password-free systems. We’ll hear his insights on the challenges and opportunities of implementing passkeys to create safer online environments for users and organizations.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[00:52] - Christiaan is part of the security team for Google accounts. He's been with Google for 9 years. Prior to that he had a startup.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[01:30] - He joined the FIDO Alliance around the same time Google joined in 2013. When he joined Google, he was able to continue with the same type of work.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[02:35] - Each of the big tech companies represents a portion of the market when it comes to how we interact with the web and apps.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[04:06] - He became interested in security when he started thinking about what could go wrong with new technology solutions. He wanted users to be able to access their financial information in a safe and secure way.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[05:06] - 2FA began gaining traction with Google in 2011. It coincided with the launch of Google Authenticator. 2FA was also used by a gaming company.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[07:54] - Usability is important, that's why having an app that displays the codes was one of the first forays into making the technology more accessible.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[08:34] - Passkeys allow us to move beyond passwords, leaving the extra hassle of traditional multi-factor authentication behind.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:05] - Key fobs were one of the earlier ways to try and bring usability to security. Now the technology is being moved to smartphones.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:33] - Passkeys are a replacement for a password manager.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:35] - Passkeys are extremely long and asymmetric in nature. You and the site you're going to both have the passkey.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:27] - The service will have the public part of the passkey, and you'll have the private part. Even if the public part leaks out, your passkey will still be secure. Passkeys can never be revealed to phishing sites.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:47] - FIDO brings the second authentication step in. The service also has to identify themselves.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:04] - Password managers try to balance security and convenience. Logging in or accessing a passkey is a unique challenge for providers.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:20] - Phone numbers are a way to get users back into their accounts.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:19] - Single device users have extra challenges.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:08] - There are pros and cons to external sources of identity.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:44] - The FIDO website has many certified solutions.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:21] - To get passkeys into daily users' lives, we need to start using them on daily applications where we log in frequently.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:49] - Hopefully this passkey solution will stand the test of time.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:34] - Attacks are beginning to shift to session hijacking.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:24] - DBSC or device-based session credentials is a new standard parallel to FIDO.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/christiaan.brand/">Christiaan Brand on Facebook</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://fidoalliance.org/">FIDO2 Technical Working Group</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.google.com/account/about/passkeys/">Learn More About Passkeys</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://passkeys.dev/">Passkeys.Dev</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://passkeys.dev/">FIDO Alliance Passkeys</a></li> </ul>]]></description>
			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">With phishing and password breaches on the rise, passkeys could offer a more secure, user-friendly solution that could reshape how we protect our online identities. Today's guest is Christiaan Brand. Christiaan is the co-founder of Entersekt, a financial services security firm and a key player at Google in their security and identity teams. </p> <p dir="ltr">A respected voice in cybersecurity, Christian co-chairs the FIDO2 technical working group focusing on standardizing robust online security protocols in advancing the use of passkeys. He has been at the forefront of the shift toward more secure, password-free systems. We’ll hear his insights on the challenges and opportunities of implementing passkeys to create safer online environments for users and organizations.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[00:52] - Christiaan is part of the security team for Google accounts. He's been with Google for 9 years. Prior to that he had a startup.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[01:30] - He joined the FIDO Alliance around the same time Google joined in 2013. When he joined Google, he was able to continue with the same type of work.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[02:35] - Each of the big tech companies represents a portion of the market when it comes to how we interact with the web and apps.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[04:06] - He became interested in security when he started thinking about what could go wrong with new technology solutions. He wanted users to be able to access their financial information in a safe and secure way.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[05:06] - 2FA began gaining traction with Google in 2011. It coincided with the launch of Google Authenticator. 2FA was also used by a gaming company.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[07:54] - Usability is important, that's why having an app that displays the codes was one of the first forays into making the technology more accessible.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[08:34] - Passkeys allow us to move beyond passwords, leaving the extra hassle of traditional multi-factor authentication behind.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:05] - Key fobs were one of the earlier ways to try and bring usability to security. Now the technology is being moved to smartphones.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:33] - Passkeys are a replacement for a password manager.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:35] - Passkeys are extremely long and asymmetric in nature. You and the site you're going to both have the passkey.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:27] - The service will have the public part of the passkey, and you'll have the private part. Even if the public part leaks out, your passkey will still be secure. Passkeys can never be revealed to phishing sites.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:47] - FIDO brings the second authentication step in. The service also has to identify themselves.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:04] - Password managers try to balance security and convenience. Logging in or accessing a passkey is a unique challenge for providers.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:20] - Phone numbers are a way to get users back into their accounts.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:19] - Single device users have extra challenges.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:08] - There are pros and cons to external sources of identity.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:44] - The FIDO website has many certified solutions.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:21] - To get passkeys into daily users' lives, we need to start using them on daily applications where we log in frequently.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:49] - Hopefully this passkey solution will stand the test of time.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:34] - Attacks are beginning to shift to session hijacking.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:24] - DBSC or device-based session credentials is a new standard parallel to FIDO.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" 			<title>5 Key Cybersecurity Elements with Kelly Hood</title>
			<itunes:title>5 Key Cybersecurity Elements with Kelly Hood</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 15 Jan 2025 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[2fa55956-36cf-401f-89d0-c8e173fd0e49]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/254]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">How do phishing scams, AI-powered attacks, and strategic governance intersect? Together, they're redefining the future of cybersecurity. Organizations are navigating a mix of challenges and implementing innovative solutions to proactively address today's threats. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today's guest is Kelly Hood. She is the EVP and cybersecurity engineer at Optics Cyber Solutions. She is a CISSP who specializes in implementing cybersecurity and privacy best practices to manage risks and to achieve compliance. She supports the NIST cybersecurity framework and serves as a CMMC registered practitioner, helping organizations strengthen their cybersecurity posture and develop effective risk management strategies.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[01:06] - Kelly is a cyber security engineer at Optic Cyber Solutions. It's her job to help companies protect themselves.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[02:17] - Don't be embarrassed if you fall for a phishing scam.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[03:01] - These attempts are getting more realistic. Kelly shares how she was briefly fooled by a phishing scam that looks like an email from her mother.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[05:25] - The NIST Cybersecurity Framework is a voluntary framework for defining cybersecurity. An update was put out in February of 2024. They also added a new function.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[06:01] - The five functions that organize a cybersecurity program have been to identify, protect, detect, respond, and recover. They recently added the govern function.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[06:38] - The govern function is about defining your business objective and then putting protections in place that makes sense for those objectives.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[09:01] - The identify function is focused on knowing what we have.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[09:40] - Protect includes everything from identity management, authentication, training, data security, and platform security.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:12] - Detect is looking at what's happening around us. It's continuous monitoring and knowing what happens if something goes wrong.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:00] - Respond is knowing what the plan is when something does happen.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:01] - Recover is about getting back to normal after something happens.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:22] - Data centers want to make sure that they have redundant power supplies.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:33] - We discuss some of the things that people might forget when identifying cybersecurity assets. Data and people need to be thought about as well as systems and hardware.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:00] - We need to write things down and understand what systems and data connections we have.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:10] - We talk about the importance of being aware of the physical space and who is actually supposed to be there.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:46] - Data is one of the assets that often gets overlooked for protection. There are many new requirements that require data to be protected.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:54] - Monitoring to understand what traffic you should expect and what is and isn't normal activity is also important.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:10] - Transparency and communication are paramount for creating trust.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:51] - Sometimes recovery doesn't mean 100%. Get up and running and prioritize the systems that matter most.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:56] - With governance, you really want to look at what you're trying to do with the business and then translate cybersecurity to fit that objective.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:27] - Have guidance documentation in place and have oversight.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.opticcyber.com/about-us.html">Optic Cyber Solutions</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://43828014.hs-sites.com/nist-cybersecurity-framework-2.0-do-i-measure-up"> (MaPT) Maturity and Progress Tracker</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/opticcyber/">Optic Cyber Solutions on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClMHL6zKvbcFHNB1YeiraMQ">Optic Cyber YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework">NIST Cybersecurity Framework</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Identity Crimes (Theft, Compromise &amp; Misuse) with Mona Terry</title>
			<itunes:title>Identity Crimes (Theft, Compromise &amp; Misuse) with Mona Terry</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jan 2025 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[198877df-9fb1-4b4f-b48c-255e56465b5c]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/253]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">When you search for customer service numbers online, you might come across a scammer’s number instead. It’s important to be cautious when sharing personal information, and to verify identities before responding to requests for sensitive data. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Mona Terry. As Chief Victims Officer at Identity Theft Resource Center, she navigates the complexities of identity protection and identity crime recovery and management of multi-million dollar federal grants. She analyzes victim experiences to create ITRC’s Identity Report and to provide information about new and ongoing trends in identity crimes.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:55] - Mona describes her role as Chief Victims Officer at Identity Theft Resource Center and how she found herself in this job.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:18] - Identity crimes include theft, compromise, and misuse. What’s the difference?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:26] - The number one recorded compromise is through scams, where people give their information to someone else.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:30] - It is also becoming more common for someone to search for a customer service number and come across a scammer’s number instead.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:01] - Some of the strategies in detecting fake websites are not helpful any longer with scammers using AI tools to make things look more legitimate.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:10] - Misuse is when someone else takes over your account and is making charges or establishing new accounts in your name.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:41] - Account takeovers don't only include credit cards. Social media account takeovers can be just as dangerous and more common.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:28] - Identity theft is what it sounds like—stealing information with the intent to misuse it.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:24] - If you suspect something is compromised, Mona recommends freezing your credit account.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:45] - Freezing your account and checking credit reports is easier than it used to be.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:32] - Mona describes how the Identity Theft Resource Center walks victims through the steps in resolving problems.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:23] - Some situations are harder to resolve than others.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:51] - Team members at Identity Theft Resource Center are not therapists, but they are trauma informed and listen to victims as they are guided through a process.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:27] - When working with the Identity Theft Resource Center, clients get a recovery plan.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:08] - If victims have tried something or don’t feel comfortable with something, ITRC can step in and help.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:50] - Don’t be afraid to check for problems. Sometimes problems don’t show themselves immediately.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.idtheftcenter.org/">Identity Theft Resource Center Website</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

Sometimes problems don’t show themselves immediately.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>Why Resolutions Fail with Dr. Leslie Becker-Phelps</title>
			<itunes:title>Why Resolutions Fail with Dr. Leslie Becker-Phelps</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 01 Jan 2025 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c475847c-4e3b-4301-a2cd-845f5b66148c]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/252]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">We often put off changes and schedule them to start on January 1st. Many of these idealistic resolutions fail shortly after beginning, so it is important to be thoughtful when planning so that you can set yourself up for success.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Dr. Leslie Becker-Phelps. Leslie is a noted psychologist who authored a number of books, including Insecure in Love, The Insecure in Love Workbook, and Bouncing Back from Rejection. She writes the Authentically You Blog and the Psychology Today Making Change Blog. Additionally, she is a national speaker and hosts a YouTube channel.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:00] - Leslie describes what she does in her career as a psychologist and author.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:32] - Throughout her work, Leslie continued to go back to the question, “What makes it so hard for some people to change?”</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:47] - There’s nothing wrong with New Year's Resolutions. But waiting to start making a change till a specific day is not effective.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:02] - You can feel good about yourself and recognize that change is good to move towards.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:23] - When people are insecurely attached, they have a negative sense of self. What is driving them forward is negativity.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:58] - It takes a lot of work to be able to be compassionate with yourself.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:49] - Leslie discusses some small changes she made for herself that allowed her to be consistent.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:04] - Leslie explains the Michelangelo Effect.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:47] - Relationships you are in have an impact on your self-esteem.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:02] - Just because it feels true, doesn’t mean it is true.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:17] - Adding in the word “yet” gives us an idea of a future that will be different.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:24] - Setbacks will happen, but they are not failures.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:18] - You have to be persistent in making changes you want to make.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:47] - If you can’t seem to make a change, you have to get into the micro parts of yourself and find out why.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:32] - Leslie suggests making different levels of goals.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:15] - Prepare yourself for good days and bad days. How can you support yourself on a down day?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:10] - When you are having really good days, you can clearly remember the days you struggle. Write a letter to your future self on a down day.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.drbecker-phelps.com/">Dr. Leslie Becker-Phelps Website</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/c/LeslieBeckerPhelpsPhD">Dr. Leslie Becker-Phelps on YouTube</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Erasing Your Digital Footprint with Jeff Jockisch</title>
			<itunes:title>Erasing Your Digital Footprint with Jeff Jockisch</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 18 Dec 2024 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[313fc9c7-4274-40b8-b55c-0291f456563a]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/251]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Data is continuously being collected and this information can lead to misleading conclusions about an individual. Without proper context, behavior can be misinterpreted. This underscores the need for data privacy laws and stronger protections against data brokers.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Jeff Jockisch. Jeff is a passionate data privacy researcher dedicated to exploring the evolution of technology, our search behaviors, trust dynamics, and safeguarding of our information. As Managing Partner at ObscureIQ, he specializes in advanced data removal and privacy risk mitigation for enterprises and government organizations.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:58] - Jeff describes his career and what he does in the field at ObscureIQ.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:35] - Instead of taking his career into the compliance field, he took his expertise to the intersection of data privacy and data science.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:40] - Jeff explains what a data broker does and breaks down a recent data breach.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:40] - The legal definition of what a data broker is is very narrow.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:42] - The data that is collected by data brokers can literally be anything, like health care data, drivers licenses, and viewing habits online.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:32] - One of the worst types of data that is collected is cell phone location data.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:46] - Data tells a story, but pieces might be missing. Data can paint an inaccurate picture of someone.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:18] - Data can be interpreted in different ways.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:41] - Your digital footprint can be deleted. But in addition to deleting it, your behavior needs to change.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:50] - Apps track data automatically for ads.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:31] - All of these companies are collecting our data, but they’re not securing it.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:42] - What can someone do with collected data? The possibilities are endless.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:38] - Data that is collected can also show other people who are connected to you.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:10] - Some things can be deleted, including public records.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:09] - The problem is that the data brokers are massively powerful.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:15] - Check out the links below for resources that Jeff recommends on the steps to take in order to delete the data you are leaking.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:57] - Jeff shares an experience of almost being a victim of a scam.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:10] - Scammers sound totally reasonable in the moment, even when we reflect and feel stupid for making a decision.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li 			<title>Executive Recruiter Scams with John Sidoti</title>
			<itunes:title>Executive Recruiter Scams with John Sidoti</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 Dec 2024 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f2b585ee-6269-42c2-8be1-0a34ee83d1f8]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/250]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">When a recruiter contacts you, it’s essential to do your homework, verify their sources, and trust your instincts. If something seems too good to be true, it probably is. While it can be frustrating to be this skeptical, being cautious can protect you and your finances. Today’s guest is John Sidoti. John is the Senior Director of Information Technology at Social Current. But take the extra step and research the company and individual.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:57] - In the grand scheme of things, the people who have been victimized by these types of scams are vulnerable and desperate for employment.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:22] - Anyone can purchase a domain name and pull together a website using a free or cheap template that all look very legitimate.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:05] - Once you know the markers, you can see them coming.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:07] - Look at the domain names and how long they have been registered.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:30] - Don’t assume it is just an email world. 			<title>Human Hacking with Peter Warmka</title>
			<itunes:title>Human Hacking with Peter Warmka</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 04 Dec 2024 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[2342ff0b-1d16-44f0-b5a3-d3d6323388a0]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/249]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Today’s threat actors and social engineers leverage social media to observe individuals’ patterns and habits. They encounter you at a coffee shop or another familiar spot. They begin to establish trust, which makes you more susceptible to their tactics. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Peter Warmka. Peter is a retired CIA officer with over two decades of breaching the security of organizations overseas in pursuit of intelligence. He is the founder of The Counterintelligence Institute, author of two books, conference speaker, consultant, and educator on the dangers of human hacking.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:56] - Peter shares his background and what he has done in his interesting career.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:27] - The Counterintelligence Institute helps organizations and individuals understand what types of information threat actors are trying to steal.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:08] - Peter discusses the surprise his friends and family experienced when learning he had been working for the CIA.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:13] - There are some skills that Peter had to learn when going into this career, but other skills came more naturally.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:15] - Trust is different in various societies, and Americans are particularly vulnerable.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:31] - Peter explains how he developed trust with others.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:00] - There are ways to leverage trust in this type of work.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:32] - Peter discusses international breaches and the types of intelligence breaches from other governments.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:11] - The internet has made information so readily available to everyone, including information you may not want them to have.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:19] - There are different types of information found on the different kinds of social media platforms that all come together to paint a whole picture.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:09] - Human hacking, or social engineering, can be accomplished through five different communication channels.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:21] - Peter describes a very powerful and common in-person scenario.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:53] - We have to get away from the silo-approach, thinking that breaches are only coming from the IT network.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:24] - Peter wrote a book in the early days of Covid-19 for organizations. He then wrote a book geared more towards individuals.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:41] - Privacy and security settings are great, but platforms can still be hacked.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:56] - It shouldn’t be “trust, then verify.” It needs to be “verify, then trust.”</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:27] - AI tools have made things even more complicated for victims and easy for threat actors.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:37] - LinkedIn specifically is overwhelmed with fake accounts.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[48:50] - Workplace education on this topic is backwards in organizations since they are seen as compliance training.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.counterintelligence-institute.com/">Counterintelligence Institute Website</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/peterwarmka/">Peter Warmka on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Digital Deception: What Lies Ahead with Perry Carpenter</title>
			<itunes:title>Digital Deception: What Lies Ahead with Perry Carpenter</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 27 Nov 2024 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[14845bc7-6f83-4f45-96f3-50ad873ee08f]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/248]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Creating habits of healthy skepticism when receiving texts or emails can prevent you from clicking on phishing links. Everybody is vulnerable online, especially when distracted or in a hurry. But cultivating critical thinking and self-awareness can enhance protection against manipulation.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Perry Carpenter. Perry is an award-winning author, podcaster, and speaker with over two decades in cybersecurity, focusing on how cyber criminals exploit human behavior. As the Chief Human Risk Management Strategist at KnowBe4, Perry helps build robust, human-centric defenses against social engineering-based threats. His latest book <em><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/FAIK-Practical-Disinformation-AI-Generated-Deceptions/dp/1394299885">FAIK: A Practical Guide to Living in a World of Deepfakes, Disinformation, and AI-Generated Deceptions</a></em>, tackles AI’s role in deception.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:02] - Perry shares his background and what his career has entailed.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:01] - Regardless of how much people say, spend, or do on security-related issues, the people side of things is hard to control.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:25] - Perry has always been interested in deception and misdirection.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:59] - Even as a security professional, Perry has experienced enough distraction to click a phishing email.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:43] - It is easier to be distracted and not follow usual healthy security habits than being on a computer.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:24] - We fall into habits easily, especially when the behavior is simple and easy.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:00] - Technology based deception is more available to anybody than in any other time in history.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:10] - Security professionals and often pushed in the roles of giving advice.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:40] - Reflection questions like “Why is this in front of me?” might prevent someone from falling victim to a scam.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:58] - Everybody is vulnerable. Even though cybersecurity professionals know more on the topic than some others, it is still possible for them as well.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:40] - Pig butchering and crypto scammers sometimes actually do send money back as a tactic to earn trust and increase hope.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:42] - We have to have a healthy skepticism of the information environment that we live in.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:39] - There are very few situations in life where you won’t benefit from slowing down and thinking things through.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:41] - Perry suggests a family activity that will help boost understanding of pressure tactics.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:17] - The narratives or tells that work for someone might raise a red flag to others.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:25] - As a society, we’ve gotten to a point where we don’t like to introspect.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[45:59] - Perry discusses the content of his most recent book and how it is information without the “easy way out”.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><em><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/FAIK-Practical-Disinformation-AI-Generated-Deceptions/dp/1394299885"> FAIK: A Practical Guide to Living in a World of Deepfakes, Disinformation, and AI-Generated Deceptions</a></em> by Perry Carpenter</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/perrycarpenter/">Perry Carpenter on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

Even though cybersecurity professionals know more on the topic than some others, it is still possible for them as well.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:40] - Pig butchering and crypto scammers sometimes actually do send money back as a tactic to earn trust and increase hope.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:42] - We have to have a healthy skepticism of the information environment that we live in.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:39] - There are very few situations in life where you won’t benefit from slowing down and thinking things through.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:41] - Perry suggests a family activity that will help boost understanding of pressure tactics.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:17] - The narratives or tells that work for someone might raise a red flag to others.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:25] - As a society, we’ve gotten to a point where we don’t like to introspect.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[45:59] - Perry discusses the content of his most recent book and how it is information without the “easy way out”.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><em><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/FAIK-Practical-Disinformation-AI-Generated-Deceptions/dp/1394299885"> FAIK: A Practical Guide to Living in a World of Deepfakes, Disinformation, and AI-Generated Deceptions</a></em> by Perry Carpenter</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/perrycarpenter/">Perry Carpenter on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Rethinking Online Anonymity with Lance Cottrell</title>
			<itunes:title>Rethinking Online Anonymity with Lance Cottrell</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 20 Nov 2024 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[e03547b1-343e-4bc1-bfc4-6efd723a8945]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/247]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">In a world of cybersecurity and online privacy, anonymity seems to be the key. VPNs are often promoted as the cure-all to our internet needs. Let’s talk about some of those misconceptions.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Lance Cottrell. Lance founded Anonymizer in 1995 and is an internationally recognized expert in cryptography, online privacy, and internet security. He is the principal author on multiple internet privacy and security technology patents. Lance stayed on as Chief Scientist as Anonymizer was acquired by Intrepid, and now advises start-ups through his platform.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:09] - Lance shares his background and how he spent the start of his career and into founding Anonymizer.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:03] - To continue destigmatizing being a victim of a scam, Lance shares his own experience as a victim himself.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:38] - In-person scammers are very believable. They learn through building a relationship the things that you want.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:47] - There are two reasons why people commit treason - revenge and justice.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:42] - Prior to founding Anonymizer, Lance had fantastic access to the internet in the early 90s and became involved in the open-source community.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:58] - Lance describes how Anonymizer did business-wise and where it capped.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:40] - There are different types of customers for Anonymizer, general consumers as well as government entities.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:30] - There were certainly times where someone would come to Anonymizer and they had done something that was really pretty dire.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:28] - Anonymizer was able to develop some new technologies that Lance describes.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:35] - If you need to trust someone, research who that someone is and understand if you can.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:11] - The biggest mistake is thinking your IP address is the important thing.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:19] - Actually achieving anonymity or pseudonymity and maintaining overtime is incredibly challenging.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:09] - Human behavior tends to give away anonymity.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:47] - People don’t think anywhere near enough on the threat model.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:58] - When are VPNs actually beneficial?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:32] - Be very specific about what you want to protect.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:05] - Obsession and trying to run your life around trying to be anonymous is not helpful.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:41] - Lance discusses some of the interesting aspects of the psychology of criminals.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:10] - Lance shares some parting advice and the basic things to do to stay protected.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/lancecottrell/">Lance Cottrell on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://lancecottrell.com/">Lance Cottrell Website</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.feeltheboot.com/">Feel the Boot - The Science of Startups</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>AI: Double-Edged Sword for Cybersecurity with Vincent LaRocca</title>
			<itunes:title>AI: Double-Edged Sword for Cybersecurity with Vincent LaRocca</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 13 Nov 2024 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c543ce52-4390-417f-8286-5d16c6d4ade5]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/246]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Cybersecurity is more crucial than ever. It’s essential that we proactively safeguard our data and recognize that no one is immune to attacks. We are all vulnerable. As malicious actors continually enhance their tactics, we must stay one step ahead by consistently improving our defenses.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Vincent LaRocca. Vincent is the CEO of CyberSecOp with the commitment to protecting sensitive data and mitigating cyber threats. With over two decades of experience, Vincent has successfully steered CyberSecOp to become one of the world’s fastest growing managed security providers, specializing in cybersecurity assessments, breach management, and risk management consulting.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:15] - Vincent shares his background and how he found himself working in cybersecurity.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:40] - Even the experts are vulnerable. Vincent shares an experience he had with fraud at his bank.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:16] - Cyber threat trends are moving to AI.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:19] - As consumers, we need to be aware of how AI is using our data and what we give it permission to have access to.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:19] - AI isn’t going anywhere. It will continue to grow and develop.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:16] - Threat actors are unfortunately usually one step ahead of defenses. They are using AI to exploit vulnerabilities.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:54] - AI gives threat actors even more reach. The number of incidents and scams are extremely high and will multiply.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:59] - Small organizations and business owners are hit pretty hard by breaches since they often do not have a cybersecurity team.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:09] - Vincent shares some of the traits and qualifications that are good to look for in cybersecurity professionals for small businesses.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:07] - Defenses are built against things that we know about, not things we don’t know about.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:27] - There are things that can be done that are free or more cost-effective.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:40] - There’s no point in putting a fancy lock on the front door if there’s nothing protecting the back door.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:06] - Even if an organization has invested in cybersecurity and knows how to keep data safe, if their partners or vendors do not, it means very little.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:31] - There are so many breaches that have happened that we don’t even know about and our data is out there mixed in with so much more.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:31] - We are a part of an AI revolution currently and the landscape of AI will be completely different in just a few years.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:58] - The tools for cybersecurity, including machine learning, are improving every day as well.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:09] - Don’t turn a blind eye and assume you can’t afford protection.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/vincentjlarocca/">Vincent LaRocca on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://cybersecop.com/">CyberSecOp Website</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Understanding and Avoiding Triangulation Fraud with Soups Ranjan</title>
			<itunes:title>Understanding and Avoiding Triangulation Fraud with Soups Ranjan</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 06 Nov 2024 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[18705d13-06dd-4488-bcdf-28eee907be98]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/245]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">As consumers, we may realize the need to be vigilant by using two-factor authentication and password managers, but there are so many scams out there that can impersonate legitimate organizations, websites, and people. We really can’t let our guard down.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Soups Ranjan. Soups has over 18 years of experience in software engineering, data science, and risk management. He is the co-founder and CEO of Sardine. This behavior-infused platform offers fraud prevention, compliance, and payment solutions for various industries including banking, online marketplaces, FinTech, crypto, online gaming, and gift card exchanges.
