			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Some scammers love the challenge of deceiving those they target while others are forced to scam. Those that thrive off of destroying others try to heighten your emotions very quickly. Both excited and angry responses can get you into making irrational decisions. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Doug Shadel. Doug is a former fraud investigator and special assistant to the Attorney General at the Washington State Attorney General’s office. He served as state director for AARP Washington and Strategy Director for AARP’s national anti-fraud efforts. Doug has collaborated on numerous educational videos and academic studies and co-authored five books about fraud. He also co-authored the AARP Fraud Frontier 2021 Report. He is currently Managing Director of Fraud Prevention Strategies LLC, a Seattle-based consulting firm.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:08] - Doug shares his background and career in fighting fraud.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:43] - Robo-calls have been a long lasting problem that Doug has been working on with AARP and Nomorobo.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:11] - Over the years, Doug has interviewed numerous scammers. They all say their primary goal is to get a victim in a heightened emotional state.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:07] - Doug describes the research that shows when people are in a heightened emotional state, they are more likely to fall victim to a scam.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:57] - Block the incoming robocalls to begin with to help avoid a scammer manipulating you into a heightened emotional state.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:17] - It still is very dangerous to answer these phone calls because a lot of them are really persuasive and really good at what they do.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:34] - There isn’t a specific demographic profile. Doug explains what people who fall victim to a scam have in common.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:49] - The FCC has come down hard on robocallers, but this has just caused scammers to be more careful and even more skilled.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:09] - Have you recently received calls asking for a donation? Doug describes how these work.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:12] - The number one red flag of a robocall is the threat of loss.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:22] - Caller ID is not reliable. It is very common and easy for scammers to spoof a call.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:48] - There are some legitimate needs for people to be able to spoof a call.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:42] - Assume it is a scam if you did not initiate the contact.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:08] - By and large, scammers will not cause violence on a victim, even if they threaten them. They follow the path of least resistance.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:02] - Doug describes some software he uses to edit videos that incorporates AI. These tools are great, but are also used by scammers.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:26] - Grandparent scams are really common. Doug describes what people have said after falling victim.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:40] - There is an illusion of invulnerability. If you are convinced that you are not vulnerable to something, you won’t do anything to prevent it.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:04] - There’s a lot more money for scammers to make in scamming an employee of a large company than individuals.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:10] - The pandemic also had a big impact on the scamming industry.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[50:50] - The AARP Fraud Watch Network Helpline is 1-877-908-3360.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[53:00] - Always report a scam when you know of one. It helps more than you know.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Educating Teens About Technology is Necessary with Clayton Cranford</title>
			<itunes:title>Educating Teens About Technology is Necessary with Clayton Cranford</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 10 Jul 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[66904708-6ea3-437a-be71-aabf60e71007]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/228]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Please stop yourself from saying, “This could never happen to me or my family.” We can all have vulnerable blindspots when it comes to those we love being exploited or endangered. Even the best trained educators can be manipulated into making a mistake.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Clayton Cranford. Clayton is the founder of Cyber Safety Cop. He is a retired sergeant from the Orange County Sheriff's Department who served as a school resource officer, juvenile investigator, and behavioral threat assessor. He is one of the nation’s leading law enforcement educators on social media, child safety, teen drug abuse prevention, and behavioral threat assessments. He is the author of the definitive parent guide to online safety, <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Parenting-Digital-World-Step-Step/dp/B08ZW6KPRH/?_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_w=fNNQa&content-id=amzn1.sym.f911c8db-3a2b-4b3e-952f-b80fdcee83f4&pf_rd_p=f911c8db-3a2b-4b3e-952f-b80fdcee83f4&pf_rd_r=134-3829439-2067154&pd_rd_wg=AvHm5&pd_rd_r=facae4c4-0e7b-4fed-9364-fcef370299e7&ref_=aufs_ap_sc_dsk">Parenting in a Digital World</a>.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:10] - Clayton shares his background as a school resource officer in 2012, which was the year that saw the adoption of smartphones by teens.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:48] - It all amounts to a simple and common narrative: a good kid made a bad choice and a parent who had no idea what was going on.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:08] - The turning point in Clayton’s career was his first day as a school resource officer.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:14] - There are things that parents can do to absolutely make a difference.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:20] - Technology has changed our kids, particularly their mental health.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:06] - Schools and counselors are alarmed at the number of children who are struggling with anxiety and depression.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:50] - Clayton shares some of the data that shows an increase in depression and suicidal ideation in teens.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:40] - Parents could come together to make real change, but oftentimes, parents don’t often make a change until it's too late.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:51] - A lot of parents are using devices to help their kids regulate their emotions.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:06] - Boys tend to lean more into video games, but girls tend to spend more time on social media. There are differences in the effect on their brains.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:52] - When it comes to friends, teens have gone from quality to quantity.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:02] - Every new generation that is now exposed to social media from the time they are born are experiencing severe mental health concerns.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:03] - Parenting styles have changed through each generation.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:03] - Why are parents giving their children phones so young?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:41] - Clayton says not to give your child a smartphone until high school.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:48] - There are apps that you can put on your child’s phone that will help regulate screen time.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:45] - Clayton discourages parents from putting technology, particularly mobile devices in your child’s bedroom.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:49] - Parenting in a digital world is more about how to talk to your children than telling them what they should and shouldn't do.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:16] - Snapchat is an especially big problem. How can we have this conversation?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:51] - The number 1 app that puts drugs in a child’s hands is Snapchat.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[45:50] - Your relationship with your child is important, but you need to be aware of what each app can do and what it can lead to.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:10] - Parents are saying that they are glad they didn’t have the internet when they were growing up.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:02] - Interacting online takes away the sense of consequence that we feel when we interact in person.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[52:10] - The way kids think is normal. But they don’t understand the consequences of their online behavior.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://cybersafetycop.com/">Cyber Safety Cop Website</a></li> <li><strong id= "docs-internal-guid-e13d38ee-7fff-06a6-f598-82d8a9219096"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Parenting-Digital-World-Step-Step/dp/B08ZW6KPRH/?_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_w=fNNQa&content-id=amzn1.sym.f911c8db-3a2b-4b3e-952f-b80fdcee83f4&pf_rd_p=f911c8db-3a2b-4b3e-952f-b80fdcee83f4&pf_rd_r=134-3829439-2067154&pd_rd_wg=AvHm5&pd_rd_r=facae4c4-0e7b-4fed-9364-fcef370299e7&ref_=aufs_ap_sc_dsk"> Parenting in a Digital World by Clayton Cranford</a></strong></li> </ul>]]></description>

Even the best trained educators can be manipulated into making a mistake.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Clayton Cranford. Clayton is the founder of Cyber Safety Cop. He is a retired sergeant from the Orange County Sheriff's Department who served as a school resource officer, juvenile investigator, and behavioral threat assessor. He is one of the nation’s leading law enforcement educators on social media, child safety, teen drug abuse prevention, and behavioral threat assessments. He is the author of the definitive parent guide to online safety, <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Parenting-Digital-World-Step-Step/dp/B08ZW6KPRH/?_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_w=fNNQa&content-id=amzn1.sym.f911c8db-3a2b-4b3e-952f-b80fdcee83f4&pf_rd_p=f911c8db-3a2b-4b3e-952f-b80fdcee83f4&pf_rd_r=134-3829439-2067154&pd_rd_wg=AvHm5&pd_rd_r=facae4c4-0e7b-4fed-9364-fcef370299e7&ref_=aufs_ap_sc_dsk">Parenting in a Digital World</a>.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:10] - Clayton shares his background as a school resource officer in 2012, which was the year that saw the adoption of smartphones by teens.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:48] - It all amounts to a simple and common narrative: a good kid made a bad choice and a parent who had no idea what was going on.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:08] - The turning point in Clayton’s career was his first day as a school resource officer.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:14] - There are things that parents can do to absolutely make a difference.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:20] - Technology has changed our kids, particularly their mental health.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:06] - Schools and counselors are alarmed at the number of children who are struggling with anxiety and depression.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:50] - Clayton shares some of the data that shows an increase in depression and suicidal ideation in teens.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:40] - Parents could come together to make real change, but oftentimes, parents don’t often make a change until it's too late.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:51] - A lot of parents are using devices to help their kids regulate their emotions.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:06] - Boys tend to lean more into video games, but girls tend to spend more time on social media. There are differences in the effect on their brains.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:52] - When it comes to friends, teens have gone from quality to quantity.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:02] - Every new generation that is now exposed to social media from the time they are born are experiencing severe mental health concerns.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:03] - Parenting styles have changed through each generation.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:03] - Why are parents giving their children phones so young?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:41] - Clayton says not to give your child a smartphone until high school.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:48] - There are apps that you can put on your child’s phone that will help regulate screen time.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:45] - Clayton discourages parents from putting technology, particularly mobile devices in your child’s bedroom.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:49] - Parenting in a digital world is more about how to talk to your children than telling them what they should and shouldn't do.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:16] - Snapchat is an especially big problem. How can we have this conversation?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:51] - The number 1 app that puts drugs in a child’s hands is Snapchat.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[45:50] - Your relationship with your child is important, but you need to be aware of what each app can do and what it can lead to.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:10] - Parents are saying that they are glad they didn’t have the internet when they were growing up.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:02] - Interacting online takes away the sense of consequence that we feel when we interact in person.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[52:10] - The way kids think is normal. But they don’t understand the consequences of their online behavior.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://cybersafetycop.com/">Cyber Safety Cop Website</a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Parenting-Digital-World-Step-Step/dp/B08ZW6KPRH/?_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_w=fNNQa&content-id=amzn1.sym.f911c8db-3a2b-4b3e-952f-b80fdcee83f4&pf_rd_p=f911c8db-3a2b-4b3e-952f-b80fdcee83f4&pf_rd_r=134-3829439-2067154&pd_rd_wg=AvHm5&pd_rd_r=facae4c4-0e7b-4fed-9364-fcef370299e7&ref_=aufs_ap_sc_dsk"> Parenting in a Digital World by Clayton Cranford</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Protecting Financial Accounts From Scams and Fraud with John Buzzard</title>
			<itunes:title>Protecting Financial Accounts From Scams and Fraud with John Buzzard</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 03 Jul 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[910cc361-53c5-4935-85af-a6b401902ea5]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/227]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Thieves used to rob banks and steal physical money, but in a digital world, it is much easier to sit behind a keyboard and deceive you into giving it to them. Fortunately, there are specific things you can do to protect your finances before scammers get into your accounts.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is John Buzzard. John is a nationally recognized financial industry fraud expert who has delivered significant influence in credit card fraud, risk, and security services for financial institutions throughout the United States. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:56] - John shares his background and what he does currently in the financial industry fraud space.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:31] - Everything old is new again. Things come back in a cyclical fashion but have a new digital spin.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:49] - There’s a price to pay for convenience especially if we don’t keep an eye on things and be aware of what can go wrong.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:19] - Be conscious of where you bank and make purchases.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:46] - Set up alerts so any activity in your bank accounts, including deposits, is made known.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:34] - There are different viewpoints on freezing your credit.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:15] - There are some capabilities in apps that can block certain types of activity.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:35] - During and post-Covid, we have gotten into a “tap and go” contactless experience when making purchases.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:20] - New payment techniques are safe. John discusses Apple Pay as something secure that he likes to use for safety and convenience.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:40] - John explains card chips and what happens when they aren’t working.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:59] - If there is fraud, it is handled differently if it is a chip transaction or a mag swipe.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:01] - John shares an experience in wanting to create a new PIN for an account.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:39] - What shouldn’t you share on social media to help prevent scams and fraud?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:54] - When you have a complete stranger reaching out to you, no matter how they do it, they’re job is to get you disturbed and upset so that you react.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:24] - Speaking in passcodes and passphrases is totally acceptable. That is often the thing a criminal does not have, even if they have your password.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:16] - From a resolution standpoint, when you go to your financial services provider, as a consumer you do have rights.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/john-buzzard-8367547/">John Buzzard on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>AI: Doomsday vs. A Very Bad Day with Dr. Robert Blumofe</title>
			<itunes:title>AI: Doomsday vs. A Very Bad Day with Dr. Robert Blumofe</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 26 Jun 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c6cd01a9-ce2e-476b-836e-5ab37f8bb1ad]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/226]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">After a data breach, many criminals are beginning to use deep learning AI to categorize the information they have stolen. They’re using a steady amount of micro attacks on individuals and businesses and not just full-scale assaults.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Robert Blumofe. Bobby joined Akamai in 1999 to lead the company’s first performance team. While serving as one of Akamai’s chief architects, he was instrumental in the design and development of their intelligent edge platform which now handles trillions of internet requests daily. Bobby’s technical past lends itself to a passion in machine learning and AI and he holds a PhD in Computer Science from MIT.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:02] - Bobby shares his background and current role at Akamai.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:32] - When he joined the company in 1999, he didn’t really know what Akamai did.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:29] - Customers recognized that Akamai could have the capabilities to see all the traffic to their websites and potentially block attacks.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:02] - Machine learning is really remarkable. Akamai has been using deep learning as a tool to solve problems for their security products.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:25] - AI has become a big part of everything we do.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:35] - The quantity and quality of the data used by AI is what differentiates the machine learning and models of an enterprise.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:36] - Bobby discusses what the next five years could look like for cyber criminals.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:24] - Criminals only need one success out of thousands or millions of targets.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:32] - Social media platforms really do want to do the right thing but there’s only so much they can do.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:39] - As a consumer, you have to be on guard and not necessarily trust where information is coming from.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:42] - Any new significant development in technology is hard to differentiate from magic, especially in the early days of development.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:04] - Machine learning is remarkable and as a technologist, Bobby wants to love it. But there are so many examples of misuse.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:29] - Use the technology, but check the output.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:10] - When solving a simple problem, does the AI really need to know everything? They access so much data that isn’t useful.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:19] - Just because an entity can carry on a conversation, doesn’t mean it has authoritative knowledge.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:04] - What is zero trust?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:51] - A misconception is that AI will take over and plan like sci-fi movies.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:11] - You need to have all the checks and balances in critical areas.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:07] - Leadership in organizations needs to prioritize efforts and be very involved.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:52] - We need to assume that AI will continue to develop and criminals will continue misusing the technology in new ways.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:23] - The changes and advances have been so fast recently, that we may need the opportunity to pause.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.akamai.com/">Akamai Website</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/robert-blumofe-258233/">Robert Blumofe on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Preventing SIM Swapping Scams with Mark Kreitzman</title>
			<itunes:title>Preventing SIM Swapping Scams with Mark Kreitzman</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 19 Jun 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[94e0bf01-0397-4b0e-813c-74174e6e06d6]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/preventing-sim-swapping-scams-with-mark-kreitzman]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">AI search tools are being used by criminals to sort through data breaches and data dumps they’ve stolen to target as many individuals as possible. After your phone has been swapped, they’ll have the ability to access all your SMS messages and phone calls. But there are precautions you can take. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Mark Kreitzman. Mark is a seasoned cybersecurity expert with over 20 years of experience in building cybersecurity companies. Mark brings insights into evolving threats facing mobile security and data privacy. His expertise in our increasingly mobile world makes him a valuable resource in discussing how to mitigate your risks as it pertains to mobile communications.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:02] - Mark shares his background in cybersecurity and what he does now in his career.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:08] - In 2017, Mark experienced a SIM swap scam.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:30] - He used his anger and paranoia to help develop Efani, a cybersecurity focused mobile service.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:51] - When you get SIM swapped and the carrier recognizes that you’ve been attacked, they go into liability protection mode.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:16] - Mark shares some of the details of what happened in his experience and explains that he still doesn’t know if he was specifically targeted.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:00] - Through fraud, scammers can actually become resellers.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:27] - SIM swapping started as a way to target and harass celebrities.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:52] - Once scammers have information, they can get into many different accounts because people tend to use the same passwords.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:14] - Everybody’s information is floating out there. Data breaches give scammers and fraudsters access to so much.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:19] - Mark describes what you will see on your phone from your end when a SIM swap scam has occurred.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:42] - Efani is a mobile service provider. Mark explains how they are different.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:28] - With a $5 million insurance policy, Efani does everything possible to protect it.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:54] - Efani is extremely busy because there are so many cases of this problem.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:07] - When you give a carrier your social security number to open an account, you are essentially opening a credit account.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:58] - Unfortunately, many people don’t know about this type of scam. It is a silently growing trend.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:08] - With Efani, mobile carriers are never given a customer’s information.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[45:45] - Mark tends to live on the paranoid side after being a victim of this type of scam. He shares what he does when he travels.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:05] - Using a VPN while traveling is a great idea to help protect yourself.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[51:44] - Right now, Efani has a promo code you can use for your plan just for Easy Prey listeners: <a href= "http://efani.com/EasyPrey">Efani.com/EasyPrey</a> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.efani.com/">Efani Website</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "http://efani.com/EasyPrey">Efani.com/EasyPrey</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>The Problem with Not Reporting Scams with Kathy Stokes</title>
			<itunes:title>The Problem with Not Reporting Scams with Kathy Stokes</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 12 Jun 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[62b32a17-72ea-496a-80a1-d01b19546058]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/224]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Many assume that scammers just target the more mature in age, but they go after everyone. Younger people who may have been manipulated may not have the same amount of money to lose, but that doesn’t mean they aren’t being targeted. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Kathy Stokes. Kathy is the Director of Fraud Prevention Programs with AARP. She leads the AARP social mission work to educate older adults on the risks that fraud represents to their financial security. She currently serves on the advisory council to the Board of International Association of Financial Crimes Investigators and on the advisory council to the Senior Issues Committee of the North American Securities Administrators Association.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:02] - Kathy shares her background, what she does at AARP, and what AARP actually is.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:50] - AARP has had a Fraud Watch Network for a while, but its current form is different from years past.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:29] - There is a concerted effort to bring the generations together to educate others in the community.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:26] - It is a common misconception that older people are targeted more often than other age groups.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:38] - The biggest barrier is something that is beginning to break down. It’s the shame and victim blaming. We are at a turning point.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:50] - Unfortunately, police officers are not able to do much for financial crimes, but it is still important to report them.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:01] - Most scams are considered “low ticket” items, even if it is several thousand dollars and that’s all you have.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:08] - AARP has a resource for how to talk about scams with family members who have been a victim of a scam. <a href= "https://www.aarp.org/saythis">https://www.aarp.org/saythis</a> </li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:50] - Rewording how we talk to and about victims of scams is changing.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:23] - You have to have a strong and unique password for literally everything.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:27] - Even just one extra layer of protection in the form of two-factor authentication is helpful.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:10] - No one will ever ask you for an authentication code over the phone.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:20] - There’s got to be something we can do as a society to help victims with the money they’ve lost.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:48] - We cannot trust incoming communication, including calls, emails, and texts.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:45] - Education and continuing to talk about this will help keep the trend of less victim shaming going.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:30] - Victims can change the verbiage as well. Report the scam and file a police report.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:29] - You can and should also report scams you know about even if you did not experience a loss.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:10] - A number to use to reach the Fraud Watch Network is 877-908-3360.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[48:09] - If someone you know has been a victim of a scam, don’t get mad at them for “falling for it,” get mad that this was done to them.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.aarp.org/saythis">AARP: Say This</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.aarp.org/money/scams-fraud/about-fraud-watch-network/"> Fraud Watch Network</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>The Difference Between Fraud and Scams with Uri Rivner</title>
			<itunes:title>The Difference Between Fraud and Scams with Uri Rivner</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 05 Jun 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[fdd8829a-e062-47d9-9095-3e6ac4c90dc2]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/223]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Moving money has never been easier. We no longer need to go into a bank, fill out a slip, and hand it to a teller to receive our money. We can now transfer money instantly. Scammers are taking advantage of unfamiliar technology to either hack in and take our money or to deceive you into sending it to them yourself. Deciding if the bank is responsible for the loss is becoming more and more of a conversation.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Uri Rivner. Uri has been fighting financial crime for 20 years working closely with the world’s largest banks on developing strategies against online fraud and scams. Prior to founding Refine Intelligence, Uri was co-founder and Chief Cyber Officer at BioCatch, the global leader in behavioral biometrics for fraud detection. Earlier, Uri served as Head of New Technologies at RSA. Innovations Uri spearheaded, such as risk-based authentication, are now saving the industry billions of dollars each year in fraud. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:19] - Uri shares his background in fighting fraud for the last 20 years.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:43] - The companies Uri has worked for, founded, and co-founded work with banks and financial institutions to help protect against fraud.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:10] - In a fraud situation, people are tricked through social engineering to hand over their information, but the fraudsters move the money.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:41] - Fraud is unauthorized. A scam is an authorized payment.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:39] - Uri describes some of the history of frauds changing over to scams.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:42] - Although there’s a difference between fraud and scams, the lines can be blurred.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:10] - Remote access malware became a real problem.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:13] - What are the differences between how the banks handle fraud and how they handle scams?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:08] - Banks can look at data and account action to determine if a criminal moved money or if the victim did it for them.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:36] - It is much more difficult for banks to detect scams.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:29] - If banks see something unusual, they typically reach out to the customer to hear the reason. This doesn’t always work due to social engineering.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:13] - Engaging customers is tricky because people don’t typically answer the phone or criminals are coaching the victim through what to say.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:17] - This year, in the UK, banks will be held liable.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:17] - By design, banks are supposed to know their customers. But that’s not the case these days.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:48] - For banks, it is harder now to connect with customers to find out exactly what happened.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:31] - Uri explains what happened with the US introduction of instant money transfers through Zelle.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:50] - There is an increase in Zelle scams, but banks were able to offer some support and reimbursement.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:59] - Scams are the most effective tools criminals have.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:45] - Uri describes what we can look out for and how to best prepare ourselves to prevent scams.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:19] - When money is moved from a bank account, it is the end of a chain of events that led to it. What is the responsibility of the platform that transferred it?</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/uri-rivner/?originalSubdomain=il">Uri Rivner on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>
			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Moving money has never been easier. We no longer need to go into a bank, fill out a slip, and hand it to a teller to receive our money. We can now transfer money instantly. Scammers are taking advantage of unfamiliar technology to either hack in and take our money or to deceive you into sending it to them yourself. Deciding if the bank is responsible for the loss is becoming more and more of a conversation.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Uri Rivner. Uri has been fighting financial crime for 20 years working closely with the world’s largest banks on developing strategies against online fraud and scams. Prior to founding Refine Intelligence, Uri was co-founder and Chief Cyber Officer at BioCatch, the global leader in behavioral biometrics for fraud detection. Earlier, Uri served as Head of New Technologies at RSA. Innovations Uri spearheaded, such as risk-based authentication, are now saving the industry billions of dollars each year in fraud. </p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:19] - Uri shares his background in fighting fraud for the last 20 years.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:43] - The companies Uri has worked for, founded, and co-founded work with banks and financial institutions to help protect against fraud.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:10] - In a fraud situation, people are tricked through social engineering to hand over their information, but the fraudsters move the money.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:41] - Fraud is unauthorized. A scam is an authorized payment.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:39] - Uri describes some of the history of frauds changing over to scams.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:42] - Although there’s a difference between fraud and scams, the lines can be blurred.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:10] - Remote access malware became a real problem.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:13] - What are the differences between how the banks handle fraud and how they handle scams?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:08] - Banks can look at data and account action to determine if a criminal moved money or if the victim did it for them.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:36] - It is much more difficult for banks to detect scams.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:29] - If banks see something unusual, they typically reach out to the customer to hear the reason. This doesn’t always work due to social engineering.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:13] - Engaging customers is tricky because people don’t typically answer the phone or criminals are coaching the victim through what to say.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:17] - This year, in the UK, banks will be held liable.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:17] - By design, banks are supposed to know their customers. But that’s not the case these days.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:48] - For banks, it is harder now to connect with customers to find out exactly what happened.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:31] - Uri explains what happened with the US introduction of instant money transfers through Zelle.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:50] - There is an increase in Zelle scams, but banks were able to offer some support and reimbursement.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:59] - Scams are the most effective tools criminals have.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:45] - Uri describes what we can look out for and how to best prepare ourselves to prevent scams.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:19] - When money is moved from a bank account, it is the end of a chain of events that led to it. What is the responsibility of the platform that transferred it?</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/uri-rivner/?originalSubdomain=il">Uri Rivner on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Sex Trafficking and Murder on the Road with Frank Figliuzzi</title>
			<itunes:title>Sex Trafficking and Murder on the Road with Frank Figliuzzi</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 29 May 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[03f08570-6c6d-42c9-a39f-76e855e52439]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/sex-trafficking-and-murder-on-the-road-with-frank-figliuzzi]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">It sounds like an episode straight out of Criminal Minds. The FBI’s Highway Serial Killers initiative hunts for long-haul truckers behind at least 850 murders of mostly female sex trafficking victims along our nation’s highways.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Frank Figliuzzi. Frank was the FBI’s Assistant Director over Counterintelligence. He served 25 years as an FBI Special Agent in assignments across the country. As the head of all espionage investigations, Frank frequently briefed the White House, the DNI, and the Attorney General. For the past seven years, Frank has been a national security analyst for NBC News and MSNBC. He’s the author of a national bestseller, <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/FBI-Way-Inside-Bureaus-Excellence-ebook/dp/B086ZSPQDR?ref_=ast_author_mpb">The FBI Way: Inside the Bureau's Code of Excellence</a>, and now <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Long-Haul-Hunting-Highway-Killers-ebook/dp/B0CGT6FSS6?ref_=ast_author_dp"> Long Haul: Hunting the Highway Serial Killers</a>.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:30] - Frank shares his background and what his role was in the FBI for 25 years.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:52] - His most recent book is <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Long-Haul-Hunting-Highway-Killers-ebook/dp/B0CGT6FSS6?ref_=ast_author_dp"> Long Haul: Hunting the Highway Serial Killers</a> and is about the FBI’s Highway Serial Killers initiative.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:57] - These cases go back several decades and remain unsolved.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:13] - Trucking is a crucial part of our society, but there are different types of truckers and some are more likely to commit crime.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:12] - The success of the initiative really relies on local police departments.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:13] - Frank describes some of the things he learned from experts in street-level human trafficking.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:27] - Frank gives examples of some of the things he did for research.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:53] - The type of trucker that Frank is most concerned about are the ones with very little interaction with other people.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:21] - There is more security and tracking of truckers in more corporate organizations.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:44] - The corporate job is less attractive to someone who is motivated to commit crime.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:03] - Frank was amazed at how high tech trucking is these days and the brains needed to understand it all.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:03] - Frank describes his experience as he shadowed a trucker and immersed himself in the lifestyle.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:43] - The number one profession for serial killers is a trucker. What is it about the job? Does it attract killers or make killers?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:17] - Most people think that people they know would never be a victim of a crime like this.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:06] - Human trafficking is most commonly initiated by someone the victim knows.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:56] - Get rid of the notion that this can’t happen to your family. That’s dangerous in and of itself because you’ll never see it coming.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:40] - Connecting with potential victims has moved online.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:57] - Trafficking victims are often victimized more and treated like criminals themselves.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:01] - What are the similarities between crime scenes in many of these cases?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:42] - The 850 unsolved cases only account for the ones that are known.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:46] - There is an organization called Truckers Against Trafficking (T.A.T.). Frank explains what they do and how they help.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:48] - Technological advances are making a huge difference, particularly in DNA.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:19] - These crime scenes are the worst Frank has ever seen even after his 25 years in law enforcement.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[52:40] - Sometimes, a victim’s name is not known for many years if at all. It is hard to track the solve-rate of these crimes.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[55:12] - There are DNA testing organizations that work with police departments.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://frankfigliuzzi.com/">Frank Figliuzzi’s Website</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Next Gen Romance Scams with Anna Rowe</title>
			<itunes:title>Next Gen Romance Scams with Anna Rowe</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 22 May 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[6d9d1c1e-618a-4138-8649-1ba47183be50]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/221]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Scammers have gone from postal mail and faxes to email and phone calls where you never see the person, but now with AI, you can even have a live video call that seems completely real with deep fake technology. It’s no longer safe to just see a person, but there are other things you can do to know if you’re communicating with the individual they claim to be.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Anna Rowe. Anna is the founder of Catch the Catfish and co-founder of LoveSaid. She is a Subject Matter Expert in Romance Fraud and Victim Support.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:55] - Anna shares her background as a teacher and describes how she was catfished in 2015.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:52] - How can you make genuine informed consent when someone is deceiving you at that level?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:45] - A therapist’s suggestion of researching narcissists and psychopaths started her healing journey.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:35] - Anna learned that this type of scam commonly comes from West Africa and the scammers are known as Yahoo Boys.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:44] - Romance fraud can be in person, like with Anna’s experience. But there are romance scams that are online only.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:32] - It is common for romance scammers to also be perpetrating other types of fraud at the same time.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:44] - Pig butchering includes another problem, where scammers themselves are also trafficked.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:59] - A lot of victims don’t realize they are interacting with a scammer for a long time because they aren’t asking for money.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:51] - In years past, Photoshopping an image to appear realistic wasn’t as easy as it is now with AI.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:26] - Blending a new face onto an existing photo can even be used in video.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:15] - Voice cloning is also often used and apps to do this are free.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:24] - Deep fake scammers use content on social media stories and live streams to record long pieces of video.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:20] - This technology is improving quickly, but Anna shares some of the ways you can tell if something is a deep fake.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:51] - There are simple things to check on profiles that you can notice as red flags before getting involved with someone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:01] - Scammers also really like using cryptocurrency because it is unregulated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:14] - Scammers build a reality typically by using the 5 C’s of reasons why their spouse is gone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:30] - There are different strategies to look for certain things as you “become your own detective” on various social media platforms.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:57] - When scammers know that you are “onto them” they know what they can change.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:36] - Every decision a scammer makes is premeditated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:50] - Scammers will keep you hooked and space away from them could get you in a space of trusting your gut.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[53:32] - Reverse image searches are extremely helpful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[57:50] - Anna describes some of the ways she was able to determine what her scammer was doing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[61:10] - Anna was put into an open relationship without her consent.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[63:05] - Future faking is common in narcissists and psychopaths.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[64:26] - These scams are really damaging and it is important to not use victim shaming language when discussing it.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Scammers have gone from postal mail and faxes to email and phone calls where you never see the person, but now with AI, you can even have a live video call that seems completely real with deep fake technology. It’s no longer safe to just see a person, but there are other things you can do to know if you’re communicating with the individual they claim to be.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Anna Rowe. Anna is the founder of Catch the Catfish and co-founder of LoveSaid. She is a Subject Matter Expert in Romance Fraud and Victim Support.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:55] - Anna shares her background as a teacher and describes how she was catfished in 2015.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:52] - How can you make genuine informed consent when someone is deceiving you at that level?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:45] - A therapist’s suggestion of researching narcissists and psychopaths started her healing journey.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:35] - Anna learned that this type of scam commonly comes from West Africa and the scammers are known as Yahoo Boys.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:44] - Romance fraud can be in person, like with Anna’s experience. But there are romance scams that are online only.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:32] - It is common for romance scammers to also be perpetrating other types of fraud at the same time.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:44] - Pig butchering includes another problem, where scammers themselves are also trafficked.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:59] - A lot of victims don’t realize they are interacting with a scammer for a long time because they aren’t asking for money.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:51] - In years past, Photoshopping an image to appear realistic wasn’t as easy as it is now with AI.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:26] - Blending a new face onto an existing photo can even be used in video.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:15] - Voice cloning is also often used and apps to do this are free.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:24] - Deep fake scammers use content on social media stories and live streams to record long pieces of video.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:20] - This technology is improving quickly, but Anna shares some of the ways you can tell if something is a deep fake.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:51] - There are simple things to check on profiles that you can notice as red flags before getting involved with someone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:01] - Scammers also really like using cryptocurrency because it is unregulated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:14] - Scammers build a reality typically by using the 5 C’s of reasons why their spouse is gone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:30] - There are different strategies to look for certain things as you “become your own detective” on various social media platforms.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:57] - When scammers know that you are “onto them” they know what they can change.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:36] - Every decision a scammer makes is premeditated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:50] - Scammers will keep you hooked and space away from them could get you in a space of trusting your gut.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[53:32] - Reverse image searches are extremely helpful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[57:50] - Anna describes some of the ways she was able to determine what her scammer was doing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[61:10] - Anna was put into an open relationship without her consent.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[63:05] - Future faking is common in narcissists and psychopaths.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[64:26] - These scams are really damaging and it is important to not use victim shaming language when discussing it.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "http://lovesaid.com">LoveSaid.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://catchthecatfish.com/">Catch the Catfish</a></p> </li> </ul> <p> </p>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Challenges of Employee Onboarding and Offboarding with Craig Davies</title>
			<itunes:title>Challenges of Employee Onboarding and Offboarding with Craig Davies</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 15 May 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>

			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/challenges-of-employee-onboarding-and-offboarding-with-craig-davies]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Many years ago, people chose to stay with the same employer for decades. Today, employees are changing jobs more regularly. Each company needs to have processes in place allowing access to systems needed to do their jobs, but there’s also a risk of when they leave that they may still have access to certain programs. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Craig Davies. Craig started in banking, holding many roles including CSO. As the CISO and the Executive Director of Gathid Ltd., he is passionate about helping organizations strengthen access management without completely overhauling their people, processes, physical infrastructure, and technology. Craig has spent more than 25 years in cybersecurity working with infrastructure operations, security architecture and software, web development and operations. He was the first CEO of Ost Cyber and at Atlassian he helped develop the security program for all aspects of their business, including security, cloud operations and protection.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:32] - Craig shares his background and what his roles are at Gathid.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:52] - When bringing on new employees, there are several front-end issues that a company and employee can face.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:22] - It can be really frustrating for a new employee when there are so many different programs to learn and manage.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:18] - We have to think about the employee’s journey.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:59] - In many cases, new employees receive a ton of access without learning the process during onboarding.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:49] - Offboarding can be a nightmare because we don’t always think about all the things that are connected.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:26] - We need to protect the person who is leaving.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:06] - One of the challenges is knowing who should be responsible.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:12] - There needs to be a list of all the programs and systems that an employee may have access to.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:17] - Offboarding is not typically a priority but not focusing on it can be a huge risk.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:43] - Smart use of control is important especially in onboarding and offboarding.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:26] - Working remotely makes systems and access even trickier.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:39] - There is a reason the large companies have large systems.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:50] - Every company has the same problems. The ones that have a process in place have likely experienced a crisis.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:57] - What are the challenges to the new ways of working post-pandemic?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:26] - You can’t get rid of risk, but you can manage it.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:50] - These processes all start with a conversation.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/craigjdavies/">Craig Davies on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://gathid.com/">Gathid Website</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>5 Common Uses of Synthetic IDs with Stuart Wells</title>
			<itunes:title>5 Common Uses of Synthetic IDs with Stuart Wells</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 08 May 2024 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[838c5049-e14a-428c-81ac-f5aaf77f0a01]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/5-common-uses-of-synthetic-ids-with-stuart-wells]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">There are entire communities set up to fight fraud that use synthetic IDs as well as scammer gangs that are advancing their creative ways to use these documents. This is changing regularly as biometric authentication advances continue. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Stuart Wells. Stuart is the CTO of Jumio and is responsible for all aspects of Jumio’s innovation, machine learning, and engineering. He is an industry veteran with more than 30 years of tech experience. He was previously the Chief Product and Technology Officer at FICO, and held executive positions at Avaya and Sun Microsystems.</p> <h3 dir="ltr">Show Notes:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:18] - Stuart shares his background and what he does at Jumio as the Chief Technology Officer.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:20] - The science behind document protection is literally decades old.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:06] - Stuart describes the process of verifying a document at Jumio.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:57] - What are the practical uses of synthetic IDs?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:39] - There are large volumes of both fraudulent and honest individuals creating and using synthetic IDs.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:25] - A lot of businesses are seeking verification from places like Jumio to protect themselves and their reputation.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:49] - Biometrics as a tool to use against fraudsters has grown globally.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:54] - Biometrics are very useful, but there are challenges.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:31] - Stuart shares a recent story about a fake video interaction that cost the victim millions of dollars.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:37] - At this point in the technology’s development, there are some signs of deep fakes that we can spot.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:03] - How can this negatively impact an individual?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:18] - Listen to your inner voice and check with another source before sending money.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:52] - You don’t have to be a programmer to use these tools. The creators have made them easy to use and people are using them to do harm.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:46] - The early versions of deep fake technology had a lot of easy-to-see abnormalities, but they are getting tougher to spot.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:26] - Although these negative impacts are concerning, there is some excitement about the positive uses of these advances.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:07] - What direction is verification headed when it comes to biometrics?</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:54] - Documents have anatomy and security measures in place.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:43] - Most security systems are layered.</li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:00] - This landscape is continuously changing.</li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905">subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3 dir="ltr">Links and Resources:</h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.jumio.com/">Jumio Website</a></li> </ul>]]></description>
