			<title>Fake vs. Taken-Over Accounts with Jason Kent and Will Glazier</title>
			<itunes:title>Fake vs. Taken-Over Accounts with Jason Kent and Will Glazier</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 20 Dec 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[2db05d95-914e-4e8f-9f71-ef8c83622238]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/199]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">As we approach the next season, threat actors will be keeping a close eye on dating apps. These apps have become a prime target for threat actors due to the size of the market expanding to over 300 million users and the rich information stored in these apps. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guests are Jason Kent and Will Glazier. Jason is a hacker-in-residence at Cequence Security. He has a diverse information security, networking, and IT background and a generous level of knowledge for most pieces of the IT spectrum including firewalls, security architecture, security controls, and security infrastructure.</p> <p dir="ltr">Will Glazier is the Head of Threat Research at Cequence Security where they protect some of the world’s largest brands from sophisticated bot attacks and threats against the public facing APIs. Will has a background in fraud abuse and prevention as well as building threat intelligence systems. </p> <p><span style= "font-size: 14pt;"><strong> </strong><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></span></p> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:18] - Jason and Will share their backgrounds and current roles at Cequence Security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:24] - As common as scams and fraud are, even Jason and Will have personal experience with them.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:39] - Dating app attacks are particularly hard because they prey on vulnerable people. There are so many cases, that there should not be shame around talking about it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:32] - The first red flag is when someone you are talking to on a dating app tries to get you over to texting or another app.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:37] - In any given month, the amount of malicious API transactions that Cequence is blocking is in the billions.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:52] - Fake accounts are constantly made but not as heavily used as taken over accounts.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:08] - Scammers are now paying for premium accounts to appear more legitimate and the investment pays off when they scam someone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:11] - There are tools people can buy to make all accounts look real through automation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:29] - It is essential that people in a fraud department can trust the information and push it out to Cequence.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:04] - Some organizations will pay a ransom to decrease the time wasted and money lost. In their eyes, the money lost to pay the ransom isn’t as much.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:11] - Margins are getting tighter for the bad guys.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:31] - The infrastructure that scammers use varies. There are some that are really well known at Cequence and some that are more difficult.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:51] - It is easier to take out one big player than to take out hundreds of small ones.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:03] - There are human and political pressures that make things more challenging for security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:07] - Romance scammers are employing new tactics and switching them up.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:48] - If you put too much trust in the platform that it makes you trust the random person you’re talking to, take a step back.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:40] - Take a look online for things that have been done by scammers historically, especially if you are new to dating apps.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.cequence.ai/">Cequence Security Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>The Changing World of Data Breaches with Troy Hunt</title>
			<itunes:title>The Changing World of Data Breaches with Troy Hunt</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 13 Dec 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[64984e5a-8ed8-4570-a4df-5d63fcd5d7f2]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/198]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Everyone who’s on the internet is exposed to risk. Every time you set up a new account or app, you create another place where your data can be hacked or breached. This makes your differing passwords crucial.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Troy Hunt. Troy is a Pluralsight author and instructor, Microsoft Regional Director, and Most Valued Professional specializing in online security and cloud development. He is a conference speaker and runs workshops on how to build more secure software with organizations. He is also the creator of the popular data breach aggregation service known as Have I Been Pwned.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:26] - Troy shares what he currently does and the work he is known for.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:57] - You can put your data in one place and it can traverse the internet and end up in places you don’t expect.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:54] - There’s a challenge in running a site that has millions of queries at any time.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:25] - Troy shares some of the accomplishments of Have I Been Pwned.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:32] - Does he experience a lot of malicious traffic? He used to. Troy explains how he has managed this.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:14] - Have I Been Pwned has been around for a while and began as a lot of manual labor for Troy.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:10] - It is crucial for organizations to be receptive to security reports.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:09] - In a lot of ransoms, data of specific groups of people are used as threats.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:56] - Troy lists some of the things that happen on the back end of running a site like Have I Been Pwned.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:36] - Cloud services have been an amazing advancement in technology, but they open up more points of entry.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:35] - There is a hierarchy of multi-factor authentication. Troy discusses the current strategies that are best practice.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:45] - For users, what is the second-factor authentication you can manage to use?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:27] - There are different risk levels to different things. What do you actually need to carefully protect and what level of inconvenience are you willing to bear?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:59] - Troy shares how his parents have been impacted by confusing technology. What is the right technology for a demographic?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:15] - Some data is more important than other pieces of information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[45:33] - Some data is also more or less important to different individuals.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:54] - For those managing and discussing data breaches, we also need to be aware that there are pieces of data that could be important to someone but isn’t important to others.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[48:24] - Unfortunately, data breaches haven’t gotten less common and aren’t really getting better.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://haveibeenpwned.com/?ref=troyhunt.com">Have I Been Pwned?</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.troyhunt.com/">Troy Hunt’s Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>When Conservatorships Go Wrong with Diane Dimond</title>
			<itunes:title>When Conservatorships Go Wrong with Diane Dimond</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 06 Dec 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[e0417abb-2674-4b59-a872-fa9303b48232]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/197]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">As people age and their physical and mental health declines, conservatorships are often considered. If you’re not careful, the entire estate can be spent on management costs and abuse can occur. There are things a family can do for better outcomes.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Diane Dimond. Diane is the author of four books and is a veteran investigative reporter for radio, TV, and print. Crime and justice is her preferred genre and she broke the Michael Jackson story twice. Currently abusive guardianship and conservatorships are her focus.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:55] - Diane shares her background as an investigative reporter.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:48] - Her recent book <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Were-Here-Help-Guardianship-Brandeis/dp/1684581672"> We’re Here to Help: When Guardianship Goes Wrong</a> is all about the possible pitfalls and risks of conservatorships.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:15] - Diane explains how guardianship and conservatorship is granted.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:21] - In a lot of cases, Diane has found that judges assume if conservatorship is being asked for that the family is dysfunctional.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:59] - Guardians are paid out of the ward’s estate and many charge an outrageous amount of money.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:31] - The most public conservatorship that went wrong was Britney Spears’s. But some celebrity guardianship scenarios have been beneficial.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:29] - Diane firmly believes that guardianship needs to be harder to establish.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:06] - Anybody can initiate a petition.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:14] - Once it is in front of a judge, it can become a catch-22 situation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:11] - Every state is different and many are starting to pass some reform. Florida in particular is a terrible state for this system.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:42] - SEAR is a very useful resource if you are in an abusive guardianship situation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:07] - It is almost impossible for the ward to make any decisions.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:50] - It is you against a whole system.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:52] - Unfortunately there is a lot of criminality that is possible.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:51] - It isn’t impossible for abusers to be caught and punished, but it is not common.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:59] - There are alternatives to guardianships that really should be considered.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:21] - If these abusers were punished, they would go somewhere else and commit a different crime, but they would at least leave these vulnerable people alone.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Were-Here-Help-Guardianship-Brandeis/dp/1684581672"> We’re Here to Help: When Guardianship Goes Wrong by Diane Dimond</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://dianedimond.com/">Diane Dimond Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>
			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">As people age and their physical and mental health declines, conservatorships are often considered. 			<title>5 Things to Teach Your Kids About Predators with Michael Buraimoh</title>
			<itunes:title>5 Things to Teach Your Kids About Predators with Michael Buraimoh</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 29 Nov 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1af997f5-b475-4cb4-9876-55a1c801bd70]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/196]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Many parents assume that their children will never be groomed by a predator and then miss the opportunity to educate their kids on the techniques that are used. Every child, regardless of gender, can be manipulated and tricked into making poor choices and put themselves in dangerous situations. Today’s guest is Michael Buraimoh. Michael joined Breck Foundation as CEO in January 2022. He is dedicated to the foundation’s mission to create a better online world for children and young people and is helping take the foundation’s important work to new heights. He is an author, and having his own children inspires him to create a safer digital world for them to grow up in. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:01] - Michael shares the background and the reason behind the creation of the Breck Foundation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:02] - Michael’s own background is in criminal justice, specifically with young people.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:23] - It is crucial that parents are honest and open with their children about this discussion.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:51] - Ignore the misconceptions about grooming.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:37] - Safety doesn’t mean having to put every form of digital activity aside. Parents need to be involved.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:07] - Trust is the key to ensuring that a child will tell their parents things that are happening online.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:05] - There are signs to look out for that could be indicative of something going on.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:32] - It can be hard to determine what is unsafe and what is normal teenage conversations, but it's important to be aware of red flags.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:11] - Young people now are digital natives. They have to be able to engage online.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:52] - There is a place and time for parental controls and limiting access, but relationships are far more important.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:42] - The Breck Foundation educates parents but also the children and young people themselves.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:08] - Young people need to know that if someone is trying to isolate them from their friends and family through secret conversations, something isn’t right.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:52] - Look for a trusted adult to report to. For parents, contact authorities.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:30] - Screenshot, shutdown, and report. The Breck Foundation has a lot of resources for this education.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:51] - Play virtually, but live real.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.breckfoundation.org/">Breck Foundation Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>The Evolution of Digital Identity with Philipp Pointner</title>
			<itunes:title>The Evolution of Digital Identity with Philipp Pointner</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[511f4b9a-102b-4d72-adbb-10c5042b33a1]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/195]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Currently we have hard copy passports and driver's licenses, but as our digital identities evolve, we may find ourselves with a worldwide digital standardized way of proving who we are. Today’s guest is Philipp Pointner. Philipp leads Jumio’s digital identity strategy and the initiative to enable multiple digital identity providers in its ecosystem. Prior to Jumio, Philipp was responsible for paysafecard, Europe’s most popular prepaid solution for online purchases. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:53] - Philipp shares his background and current role at Jumio.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:12] - Our online identity has changed very quickly over the last decade.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:47] - Over time, this evolution has made people a lot more comfortable with technology.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:50] - The changes that Philipp thinks are coming may cause problems with some countries not accepting them.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:30] - The digital identity will likely be more secure than physical copies of important documents like passports and driver’s licenses.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:47] - Chris and Philipp discuss a recent experience in verifying the credibility of physical documents.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:52] - With more sophisticated benefits to a digital identity comes more sophisticated attack attempts.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:40] - Where does one turn if they are a victim of identity theft?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:11] - Philipp believes that it should be the responsibility of an organization to ensure the end user is safe.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:48] - Philipp shares the results of a survey that asked people if they were willing to take more steps to ensure that they were secure online, but the exception was social media.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:02] - Education around scams is improving and increasing, but not about everything.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:20] - The technology exists to keep people more secure, but it isn’t employed as often as is necessary.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:47] - At the end of the day, the inconvenience is always put on the end user.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:07] - Biometrics are strong and have a lot of well governed standards already in place.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:40] - Research shows that the requirement to change passwords every 90 days is ineffective.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:59] - Currently, there isn’t a one-stop shop to receive the education they need to better understand cybersecurity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:48] - Philipp and Chris talk about the recent issue with concert tickets being purchased by bots for scalping.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:28] - The general public has become an easier target than in years past because of the increase in online activity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:09] - People vastly overestimate their ability to detect fake images and deep fakes.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:42] - Philipp explains what it means to have a reusable digital identity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:30] - When digital identity is used to verify in the future, will users have the ability to revoke their provided information?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:58] - Pursue education on this topic and then take action.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[50:01] - Your data is definitely online and it's important to be aware of what is available for potential scammers to know.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.jumio.com/">Jumio’s Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Preventing and Reporting Cyber Attacks with Robert Karas</title>
			<itunes:title>Preventing and Reporting Cyber Attacks with Robert Karas</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 15 Nov 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[e9acc26f-acd5-4747-b46a-cf80746297e8]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/194]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Cyber criminals are growing in their attack planning. CISA is continuing training their teams to look for vulnerabilities and help out not only the government, but other entities secure their networks and products. Today’s guest is Robert Karas. Rob came to the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency in 2010. He has over 30 years experience in the information security field and significant experience in building nationally recognized security platforms. At CISA, Rob built the Cyber Hygiene Program, risk and vulnerability assessments, and penetration testing programs. He has also created the Cyber Defense Education training programs to address industry challenges. How can we inspect everything?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:09] - When it comes to purchasing new devices, ensure that frequent updates are part of the guarantee.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:41] - A great place to start for resources on CISA’s website. 			<title>Support to Navigate the Justice System with Rachel Gibson</title>
			<itunes:title>Support to Navigate the Justice System with Rachel Gibson</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 08 Nov 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[992410e4-9d2a-47c7-8242-f5ebbeef30c6]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/193]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Everyday people are falling victims to scams and fraud. Embarrassment and guilt can prevent people from reporting the incident. Not everyone is aware that there are resources available to help navigate the justice system. Today’s guest is Rachel Gibson. Rachel is the Director of the Center of Victim Service Professionals at the National Center for Victims of Crime where she works to further the mission by supporting and overseeing programs for victim service professionals, providing training and technical assistance. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:48] - Rachel shares her background and her role as the Director of the Center of Victim Service Professionals.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:53] - We talk a lot about prevention work, but there aren’t as many resources for what to do after an incident.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:47] - Rachel explains the background and how the Center for Victims of Crime was founded.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:46] - Many victims are experiencing polyvictimization and may not realize they are victims of a crime at first.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:14] - 24-hour hotlines are available and very impactful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:51] - Rachel describes the different programs that she is involved in at the Center for Victims of Crime.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:57] - Part of the work she does is helping people realize the intersection and connections between different types of crime.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:08] - Oftentimes in these cases, this is the first time victims have been involved with the justice system.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:02] - Maybe a victim doesn’t want to go to law enforcement, but the crime should still be reported.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:12] - Financial fraud is a crime where society victim blames right out of the gate.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:24] - The conversation shouldn’t be about who is victimized, but rather who is being targeted.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:17] - Google is a great first step in determining legitimacy.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:51] - Fraudsters are banking on targets not being knowledgeable.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:55] - We have to come to the conversation with an attitude of empowerment.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:26] - Rachel explains how partnerships are important as service professionals will likely hear about crimes.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:47] - Legally, there’s a difference between a scam and fraud. But there’s always an opportunity to connect people to resources.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:07] - Think about what someone needs in the moment. It might not be to go to law enforcement.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:03] - Talk to your friends and family. If something seems too good to be true, it probably is.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:24] - A big trend right now in questions and concerns is the intersection of AI and fraud.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://victimsofcrime.org/">National Center for Victims of Crime Website</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://victimconnect.org/">Victim Connect Resource Center</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Human Trafficking Into Scam Call Centers with Matt Friedman</title>
			<itunes:title>Human Trafficking Into Scam Call Centers with Matt Friedman</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 01 Nov 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[15596fe1-170f-4293-adfd-7100302313ef]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/192]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p>It’s hard to imagine finding a job, advancing into a second interview, they send you a ticket to their overseas office, only to find out that you’re about to be trafficked into a life of forced labor while they threaten your family. But this is happening all around the world today. Today’s guest is Matt Friedman. Matt is an international human trafficking expert with more than 35 years of experience. 			<title>Active Shooter Preparedness with Katherine Schweit</title>
			<itunes:title>Active Shooter Preparedness with Katherine Schweit</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 25 Oct 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[dc26920b-299c-491c-8fa2-62973b8add14]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/191]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">No one ever wants to find themselves in an active shooter situation. But if you are, it’s important to know how to respond. Today’s guest is Katherine Schweit. Katherine is an attorney, consultant, and retired FBI special agent who created and led the FBI’s Active Shooter Program after the horrible tragedy at Sandy Hook Elementary School. She joined a White House team working on violence prevention matters, led by then Vice President Biden. She is the author of <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1947635573/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1"> Stop the Killing: How to End the Mass Shooting Crisis</a>, <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/How-Talk-About-Guns-Anyone-ebook/dp/B0C63ZQPCK"> How to Talk About Guns With Anybody</a>, and the FBI’s research on mass shootings, a study of 160 active shooter incidents in the United States between 2000 and 2013. She was part of the crisis team responding to shooting incidents including at the Holocaust Memorial Museum, the Pentagon, and the Navy Yard in Washington, DC.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:14] - Katherine shares her background, her experience in the FBI, and her work in the Active Shooter Program.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:05] - In her work, she spent time with parents and families of those killed in mass shootings.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:23] - What constitutes a mass shooting or an active shooter situation? There is no real definition.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:10] - Most mass killings are domestic, particularly murder/suicides, but those will not show in data. Katherine explains what the FBI looks at.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:44] - Journalists and media impact what stories are news-worthy.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:21] - Katherine released her book <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/How-Talk-About-Guns-Anyone-ebook/dp/B0C63ZQPCK"> How to Talk About Guns With Anyone</a> to keep the conversation going.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:19] - In 2020, the CDC determined that gun deaths in youth 19 and younger exceeded the deaths by traffic accidents in the same age group.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:56] - Safety isn’t about when it happens. It’s about if it happens.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:58] - The shooting at Columbine changed the way the American public viewed and feared shootings, although public shootings were not new events.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:32] - Katherine explains the response and training of law enforcement officers during the tragedy at Sandy Hook Elementary.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:06] - The numbers of incidents have increased but we have not seen the number of casualties increase.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:00] - Television shows and movies create misunderstandings on what law enforcement officers and FBI agents can accomplish.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:37] - See something, say something.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:00] - In most cases, someone close to a shooter had information and didn’t say anything.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:48] - What do you do when something happens? People should have Run, Hide, Fight training.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:51] - In 13% of shootings, a civilian was successful in getting in to help incapacitate the shooter.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:40] - A simple thing to be prepared with is knowledge of the exits in your location.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:19] - It is important when hiding to hide where there is actual cover.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:27] - Don’t stay where there is no protection.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:51] - Shooters come in with a plan and it is always intentional.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:11] - Sometimes an unexpected distraction makes a difference because it throws off a shooter’s plan.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:37] - While school shootings are terrible incidents, children are actually more in danger in their homes and neighborhoods.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:45] - Although they are major news stories when they happen, elementary school shootings are rare.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[51:29] - Listen to Katherine’s podcast, Stop the Killing, for more information.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a "https://www.amazon.com/How-Talk-About-Guns-Anyone-ebook/dp/B0C63ZQPCK"> How to Talk About Guns With Anybody</a> by Katherine Schweit</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1947635573/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1"> Stop the Killing: How to End the Mass Shooting Crisis</a> by Katherine Schweit</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.katherineschweit.com/">Katherine Schweit’s Website</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.katherineschweit.com/podcast">Stop the Killing Podcast</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>The Passwords Are the Problem with Thierry Gagnon and Philippe Desmarais</title>
			<itunes:title>The Passwords Are the Problem with Thierry Gagnon and Philippe Desmarais</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 18 Oct 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[a5eb1086-8088-45cf-826d-eaca7a9cc51a]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/190]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">With the use of passwords, we’re hoping to ensure privacy and security, but sometimes it is at the expense of convenience. As technology changes and biometric databases become more utilized, we need to remember that they may also be hacked. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guests are Philippe Desmarais and Thierry Gagnon. Philippe is a tech entrepreneur who co-founded Kelvin Zero and currently serves as its CEO, overseeing the company’s strategic direction. He is also a member of the Next Generation Advisory Council at Rockefeller Capital Management. Before creating Kelvin Zero, Philippe played a significant role in various start-ups, focusing on data analytics for political campaigns, remote hardware device management, and cybersecurity.</p> <p dir="ltr">Thierry Gagnon is co-founder and Chief Technology at Kelvin Zero. He is an expert in software development, malware analysis, cryptography, and reverse engineering. He has been actively involved in the cybersecurity community, participating in renowned competitions and projects such as Malware Information Sharing Platform.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:18] - Philippe and Thierry share their backgrounds and their roles in the company they co-founded together, Kelvin Zero.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:34] - Thierry’s expertise is in cybersecurity but Philippe’s interest was more in crime. They combined their strengths and passions to create Kelvin Zero.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:18] - Passwords have been around for millennia. </p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:24] - We often confuse being smarter with being faster.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:45] - Passwords are not often attached to an individual. We have so many passwords and can’t actually know them all.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:53] - We can compromise passwords at scale.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:20] - The attackers only need to be right once. The defenders need to be right 100% of the time. How can we flip this?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:47] - The average person is tasked with trying to keep up with cybersecurity and, in most cases, they are not qualified to do this.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:11] - What does it look like to take a password-less approach?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:20] - If cybersecurity is done successfully, the opportunities are massive. But regulation holds us back.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:51] - Once a tech company can serve protection, then companies can focus on their services and products.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:46] - There are differences between the physical world and the logical world.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:41] - How do you convince people to share medical data for research when there are constant breaches?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:33] - Is privacy the same as anonymity?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:52] - Technology should be able to do what we want it to do, but that’s not the case.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:36] - In a password-less environment, how can we validate a user?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:40] - Thierry believes we should get away from the server authenticating because then it is the responsibility of the organization.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:18] - Sci-fi movies sound far-fetched, but a lot of them predict technology.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:35] - Thierry and Philippe share their thoughts on what we should be putting our focus on now.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:40] - Stay away from single-factor authorization.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://kzero.com/">Kelvin Zero Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>5 Ways to Stay Safe Online with Patrick McNamara</title>
			<itunes:title>5 Ways to Stay Safe Online with Patrick McNamara</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 Oct 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[28384b9f-4737-4ace-aa00-7543dee5dfd3]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/189]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Staying safe online requires you to be an active participant. You need to do your own research and not rely entirely on other people’s tools, some of which are intended to actually take advantage of you. Today’s guest is Patrick McNamara. Patrick holds a bachelor’s degree in cybersecurity from University of Maryland Global along with multiple certifications. He operates the cyber awareness site DIYSecurityTips.com and is currently a cybersecurity engineer for a software company. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:52] - Patrick shares his background and current role in cybersecurity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:09] - Chris and Patrick discuss the changes in cybersecurity in education in just a few years.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:18] - When it comes to working in the industry, there are a lot of misunderstandings and inflexible definitions of what cybersecurity is.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:35] - Volunteer as much as you can.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:48] - A great place to start for your own online security is with passwords.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:17] - Literally anything can be breached. A password manager can at least mitigate risk.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:40] - Is it safe to connect to public wifi?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:56] - Using your cell phone’s hotspot is a lot safer than using public wifi. VPNs are also fantastic to invest in.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:42] - VPNs that are free could be dangerous as well. How are they making money if they are offering the service for free?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:33] - Pay attention to the developer before downloading any app on your phone or mobile device.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:16] - Check the permissions for the apps you download. For example, a calculator app doesn’t need access to your contacts and pictures.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:01] - Anything that is new and exciting, malware developers will be on it very quickly.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:40] - Understand how crypto works before investing in it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:52] - Patrick believes that it is possible to be completely anonymous online but there are a lot of very difficult steps to follow to do so.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:13] - Privacy is easier to maintain than anonymity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:41] - There’s special malware for every type of attack. Patrick shares some scenarios on different types of attacks.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:57] - VPNs cannot protect you from social engineering.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:21] - Some malware is downloaded through files online on a site that was recently breached.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:01] - Chris shares an experience in supply chain crypto mining that happened unintentionally. You never know.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:34] - You should at least know how to back up your data.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:13] - Patrick shares about his website and how to learn more about online safety.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "http://diysecuritytips.com">DIYSecurityTips.com</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

For example, a calculator app doesn’t need access to your contacts and pictures.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:01] - Anything that is new and exciting, malware developers will be on it very quickly.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:40] - Understand how crypto works before investing in it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:52] - Patrick believes that it is possible to be completely anonymous online but there are a lot of very difficult steps to follow to do so.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:13] - Privacy is easier to maintain than anonymity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:41] - There’s special malware for every type of attack. Patrick shares some scenarios on different types of attacks.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:57] - VPNs cannot protect you from social engineering.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:21] - Some malware is downloaded through files online on a site that was recently breached.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:01] - Chris shares an experience in supply chain crypto mining that happened unintentionally. You never know.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:34] - You should at least know how to back up your data.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:13] - Patrick shares about his website and how to learn more about online safety.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>Tracking Down Scammers with Ryan Kelly</title>
			<itunes:title>Tracking Down Scammers with Ryan Kelly</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 04 Oct 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[5bbf32f3-8b77-4708-8077-88b4c317abd5]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/188]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Everyone is being targeted by organized crime to separate you from your money. If you’ve been scammed, don’t allow embarrassment to keep you from reporting it. Your story could keep someone else from going through the same thing. Today’s guest is Ryan Kelly. Ryan is a stand-up comedian who hunts scammers with his master’s degree in Homeland Security.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:45] - Ryan shares his background and how he wound up hunting scammers.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:12] - Just a few months ago, Ryan himself was scammed.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:25] - Through social media, Ryan shared his experience and all of the comments showed that an incredible amount of people experienced it as well.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:13] - We do victims an injustice when we describe a hacker as a bored man in a basement and a hoodie. There are incredibly organized scam crime rings.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:07] - Your phone sells a lot of data.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:53] - Ryan shares what he does initially when tracking down a scammer.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:47] - Knowing an IP address can be helpful in knowing a little information, but it’s not exact.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:46] - Some military personnel cannot use fitness trackers or other devices that transmit data.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:08] - Ryan explains how a fan of his social media content recognized the background of a video and found him in person.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:03] - If you possibly feel like you are being targeted as a scam but you are unsure, you can ask a series of questions to see if they are lying.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:16] - Sometimes scammers purposely use bad grammar and spelling to weed out the people who are suspicious.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:37] - Two factor authorization should be a requirement on every login.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:01] - Your information is easy to find. There are ways to take some things down.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:01] - LinkedIn is a great tool, but it can be dangerous as scammers can create a false connection.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:09] - If you’re paying for something and it feels like a weird way to be paying for something, stop.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:51] - If you are looking at investing in something, think about the risk. Can you afford to possibly lose it all?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:36] - Scammers also target people under the pretense of helping them get their money back after a scam.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:25] - Don’t send photos to people you don’t know.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.tiktok.com/@youthpastorryan?lang=en">Ryan Kelly on TikTok</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/ryankellycomedy/?hl=en">Ryan Kelly on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.ryankellycomedy.com/">Ryan Kelly Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>World Romance Scam Prevention Day - October 3rd with Kathy Waters and Bryan Denny</title>
			<itunes:title>World Romance Scam Prevention Day - October 3rd with Kathy Waters and Bryan Denny</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 27 Sep 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[db906825-be16-474b-a7ed-eb80d6741a04]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/187]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Romance scammers are patient and willing to take their time to win over their target. In today’s episode, we’ll talk about how you can help out and make a difference to reduce the impact of romance scams. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guests are Kathy Waters and Bryan Denny. Kathy Waters is an expert advocate and an educator on the subject of online romance scams. Kathy is co-founder, along with retired Colonel Bryan Denny, of the non-profit organization Advocating Against Romance Scammers. Both have been working for safer platforms since 2016 with the same goals in mind: justice for victims and educating all online of the cybercrime known to tear people down emotionally, psychologically, and financially. They are now the organizers of World Romance Scam Prevention Day on October 3rd.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:10] - Kathy and Bryan share their background and why they are passionate about advocating for victims of romance scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:47] - Bryan was a victim of a romance scam, but not in the way you might think. Someone had been using his photo and posing as him.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:10] - Unfortunately, Bryan’s name and photo are still being used by scammers.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:36] - When someone’s profile image is taken, it is used over and over again. Getting one taken down is not going to end it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:22] - There are organized crime groups that use Bryan’s photos, but they believe that there are independent scammers using it as well.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:55] - World Romance Scam Prevention Day is October 3rd, and this is the first year it is official.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:59] - One of the myths about romance scams is the belief that people don’t actually fall for these things.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:47] - Another myth is that this only targets older people, but even juveniles are being targeted specifically for sextortion.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:01] - Romance scammers typically start to build a relationship slowly. They move the conversation outside a lot of social media apps.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:49] - People who want to believe it's real, will believe that it's real.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:44] - Bryan shares some common stories that scammers use in romance scams to get money from a victim.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:03] - Although some take a lot of time to ask for money, others will test the waters early and ask for small amounts or even content they use to blackmail.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:19] - Kathy suggests that mental health professionals come forward to provide education and support as well.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:40] - Never turn your back on a friend or family member who has fallen victim to a romance scam.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:24] - Learn what you can do to help support World Romance Scam Prevention Day.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://advocatingforu.com/">AdvocatingForU.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://protectingheartsday.com/#:~:text=October%203rd%20is%20the%20first%20globally%20recognized%20World%20Romance%20Scam%20Prevention%20Day."> World Romance Scam Prevention Day Home Page</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

They are now the organizers of World Romance Scam Prevention Day on October 3rd.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:10] - Kathy and Bryan share their background and why they are passionate about advocating for victims of romance scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:47] - Bryan was a victim of a romance scam, but not in the way you might think. Someone had been using his photo and posing as him.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:10] - Unfortunately, Bryan’s name and photo are still being used by scammers.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:36] - When someone’s profile image is taken, it is used over and over again. Getting one taken down is not going to end it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:22] - There are organized crime groups that use Bryan’s photos, but they believe that there are independent scammers using it as well.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:55] - World Romance Scam Prevention Day is October 3rd, and this is the first year it is official.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:59] - One of the myths about romance scams is the belief that people don’t actually fall for these things.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:47] - Another myth is that this only targets older people, but even juveniles are being targeted specifically for sextortion.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:01] - Romance scammers typically start to build a relationship slowly. They move the conversation outside a lot of social media apps.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:49] - People who want to believe it's real, will believe that it's real.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:44] - Bryan shares some common stories that scammers use in romance scams to get money from a victim.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:03] - Although some take a lot of time to ask for money, others will test the waters early and ask for small amounts or even content they use to blackmail.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:19] - Kathy suggests that mental health professionals come forward to provide education and support as well.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:40] - Never turn your back on a friend or family member who has fallen victim to a romance scam.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:24] - Learn what you can do to help support World Romance Scam Prevention Day.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://advocatingforu.com/">AdvocatingForU.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://protectingheartsday.com/#:~:text=October%203rd%20is%20the%20first%20globally%20recognized%20World%20Romance%20Scam%20Prevention%20Day."> World Romance Scam Prevention Day Home Page</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<itunes:subtitle><![CDATA[Romance scammers are patient and willing to take their time to win over their target. In today’s episode, we’ll talk about how you can help out and make a difference to reduce the impact of romance scams.  Today’s guests are Kathy Waters...]]></itunes:subtitle>
