			<title>Stopping Financial Fraud with Giles Mason</title>
			<itunes:title>Stopping Financial Fraud with Giles Mason</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 20 Sep 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[31985b28-ed58-460f-8219-790e192658e9]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/186]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Scammers try to take advantage of human politeness. Utilizing critical thinking and slowing down conversations with someone who claims to be an authority like a government agency or bank could be what prevents us from making a financial mistake. Today’s guest is Giles Mason. Giles is the Director of Campaigns at UK Finance. He is responsible for planning and delivering the organization’s communication activities to promote campaigns on behalf of the banking and finance industry.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:50] - Giles shares his background and current role at UK Finance.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:36] - In 2016, UK Finance launched Take Five to Stop Fraud.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:03] - Many victims of fraud often think after they’ve responded to a scammer that they could tell that something wasn’t quite right.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:36] - The biggest trend at the moment is purchase scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:16] - The type of scam that normally sees the greatest fraud is impersonation scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:08] - Scams that banks see are typically payment scams through their bank account.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:10] - Once a payment is made, most of the time there’s nothing you can do about it. Banks will do what they can, but it’s not always possible.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:38] - There are even scams that involve purchasing a home which are terrible because of the sheer amount of money involved.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:04] - Hang up and call the number you know for certain is your bank.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:13] - As humans, we want to be supportive and respect perceived authority.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:38] - Scammers typically won’t have a good reaction to you saying that you will call the number you know, which is a sign that they are not who they say they are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:10] - Young people are more willing to share information about a scam.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:35] - While Giles has not fallen victim to a scam, he has had multiple attempts.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:41] - Giles describes some of the trends in scamming.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:48] - Stop, challenge, and protect.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.takefive-stopfraud.org.uk/">Take Five to Stop Fraud Home Page</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.takefive-stopfraud.org.uk/">Take Five to Stop Fraud Home Page</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
			<title>Buyer Beware with Marta Tellado</title>
			<itunes:title>Buyer Beware with Marta Tellado</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 13 Sep 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[004c4858-c3fd-40c3-8d39-91eb718f6fdb]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/185]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">The burden is on consumers to question the validity of online offers because privacy laws and standards are not yet well regulated. Consumer Reports is fighting to make changes in this arena. Today’s guest is Marta Tellado. Marta is President and CEO of Consumer Reports, the independent non-profit that works side by side with consumers to create a fair and just marketplace. She is a market driven leader with a passion for innovation, public-service, philanthropy, and helping organizations maximize and improve the world.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:55] - Marta shares her background and her role as CEO of Consumer Reports.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:19] - We’re at a pioneering moment in the consumer market. Regulation hasn’t transitioned into the digital marketplace.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:04] - When online, we assume everything we do is safe.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:52] - Now with AI, consumer awareness is even more important.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:41] - As technology advances, so does the potential for scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:27] - Be aware of the red flags. </p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:33] - Consumer Reports has a ton of resources and information on scam protection.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:17] - Everyone is a target and anyone can fall for a scam, including Marta.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:51] - Marta shares the estimated amount of money lost to scams in 2022 and the increase we are seeing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:45] - Instead of connecting your peer-to-peer payment accounts to your bank account, connect them to your credit card where you have more protection.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:17] - Even when we select the “unsubscribe” button, we may be flagged as someone who is interacting with the scam content and further targeted.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:58] - The rules and regulations aren’t keeping up with the rapid growth and development of technology.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:55] - Marta describes the ways Consumer Reports works to educate consumers.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:25] - It takes a really long time to get laws and regulations in place.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:01] - We can’t see or feel the things that keep us safe or harm us online. </p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:38] - Even if you feel that you don’t have anything that a scammer would want, be aware that any information is valuable to them.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.consumerreports.org/">Consumer Reports Home Page</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Scambaiting with Pierogi</title>
			<itunes:title>Scambaiting with Pierogi</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 06 Sep 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[07ab8b00-0fb3-42ff-a55d-df44b63a3b3e]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/184]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Scammers have used our systems against us, like shipping, rental cars, and rental homes. They’ve learned how to stay off the radar and, in order to stop money laundering, we need to address fraud one step at a time. Today’s guest is Pierogi. Pierogi protects the innocent and vulnerable from internet scammers through his channel Scammer Payback. He exposes these criminals and helps victims through his technology and cybersecurity knowledge.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:07] - Pierogi shares his background and how he got into cybersecurity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:25] - His drive to help people and get back at scammers is why he started Scammers Payback.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:03] - Scammers can get access to a bank account and ruin everything.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:32] - Pierogi shares one of the projects he worked on that actually resulted in an arrest.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:56] - Scammers know how to stay under the radar.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:31] - Those involved in organized crime consider their victims as customers.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:32] - Pierogi describes how a well-trained scammer can cater their manipulation to each individual situation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:26] - It’s a numbers game. At some point, a scammer is going to connect with someone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:04] - Scammers can learn so much about you on the internet that makes their false claims that much more believable.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:56] - A lot of the time, scammers know when to give up and move on.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:18] - Never send a text message of any type of personal identification.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:11] - Focus on the mental aspect of this.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:52] - Employees at different stores that sell gift cards are on high alert and typically do not sell certain numbers of gift cards.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:14] - In some cases, banks are even calling out possible red flags.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:31] - Financial institutions can use technology to determine behaviors that are not normal for you to indicate possible fraud.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:29] - Hackers are using known processes that are good but for bad purposes.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:58] - Major corporations have a budget for cybersecurity but regular people don’t.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:28] - Phone carriers are trying to do more to prevent scam calls.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:03] - While playing different roles, Pierogi shares that he actually “married” a scammer. He shares some of the craziest things scammers have done.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:32] - Pierogi is also learning different languages so he can learn more about where scammers are located.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:39] - A lot of the experiences of the victims and how scammers talk about them makes Pierogi emotional.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:40] - These experiences are sometimes hard to listen to.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:28] - A lot of people say they’ll know immediately if they are talking to a scammer, but it isn’t that simple.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[48:54] - If we know this information, we need to talk about it to others and educate.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[51:16] - Scammers are very good at what they do. We portray them as silly, but they are very intelligent and convincing.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCC9EjyMN_hx5NdctLBx5X7w">Scammer Payback on YouTube</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Being Foolproof to Misinformation with Sander van der Linden</title>
			<itunes:title>Being Foolproof to Misinformation with Sander van der Linden</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 30 Aug 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[d300a980-8fd2-4e0c-9f55-50874b2f9bdd]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/183]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">We’ve heard the polarizing narrative, “Either you’re with me or you’re my enemy.” Using this polarizing statement can allow people to fall prey to being manipulated. Today’s guest is Sander van der Linden. Dr. van der Linden is a professor of Social Psychology and Society and the Director of Cambridge Social Decision Making Lab in the Department of Psychology at the University of Cambridge. He is ranked among the top 1% of highly cited social scientists worldwide and has published over 150 research papers. He’s the author of <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Foolproof-Misinformation-Infects-Minds-Immunity/dp/039388144X"> Foolproof: Why Misinformation Infects Our Minds and How to Build Immunity</a>.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:01] - Sander describes what he does at Cambridge and why we began his work on this topic beginning ten years ago.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:22] - The early days of the internet created an interest for Sander as he saw that anyone could pretend to be someone else.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:01] - What exactly is misinformation?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:29] - Disinformation is the spread of misinformation with harmful or deceitful intent.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:37] - One form of disinformation is click-baited sensational headlines that seem harmless.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:32] - Sander describes some of the key phrases within content that usually indicate mis- or disinformation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:11] - Even if information is accurate, content can be written manipulatively to evoke emotion, particularly rage. This is misleading.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:01] - Most people don’t want to be a part of a flame war or in an echo chamber but the behavior is common.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:45] - Social media algorithms seem to reward toxic behavior and amplify polarization that already exists.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:31] - People are constantly being bombarded with information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:47] - Everyone is scattered in their own echo chambers because of fragmented social media.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:49] - What should platforms be doing to help limit the spread of misinformation? What should individual people do to keep themselves safe?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:01] - The brain needs a few experiences before developing a habit.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:50] - Sander explains why most people don’t have the facts to actually defend what they believe to be accurate information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:56] - Sander has developed games that help users understand misinformation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:02] - Using the example of climate change and global warming, Sander demonstrates how people can be misled.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:01] - False dichotomies are a real problem and politicians in particular use this strategy.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:50] - The goal is to help others recognize manipulation online, not necessarily to change their mind.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:41] - There are different types of scams and most are disinformation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:45] - Romance scams use these tactics. How can we inoculate people against this type of information?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:37] - Deradicalization is extremely difficult.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:20] - There’s a benefit to being somewhat skeptical. But how skeptical should you be?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[52:03] - We want to be able to live our normal lives without fear, but there needs to be a healthy amount of skepticism.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[55:18] - There are some crossovers between persuasion and manipulation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[60:42] - You can play the games Sander described at Inoculation Science.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.sandervanderlinden.com/">Sander van der Linden’s Home Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/sander-van-der-linden-156a08203/?originalSubdomain=uk"> Sander van der Linden on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://inoculation.science/">Inoculation Science Home Page</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

Dr. van der Linden is a professor of Social Psychology and Society and the Director of Cambridge Social Decision Making Lab in the Department of Psychology at the University of Cambridge. He is ranked among the top 1% of highly cited social scientists worldwide and has published over 150 research papers. He’s the author of <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Foolproof-Misinformation-Infects-Minds-Immunity/dp/039388144X"> Foolproof: Why Misinformation Infects Our Minds and How to Build Immunity</a>.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:01] - Sander describes what he does at Cambridge and why we began his work on this topic beginning ten years ago.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:22] - The early days of the internet created an interest for Sander as he saw that anyone could pretend to be someone else.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:01] - What exactly is misinformation?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:29] - Disinformation is the spread of misinformation with harmful or deceitful intent.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:37] - One form of disinformation is click-baited sensational headlines that seem harmless.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:32] - Sander describes some of the key phrases within content that usually indicate mis- or disinformation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:11] - Even if information is accurate, content can be written manipulatively to evoke emotion, particularly rage. This is misleading.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:01] - Most people don’t want to be a part of a flame war or in an echo chamber but the behavior is common.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:45] - Social media algorithms seem to reward toxic behavior and amplify polarization that already exists.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:31] - People are constantly being bombarded with information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:47] - Everyone is scattered in their own echo chambers because of fragmented social media.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:49] - What should platforms be doing to help limit the spread of misinformation? What should individual people do to keep themselves safe?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:01] - The brain needs a few experiences before developing a habit.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:50] - Sander explains why most people don’t have the facts to actually defend what they believe to be accurate information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:56] - Sander has developed games that help users understand misinformation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:02] - Using the example of climate change and global warming, Sander demonstrates how people can be misled.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:01] - False dichotomies are a real problem and politicians in particular use this strategy.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:50] - The goal is to help others recognize manipulation online, not necessarily to change their mind.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:41] - There are different types of scams and most are disinformation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:45] - Romance scams use these tactics. How can we inoculate people against this type of information?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:37] - Deradicalization is extremely difficult.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[49:20] - There’s a benefit to being somewhat skeptical. But how skeptical should you be?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[52:03] - We want to be able to live our normal lives without fear, but there needs to be a healthy amount of skepticism.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[55:18] - There are some crossovers between persuasion and manipulation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[60:42] - You can play the games Sander described at Inoculation Science.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" 			<title>Why We Fall for Scams with Chris Chabris and Dan Simons</title>
			<itunes:title>Why We Fall for Scams with Chris Chabris and Dan Simons</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 23 Aug 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[561caf38-a9b4-4192-af3c-d50c66109979]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/182]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Scammers, like magicians, use distractions and illusions to keep you from realizing what is really going on. They may choose to have you focus on something that is urgent hoping that you’ll make mistakes that you normally wouldn’t.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guests are Chris Chabris and Dan Simons. Dr. Chabris is a Cognitive Scientist who has taught at Union College in Harvard University and is a fellow of The Association for Psychological Science. His research focuses on decision-making, attention, intelligence, and behavior genetics. Chris received his PhD in Psychology from Harvard University. </p> <p dir="ltr">Dr. Daniel Simons is a professor of Psychology at the University of Illinois, where he has the Visual Cognitive Laboratory. Dan received his PhD from Cornell University. His research explores the limits of awareness and memory, the reasons why we often are unaware of those limits, and the implications of such limits on our personal and professional lives.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:18] - Dan and Chris share their background and what their current roles are in their industry.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:27] - Why did Dan and Chris decide to write a book together?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:12] - Stories of victims are engaging and interesting, but these stories don’t focus on why we are fooled.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:53] - Chris and Dan share the story of a time they were almost scammed.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:01] - Fictional stories in movies get some things right about what con artists exploit, but real scenarios are not always so precise.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:52] - We have the ability to focus on a select amount of the information in front of us.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:39] - There are a lot of different techniques that scammers employ to put you under time pressure.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:59] - Confirmation bias is the idea that you try to find evidence of what you believe.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:04] - There are a lot of theories about why we are good at some things and not as good at others.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:15] - It is logical to trust someone you know, but social media has created the opportunity to trust misinformation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:38] - Commitments are assumptions that we make and hold steadfastly to.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:41] - It is easy to trust someone when you’ve committed to your perception of them.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:33] - Ask yourself if there is anything you believe that could be proven wrong if you were given new information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:01] - External validation is a great source for seeing things you might have missed.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:48] - There are scams in literally everything, even chess.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:02] - Are scams increasing or is it awareness of scams that is increasing?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:26] - All scams employ the same principles. They are always going to rely on the same tricks and tap into the same fears.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:37] - Dan’s hope is that people will question the information they get and become less accepting.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Invisible-Gorilla-How-Intuitions-Deceive/dp/0307459667"> The Invisible Gorilla: How Our Intuitions Deceive Us by Chris Chabris and Dan Simons</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Securing IoT and Cyber Warfare with Mikko Hypponen</title>
			<itunes:title>Securing IoT and Cyber Warfare with Mikko Hypponen</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 16 Aug 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[8d4c556d-3669-4371-b628-d8deabc2f83c]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/181]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Our home IoT devices are constantly being probed for weaknesses so that they can be compromised and used for broader nefarious purposes like cyber warfare. The Ukrainians may be considered some of the best in the world when it comes to defending against cyber warfare because they have been regularly attacked and have been defending their systems for years. Today’s guest is Mikko Hypponen. He has written for The New York Times, Wired, and Scientific American and has lectured at universities like Oxford, Stanford, and Cambridge. Mikko works as the Chief Research Officer for WithSecure and sits on the advisory board of Europol.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:11] - Mikko shares his background as an old-school hacker.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:46] - His mother advised Mikko to pursue this career in the 1980s.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:23] - Smart devices like doorbells and refrigerators are not configured correctly because security makes the device more expensive.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:50] - Mikko discusses regulation in Europe and how, most of the time, regulation fails.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:03] - Many hackable devices wouldn’t be hackable if consumers read the manual.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:13] - Most malware traffic used to be Windows based but is now Linux based.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:26] - Many people don’t think that there’s any data that can be stolen from IoT devices, but they are surprisingly powerful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:16] - Mikko explains some recent attacks.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:43] - Medical devices are just as vulnerable as any other IoT device.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:41] - What is a honeypot?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:02] - Mikko shares that he has been a victim himself with his credit card number stolen twice.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:14] - Even experts make mistakes.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:26] - If you believe you have been hacked or think you are being scammed, take a step back.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:06] - Mikko describes some of his experience living so near Russia and monitoring cyber warfare.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:07] - Spying and espionage is a big problem in countries bordering Russia.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:06] - With invasions in 2022, Ukraine improved many systems.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:20] - Mikko makes a prediction on what will come next that sounds like Science Fiction, just like cyber war sounded like before.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:18] - What are Mikko’s thoughts on AI?<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://mikko.com/">Mikko.com</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>
			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Our home IoT devices are constantly being probed for weaknesses so that they can be compromised and used for broader nefarious purposes like cyber warfare. The Ukrainians may be considered some of the best in the world when it comes to defending against cyber warfare because they have been regularly attacked and have been defending their systems for years. Today’s guest is Mikko Hypponen. He has written for The New York Times, Wired, and Scientific American and has lectured at universities like Oxford, Stanford, and Cambridge. Mikko works as the Chief Research Officer for WithSecure and sits on the advisory board of Europol.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:11] - Mikko shares his background as an old-school hacker.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:46] - His mother advised Mikko to pursue this career in the 1980s.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:23] - Smart devices like doorbells and refrigerators are not configured correctly because security makes the device more expensive.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:50] - Mikko discusses regulation in Europe and how, most of the time, regulation fails.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:03] - Many hackable devices wouldn’t be hackable if consumers read the manual.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:13] - Most malware traffic used to be Windows based but is now Linux based.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:26] - Many people don’t think that there’s any data that can be stolen from IoT devices, but they are surprisingly powerful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:16] - Mikko explains some recent attacks.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:43] - Medical devices are just as vulnerable as any other IoT device.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:41] - What is a honeypot?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:02] - Mikko shares that he has been a victim himself with his credit card number stolen twice.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:14] - Even experts make mistakes.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:26] - If you believe you have been hacked or think you are being scammed, take a step back.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:06] - Mikko describes some of his experience living so near Russia and monitoring cyber warfare.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:07] - Spying and espionage is a big problem in countries bordering Russia.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:06] - With invasions in 2022, Ukraine improved many systems.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:20] - Mikko makes a prediction on what will come next that sounds like Science Fiction, just like cyber war sounded like before.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:18] - What are Mikko’s thoughts on AI?</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://mikko.com/">Mikko.com</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Behavioral Analysis From an FBI Expert with Robin Dreeke</title>
			<itunes:title>Behavioral Analysis From an FBI Expert with Robin Dreeke</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 09 Aug 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1274d138-0d4f-47a7-8dfd-c082c8f9bf4a]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/180]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Our non-verbal communication is as much or more important than what we verbally communicate. We may display mannerisms that our gut instincts pick up as just off, but a trained FBI Behavioral Analysis can pick up on these signs faster than you might expect. Today’s guest is Robin Dreeke. Robin is an accomplished executive coach, bestselling author, and professional speaker with an impressive background. As a Marine Corps officer and retired FBI Special Agent, he served as Chief of the Counterintelligence Behavior Analysis Program where he honed his skills on recruiting spies and behavioral assessment. Robin has translated his expertise into his unique interpersonal communication strategies that focus on recruiting allies in business. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:23] - Robin shares his background and previous roles in the Marine Corps and FBI.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:45] - Robin has not been a victim of a scam, but there have been many attempts and close calls.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:02] - We establish normal patterns of behavior and tempo.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:52] - Be wary of things that deviate from normal patterns of behavior.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:19] - If we’re trying to find something wrong, we miss a lot.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:07] - Robin explains why he looks for openness, honesty, and transparency in a nice even tempo.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:42] - Underneath “why” is the “what” and the “how.”</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:30] - Vulnerability is the willingness to show your shame. </p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:17] - Words are extremely powerful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:24] - The more time spent with someone, you will be able to learn their natural tempo and behavior patterns.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:34] - The techniques Robin talks about aren’t just applicable to criminal interviews, but even just personal conversations.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:07] - Master manipulators are on a timeline. Usually they’re not patient.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:52] - Sales people can also use these techniques to push the tempo out of your comfort zone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:31] - Robin only vets people based on in-person interactions now.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:12] - Robin compares reality to shows like Criminal Minds.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:43] - The actions that people will take are predictable.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:52] - Some people have the tendency to find something wrong with everyone and everything.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:08] - Focus on having a great conversation with other people.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.peopleformula.com/">People Formula Website</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/rdreeke/">Robin Dreeke on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>7 Flags of MLM with Roberta Blevins</title>
			<itunes:title>7 Flags of MLM with Roberta Blevins</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 02 Aug 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[ab4a2caa-3418-4e79-90e9-9e40acb9d54b]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/179]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Many people have ended up in an MLM because they wanted to help a friend out. But it is important to understand the red flags of how they can motivate and manipulate. Today’s guest is Roberta Blevins. Roberta is an anti-MLM advocate who starred in the Amazon Prime documentary Lula Rich and speaks out on social media against MLMs, scams, frauds, and cults and is the host of the podcast Life After MLM.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:45] - Roberta shares her background and what she does now.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:20] - In 2015, Roberta heard about LulaRoe and was initially very excited.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:34] - She wasn’t making any more than she had been making in the job she left, but was working a lot more.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:40] - Roberta realized that it wasn’t the right way to run a business and it took a toll on her and her family’s mental health.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:17] - Pressure and pushback against questions are major red flags.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:28] - Avoid being alone and being led to a second location when talking to someone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:28] - Roberta explains how different MLMs operate under a pay-to-play model.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:05] - The only way to make money is to hit qualifying monthly quotas that are a big challenge to accomplish.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:58] - What is the difference between a pyramid scheme and an MLM?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:43] - MLMs tend to invade every area of your life.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:10] - Many people have a fake-it-till-you-make-it approach which is misleading people to be recruited.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:26] - Social media plays into this fabricated lifestyle.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:42] - MLMs exploit personal relationships.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:54] - Roberta shares how “icky” it felt to keep a “dirt list”.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:38] - There are stories of some people signing up their children in order to meet their recruitment quota.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:30] - Roberta explains the history of MLMs and how they started.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:21] - MLMs aren’t going anywhere, but Roberta wants to see regulation in an unregulated space.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:48] - Roberta shares about some of the background work she is doing to help create dialogue about regulation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:12] - Social media has strengthened MLMs and has gotten more people to sign up.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:53] - In some MLMs, more than half of the sellers are making no money.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:26] - Numbers don’t lie. If you are spending or making money, you should track it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:51] - Track any amount of time you spend on the business.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:07] - Roberta outlines a strategy if you are in an MLM and deciding if it is the right fit for you.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:30] - Have someone who is unbiased listen to you. Be that person for someone else.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:35] - A company should be able to stand up to scrutiny.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Many people have ended up in an MLM because they wanted to help a friend out. But it is important to understand the red flags of how they can motivate and manipulate. Today’s guest is Roberta Blevins. Roberta is an anti-MLM advocate who starred in the Amazon Prime documentary Lula Rich and speaks out on social media against MLMs, scams, frauds, and cults and is the host of the podcast Life After MLM.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:45] - Roberta shares her background and what she does now.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:20] - In 2015, Roberta heard about LulaRoe and was initially very excited.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:34] - She wasn’t making any more than she had been making in the job she left, but was working a lot more.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:40] - Roberta realized that it wasn’t the right way to run a business and it took a toll on her and her family’s mental health.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:17] - Pressure and pushback against questions are major red flags.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:28] - Avoid being alone and being led to a second location when talking to someone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:28] - Roberta explains how different MLMs operate under a pay-to-play model.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:05] - The only way to make money is to hit qualifying monthly quotas that are a big challenge to accomplish.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:58] - What is the difference between a pyramid scheme and an MLM?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:43] - MLMs tend to invade every area of your life.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:10] - Many people have a fake-it-till-you-make-it approach which is misleading people to be recruited.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:26] - Social media plays into this fabricated lifestyle.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:42] - MLMs exploit personal relationships.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:54] - Roberta shares how “icky” it felt to keep a “dirt list”.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:38] - There are stories of some people signing up their children in order to meet their recruitment quota.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:30] - Roberta explains the history of MLMs and how they started.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:21] - MLMs aren’t going anywhere, but Roberta wants to see regulation in an unregulated space.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:48] - Roberta shares about some of the background work she is doing to help create dialogue about regulation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:12] - Social media has strengthened MLMs and has gotten more people to sign up.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:53] - In some MLMs, more than half of the sellers are making no money.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:26] - Numbers don’t lie. If you are spending or making money, you should track it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:51] - Track any amount of time you spend on the business.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:07] - Roberta outlines a strategy if you are in an MLM and deciding if it is the right fit for you.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:30] - Have someone who is unbiased listen to you. Be that person for someone else.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:35] - A company should be able to stand up to scrutiny.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" 			<title>Reading and Understanding Behavior with Chase Hughes</title>
			<itunes:title>Reading and Understanding Behavior with Chase Hughes</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 26 Jul 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[d2cbe6d1-444f-4c3d-aee8-5b937420d670]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/178]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p>A scalpel in the hand of a surgeon can be an amazing instrument. But the same tool in the hand of a person choosing to do harm is dangerous. The knowledge on how to read someone’s behavior is the same thing, either beneficial or detrimental, based on the person’s intentions.</p> <p>Today’s guest is Chase Hughes. Chase is a retired US Navy Chief and is the leading military and intelligence behavior expert with 20 years of creating the most advanced behavior skill courses and tactics available worldwide. He is a Harvard educated neuroscientist, keynote speaker, and the author of two bestselling books. He teaches elite groups of government agencies on behavior science skills, including behavior profiling, non-verbal analysis, deception detection, interrogation, and advanced behavioral investigation.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul class="lst-kix_1v88fkgk34xx-0 start"> <li>[1:08] - Chase shares his background as a US Navy Chief and his current work in educating others on behavior science skills.</li> <li>[2:45] - Chase tells the story of losing a friend as inspiration to grow his knowledge.</li> <li>[4:51] - Hidden stress signals are universal.</li> <li>[7:04] - At a certain point of understanding behaviors, Chase sees a world that is hidden right in front of everyone.</li> <li>[8:06] - In learning behaviors, focus on learning one at a time until you notice them in your day-to-day life.</li> <li>[10:03] - When it comes to psychopaths, there are certain behaviors that are hard to spot.</li> <li>[12:01] - Chase does an activity with Chris to demonstrate eye movement.</li> <li>[15:18] - When it comes to interrogation and questioning, these eye movements are very telling.</li> <li>[17:13] - Women are naturally very good at reading behavior.</li> <li>[18:02] - We learn to lie first with our face.</li> <li>[20:10] - What is a detail mountain and a detail valley?</li> <li>[23:07] - There is a reason we fall so hard for con artists and cult leader personalities.</li> <li>[25:10] - All kinds of influence follow this exact model every time: Perception, Context, Permission.</li> <li>[27:58] - The second thing that Chase teaches is how to access the mammalian brain.</li> <li>[30:36] - Anything we feel emotion about is memorized.</li> <li>[33:21] - The more we learn about this, the better we are at avoiding being manipulated.</li> <li>[34:58] - These tactics are also tools for good parenting. What is the end goal of these tools?</li> <li>[37:10] - Chase discusses some examples of the models he teaches.</li> <li>[39:41] - When it comes to confidence, people look at situations through a hierarchy lens.</li> <li>[41:10] - Chase shares the titles of his books and what they are about.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>Ever-Changing Cyber Crime with Raj Samani</title>
			<itunes:title>Ever-Changing Cyber Crime with Raj Samani</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 19 Jul 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[574c316a-f2d0-4303-9087-45131ae8a445]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/177]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">It can be difficult to quantify the impact of good CISO or IT professionals. Protecting the network, infrastructure, and data is a constant effort and they’ve got to get it right 100% of the time. But the criminals breaking in only need to get it right once. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Raj Samani. Raj is the Chief Scientist for the cyber security firm Rapid7. He has assisted multiple law enforcement agencies in cybercrime cases and is a special advisor to the European Cybercrime Centre in The Hague. Raj has been recognized for his contributions to the computer security industry through numerous awards and has co-authored several books and has been a technical editor in others.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:01] - Raj explains what he does for the cyber security firm, Rapid7, and how he got into the field.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:40] - In the beginning of his career, cyber security was more of a hobby.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:07] - There is a level of transparency, but Raj explains how things have to be absolutely certain before releasing information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:32] - Raj introduces the topic of cyber security as a service.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:11] - Without the means to physically interrogate, it is hard to confirm theories about what is happening and who is doing it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:01] - “The sooner we collectively as an industry start to provide more transparency, I think the better we’ll be.”</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:57] - We see CISOs let go when a breach takes place. It is immature as an industry since there are no metrics to measure success.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:54] - Raj shares the experience of the explosion of Covid-19 related scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:40] - As security professionals, the job is never done.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:51] - Raj compares educating your children of online safety to wearing a seatbelt in your car.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:10] - The odds are certainly in favor of the cyber criminals.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:48] - Raj explains the estimation of money saved by preventing attacks, but also explains that there’s no true way to measure this.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:20] - If we aren’t reporting incidents, the government isn’t going to do anything because we can’t prove the impact.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:29] - Because it is a global issue, international law enforcement collaboration is crucial.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:17] - Now that cybercrime is so lucrative, they can actually pay for marketing and make their content much more believable than a simple email with a link.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:30] - It is a constant case of cat and mouse.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:32] - Raj does not use the word “hacker” to describe the individuals behind attacks. They are criminals.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:18] - Raj highly recommends the book <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/CUCKOOS-EGG-Clifford-Stoll-ebook/dp/B0083DJXCM/ref=sr_1_1?crid=2SCGAMF3F15HW&keywords=cuckoo%27s+egg&qid=1687828928&sprefix=cuckoo%27s+egg%2Caps%2C173&sr=8-1"> Cuckoo’s Egg by Clifford Stoll</a>.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/rajsamani/?originalSubdomain=uk">Raj Samani on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.rapid7.com/">Rapid7 Home Page</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>What NOT to Do When Wiretapping the Government with Bryan Seely</title>
			<itunes:title>What NOT to Do When Wiretapping the Government with Bryan Seely</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 12 Jul 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[4395c7f3-19d9-4016-98d2-5ad0a4064d2d]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/176]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Bryan Seely, a world famous cyber security expert, ethical hacker, author, keynote speaker, and former US Marine. He is known for intercepting calls to the US Secret Service and FBI. We chat about why and how he did it and surprisingly why he didn’t go to jail.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:48] - Bryan shares his background, what he does now, and what he is famous for.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:10] - To show how easily hacked and manipulated Google Maps was, Bryan changed the names of locations which didn’t get their attention.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:03] - At the time, the FBI didn’t know that Bryan wiretapped them. Bryan explains how this was an issue and how he let them know.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:14] - They didn’t believe him and he explains how he proved it and what the major problems with their communications were.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:03] - At no point was Bryan arrested, but he had to show how he managed to wiretap them.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:00] - Bryan managed to record 40 calls.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:26] - Because he had no ill intent, he told them what he was doing and how he did it to help prevent it happening by others, Bryan was not charged.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:24] - Technically, Bryan didn’t do anything that wasn’t possible for anyone else to do. He didn’t hack a system, but rather saw a logic flaw.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:51] - There wasn’t technically anything wrong. It was just designed in a way that could easily be exploited.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:50] - The cost of just letting people know about a breach is high.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:44] - Bryan believes that companies should be honest about breaches and what they will do to fix the problem.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:41] - We don’t intentionally broadcast our information or location, but it is easy to guess in many cases.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:57] - There are little things that we do that we think are protecting us but are actually giving out more information than we should.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:26] - Bryan shares some tips in keeping you protected, like turning off Bluetooth and wifi on your phone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:36] - Anyone can create a wifi network and name it anything, like Starbucks Wifi or Free Airport Wifi to make it easy to have people connect.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:47] - Teach your kids how to be safe.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:42] - Bryan primarily uses authenticator apps for MFA, but any kind is helpful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:20] - Bryan is currently writing another book and loves meeting people who have done great things for cyber security education.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.bryanseely.com/">Bryan Seely Home Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/bryanthemapsguy/">Bryan Seely LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/bryanthemapsguy?lang=en">Bryan Seely on Twitter</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>
