Bryan explains how this was an issue and how he let them know.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:14] - They didn’t believe him and he explains how he proved it and what the major problems with their communications were.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:03] - At no point was Bryan arrested, but he had to show how he managed to wiretap them.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:00] - Bryan managed to record 40 calls.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:26] - Because he had no ill intent, he told them what he was doing and how he did it to help prevent it happening by others, Bryan was not charged.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:24] - Technically, Bryan didn’t do anything that wasn’t possible for anyone else to do. He didn’t hack a system, but rather saw a logic flaw.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:51] - There wasn’t technically anything wrong. It was just designed in a way that could easily be exploited.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:50] - The cost of just letting people know about a breach is high.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:44] - Bryan believes that companies should be honest about breaches and what they will do to fix the problem.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:41] - We don’t intentionally broadcast our information or location, but it is easy to guess in many cases.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:57] - There are little things that we do that we think are protecting us but are actually giving out more information than we should.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:26] - Bryan shares some tips in keeping you protected, like turning off Bluetooth and wifi on your phone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:36] - Anyone can create a wifi network and name it anything, like Starbucks Wifi or Free Airport Wifi to make it easy to have people connect.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:47] - Teach your kids how to be safe.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:42] - Bryan primarily uses authenticator apps for MFA, but any kind is helpful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:20] - Bryan is currently writing another book and loves meeting people who have done great things for cyber security education.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.bryanseely.com/">Bryan Seely Home Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/bryanthemapsguy/">Bryan Seely LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/bryanthemapsguy?lang=en">Bryan Seely on Twitter</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>The Human Side of Cyber Security with Jessica Barker</title>
			<itunes:title>The Human Side of Cyber Security with Jessica Barker</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 05 Jul 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1e528078-bcb4-4f76-acc7-682bb4b38f8e]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/175]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">The cyber security circle of information will always have some human involvement and raising awareness in how systems were designed, developed, used, and abused is critical. Today’s guest is Dr. Jessica Barker. Jessica is an award winning leader in the human side of cyber security and has delivered face to face awareness sessions to over 50,000 people. She is a best selling author, international keynote speaker, media commentator, and serves on numerous boards, including the UK government’s Cyber Security Advisory Board. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:00] - Jessica shares her background and her passion for educating people on cyber security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:34] - When it comes to personal experience, Jessica has not been a victim of a scam, but she has come close.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:49] - Being vigilant is helpful but the right phish at the right time can catch any of us.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:01] - Take a step back and talk to someone else. Seeing someone else’s perspective is helpful.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:43] - There’s a fine line between scam indicators and marketing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:51] - There are always people involved. Jessica explains the elements of the human side of cyber security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:24] - There is an assumption that the younger generation don’t care about cyber security, but it’s not accurate.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:14] - The majority of clients that Cygenta works with are corporate clients.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:33] - Every organization has a security culture already, but what kind is it?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:46] - Many departments within a company avoid cyber security and the security team and it creates an adversarial relationship and culture.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:15] - Measuring the success of cyber security is a challenge.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:57] - We need to consider our language when explaining cyber security attacks.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:57] - Jessica’s work primarily focuses on prevention.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:20] - Chris shares the experience of seeing a problem but not knowing where it was coming from.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:50] - It’s important to mitigate risk while also not being so worried all the time.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:57] - We all need education to help with critical thinking.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:14] - Education also boosts people’s confidence.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:27] - It is important to have strong organizational values and the ability to tap into people’s individual values.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:01] - Cygenta has a free resource online called <a href= "https://www.cygenta.co.uk/cyber-security-culture-guide">The Ultimate Guide to Cyber Security Culture</a>.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.cygenta.co.uk/">Cygenta</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.cygenta.co.uk/cyber-security-culture-guide">Cyber Security Culture Guide</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Confident-Cyber-Security-Started-Futureproof/dp/1789663407"> Confident Cyber Security by Dr. Jessica Barker</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Diet Culture and Wellness Traps with Christy Harrison</title>
			<itunes:title>Diet Culture and Wellness Traps with Christy Harrison</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 28 Jun 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c4350969-f04d-4def-a908-713201c22f2e]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/174]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">With the appearance of health taking focus in today’s culture, many are persuaded to try extreme trends to achieve quick weight and health results. Conventional healthcare may not always have the answers we’re looking for but it’s important to not let our fears and concerns be exploited for someone else’s profit. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Christy Harrison. Christy and a Registered Dietician Nutritionist, Certified Intuitive Eating Counselor, and a journalist who has been covering food, nutrition, and health for more than 20 years. She is the author of two books, <a href="https://christyharrison.com/the-wellness-trap">The Wellness Trap</a> and <a href= "https://christyharrison.com/book-anti-diet-intuitive-eating-christy-harrison"> Anti-Diet</a> and the producer and host of the podcasts <a href= "https://rethinkingwellness.substack.com/">Rethinking Wellness</a> and <a href="https://christyharrison.com/foodpsych">Food Psych</a> which has helped tens of thousands of people around the world think critically about diet and wellness and culture and develop a more peaceful relationship with food. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:05] - Christy shares her background and what she specializes in as a Dietician Nutritionist.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:19] - Christy describes her past experiences with disordered eating and combined her perspective with her journalism career.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:15] - Through her own recovery, she discovered her passion for helping others at a large scale.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:21] - This is not a substitute for physical or mental health advice.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:20] - There is a long history of how our current societal focus on weight and body shape has evolved.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:18] - As society developed an anti-fat approach, diets became trendy and scammy weight loss products became prevalent.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:07] - There’s a lot of motivation for scammers to make money in the health and wellness space as it is a huge industry.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:22] - Christy shares some history on the first diet book and how we are currently seeing similar trends again.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:03] - Watch out for anything that purports a product to be a cure-all.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:16] - While there are problems with mainstream healthcare, anyone who turns fear into a sales pitch is a red flag.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:02] - A lot of people in ads, especially on social media, are paid to promote a product that they probably have never tried.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:14] - Be aware of the differences between real studies and anecdotal science-sounding claims.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:32] - A problem with nutritional research is that it is mostly observational.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:15] - It’s not all down to the individual. We can certainly do things to make ourselves less susceptible, but the system needs to change.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:35] - Unless it is coming from your own medical provider who knows you and your needs, be skeptical of medical information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:17] - Before adopting a health and wellness practice, you should do research.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:39] - Check in with yourself on any emotional pull you have.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:34] - There are also claims from scammers who will say that you have to feel worse to feel better, which isn’t generally the case.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:37] - Diet culture creates a yo-yo effect for a lot of people.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:28] - Self efficacy is critical to mental health and dieting takes it away. They have a hugely negative psychological effect.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:40] - Christy shares some things to consider before making changes to your diet.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:42] - What are the things you have control over in your life? Don’t demonize yourself for the choices you make when there isn’t anything else you can choose.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:56] - There isn’t one solution for every single person.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://christyharrison.com/">ChristyHarrison.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://rethinkingwellness.substack.com/">Rethinking Wellness Podcast</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://christyharrison.com/foodpsych">Food Psych Podcast</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>
			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">With the appearance of health taking focus in today’s culture, many are persuaded to try extreme trends to achieve quick weight and health results. Conventional healthcare may not always have the answers we’re looking for but it’s important to not let our fears and concerns be exploited for someone else’s profit. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Christy Harrison. Christy and a Registered Dietician Nutritionist, Certified Intuitive Eating Counselor, and a journalist who has been covering food, nutrition, and health for more than 20 years. She is the author of two books, <a href="https://christyharrison.com/the-wellness-trap">The Wellness Trap</a> and <a href= "https://christyharrison.com/book-anti-diet-intuitive-eating-christy-harrison"> Anti-Diet</a> and the producer and host of the podcasts <a href= "https://rethinkingwellness.substack.com/">Rethinking Wellness</a> and <a href="https://christyharrison.com/foodpsych">Food Psych</a> which has helped tens of thousands of people around the world think critically about diet and wellness and culture and develop a more peaceful relationship with food. </p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:05] - Christy shares her background and what she specializes in as a Dietician Nutritionist.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:19] - Christy describes her past experiences with disordered eating and combined her perspective with her journalism career.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:15] - Through her own recovery, she discovered her passion for helping others at a large scale.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:21] - This is not a substitute for physical or mental health advice.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:20] - There is a long history of how our current societal focus on weight and body shape has evolved.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:18] - As society developed an anti-fat approach, diets became trendy and scammy weight loss products became prevalent.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:07] - There’s a lot of motivation for scammers to make money in the health and wellness space as it is a huge industry.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:22] - Christy shares some history on the first diet book and how we are currently seeing similar trends again.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:03] - Watch out for anything that purports a product to be a cure-all.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:16] - While there are problems with mainstream healthcare, anyone who turns fear into a sales pitch is a red flag.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:02] - A lot of people in ads, especially on social media, are paid to promote a product that they probably have never tried.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:14] - Be aware of the differences between real studies and anecdotal science-sounding claims.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:32] - A problem with nutritional research is that it is mostly observational.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:15] - It’s not all down to the individual. We can certainly do things to make ourselves less susceptible, but the system needs to change.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:35] - Unless it is coming from your own medical provider who knows you and your needs, be skeptical of medical information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:17] - Before adopting a health and wellness practice, you should do research.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:39] - Check in with yourself on any emotional pull you have.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:34] - There are also claims from scammers who will say that you have to feel worse to feel better, which isn’t generally the case.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:37] - Diet culture creates a yo-yo effect for a lot of people.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:28] - Self efficacy is critical to mental health and dieting takes it away. They have a hugely negative psychological effect.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[44:40] - Christy shares some things to consider before making changes to your diet.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:42] - What are the things you have control over in your life? Don’t demonize yourself for the choices you make when there isn’t anything else you can choose.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:56] - There isn’t one solution for every single person.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://christyharrison.com/">ChristyHarrison.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://rethinkingwellness.substack.com/">Rethinking Wellness Podcast</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://christyharrison.com/foodpsych">Food Psych Podcast</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>New and Improved Nigerian Scams with Ronnie Tokazowski</title>
			<itunes:title>New and Improved Nigerian Scams with Ronnie Tokazowski</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 21 Jun 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[267d5d55-3b49-4db7-9192-64c5a0dfb366]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/173]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">In this episode, we look at two sides of the Nigerian scam: The emotional, psychological, and financial damage done by scammers and the scammers we often look at as bad people doing bad things. But in some cultures, this is seen as an acceptable career option.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Ronnie Tokazowski. Ronnie has been fighting Nigerian fraud for the last seven years and has collaborated with both law enforcement and the private sector. He runs a mailing list which collaborates with victims in identifying critical pieces of information around how the fraud works as well as working with romance victims themselves.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:53] - Ronnie shares his role as a Principal Threat Advisor and the work he does with Nigerian fraud.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:10] - Seven years ago, Ronnie saw the increasing trend in Nigerian fraud and is trying to get ahead of it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:58] - Scammers operate in a way that is similar to pulling tools out of a toolbox. They know which strategies to use in different situations.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:44] - Relationships have been built with victims over months or sometimes even years, especially in romance scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:19] - Ronnie explains how emotions are targeted to build relationships with scammers.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:36] - Business email cybercrime was the number one cybercrime for seven years ago.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:41] - The more we talk about it, the more victims come forward to talk about their own experience and overcome the social stigma.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:36] - While not a scam victim, Ronnie explains a scenario in which he questioned his decisions.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:27] - There are people out there doing the work in Nigeria in getting scammers to leave the career. But it is a huge undertaking.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:50] - A common scam is to reach out on social media and try to get the target off the platform to talk.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:18] - Some scammers are victims of human trafficking doing the work against their will.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:36] - Right now with pig butchering, the belief is that the groups are organized crime groups in China.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:01] - Ronnie shares the experience in speaking with law enforcement in Nigeria.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:57] - The connections to different scams are very intricate and sophisticated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:21] - In one experiment, gift cards were purchased to give to scammers to track what they did with them.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:26] - Scammers collaborate together to find “clients” and share their list of victims to facilitate other crimes.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:50] - Ronnie shares the story of a scammer who collaborated with multiple people and wound up being involved in tons of different types of scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:12] - In Nigeria, there are a lot of tribal religions in play.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:31] - Many scammers in Nigeria will go through rituals in their attempt to manifest wealth.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:07] - One of the main motivations for scammers is their experience in poverty.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:02] - What about government intervention? How is the Nigerian government handling the situation?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:21] - In some countries, the government is also tied up in the scamming.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[45:20] - Two factor authentication is critical to security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:26] - For businesses, there should be a process to ensure money is wired correctly when necessary.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[48:10] - Ronnie doesn’t recommend investing in crypto right now especially if it sounds too good to be true.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/ronnietokazowski/">Ronnie Tokazowski on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/iHeartMalware?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor"> Ronnie Tokazowski on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://cofense.com/">Cofense.com</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

			<itunes:subtitle><![CDATA[In this episode, we look at two sides of the Nigerian scam: The emotional, psychological, and financial damage done by scammers and the scammers we often look at as bad people doing bad things. But in some cultures, this is seen as an acceptable...]]></itunes:subtitle>

		<item>
			<title>10 Types of Identity Crimes with Eva Velasquez</title>
			<itunes:title>10 Types of Identity Crimes with Eva Velasquez</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 14 Jun 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[2a8ef612-33c9-455a-bb10-7edd64bb93b9]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/172]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Recovering from identity crimes can be daunting and take a toll on your entire life, not just financially and emotionally. Once someone gains access to one of your accounts, they can work to manipulate your friends and relatives as well.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Eva Velasquez. Eva is the President and CEO of The Identity Theft Resource Center. She previously served as the Vice President of Operation for the San Diego Better Business Bureau and for 21 years at the San Diego District Attorney’s Office. She is an author, public speaker, and a recognized expert who has been featured on CBS Mornings, NBC Nightly News, New York Times, NPR, and numerous other media outlets.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:02] - Eva describes her role as CEO and President of The Identity Theft Resource Center and what the organization does.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:11] - Eva began her career in law enforcement and learned firsthand how dismissive we are of victims of identity crimes.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:26] - The great majority of these crimes go completely uninvestigated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:48] - Your energy is best spent on recovering what you’ve lost rather than trying to convict the perpetrator.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:03] - Identity theft isn’t the only identity crime.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:47] - Most scams and data breaches at this time can be considered an identity crime.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:06] - The majority of identity crimes that are reported at The Identity Theft Resource Center are caused by social engineering.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:42] - If you see some unusual activity or communication on social media from someone you know, let the real person know.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:17] - Chris shares a strategy for family passwords to verify their identity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:11] - There are several different types of identity fraud. A lot of it is credit cards, but it could be other types of loans or accounts.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:54] - Identity fraud is complicated to solve.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:00] - Eva shares the story of a victim who was car jacked and has had non-stop identity theft issues.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:24] - People who are victims of identity theft may even have major problems in getting jobs.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:42] - The number of victims who have felt suicidal after identity theft has increased year over year.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:37] - The Identity Theft Resource Center is like AAA roadside assistance. Reach out to them.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:00] - Eva shares that this is her life’s mission. She would love a world where The Identity Theft Resource Center wasn’t needed.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:22] - Password management needs to be improved.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:03] - Multi-factor authorization is absolutely necessary.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:28] - If you ever get a call from someone claiming to be from your bank, hang up and actually contact your bank using the number on your card.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:42] - We need to flip our view of “annoying” security measures.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:57] - Safeguard access to all the accounts you have, even email accounts.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[43:16] - It can take anywhere between a day and ten years to resolve identity fraud. It is very situational.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[46:03] - It may also be possible for something to appear solved but then it is in remission. </p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[47:20] - There is no shame in asking for help. It is very complicated.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.idtheftcenter.org/">The Identity Theft Resource Center</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/eva-casey-velasquez-04a86411/">Eva Velasquez on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> </ul> <p> </p>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>The Science of Social Engineering with Chris Hadnagy</title>
			<itunes:title>The Science of Social Engineering with Chris Hadnagy</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 07 Jun 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[8f2a01ce-6ab3-46a4-9cfc-2b2454b41267]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/171]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">You may be shocked to know that master manipulators utilize special tactics to impact human behavior and emotions by more than just instilling a sense of urgency. The art of persuasion can be used for both good and evil. Today’s guest is Chris Hadnagy. Chris is the author of five books on the topic of social engineering. He is a professor of social engineering at the University of Arizona as well as the CEO of Social Engineer LLC, the Innocent Lives Foundation, and the Institute for Social Engineering.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:57] - Chris shares his background and how he found himself in the field of social engineering and understanding human decision making.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:38] - It is not the case that only stupid people fall for scams and phishing emails.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:04] - There is good social engineering and Chris gives some examples.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:47] - The release of oxytocin is researched to show that it is linked to trust.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:58] - You can have oxytocin and dopamine separately but together they build a bond.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:17] - Marketing and advertising land in the gray middle area of social engineering. Is it being used for good or bad?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:14] - It is important to look at things through the lens of purpose. What is the intent behind it?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:35] - All social engineering, good and bad, use the same principles. But malicious social engineering triggers different emotions, namely fear.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:37] - Preying on fear is one way people are socially engineered, but Chris gives an example of how a company as large as Toyota was impacted by the sense of urgency.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:12] - There are so many stories of social engineering that are extremely plausible and believable.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:04] - The trend now is to use social media data and information to target people for spear phishing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:30] - If you feel any strong emotion after a request, it is a great time to pause and consider if you are being manipulated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:21] - If you ever fall for something, don’t let embarrassment make you sweep it under the rug.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:31] - The idea of an authority figure is a principle to remember, but it doesn’t always work.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:10] - In some countries, fear of authority isn’t present. But social engineers will look for the weaknesses to exploit in different environments.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:16] - Voice phishing is currently on the rise.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:21] - Chris shares about the uptick on LinkedIn requests that even targeted the US military.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:28] - Although we will see some good from AI, Chris has many concerns.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:33] - Chris describes some of the classes he teaches at the University of Arizona specifically about Social Engineering.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:17] - You can take classes online from Chris on Social-Engineer.com.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:21] - We need to understand social engineering to keep our children safe. Start having conversations early.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopherhadnagy/">Chris Hadnagy on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.social-engineer.com/social-engineer-team/">Social-Engineer LLC</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.innocentlivesfoundation.org/">Innocent Lives Foundation</a></p> </li> </ul> <p> </p>]]></description>

But social engineers will look for the weaknesses to exploit in different environments.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:16] - Voice phishing is currently on the rise.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:21] - Chris shares about the uptick on LinkedIn requests that even targeted the US military.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:28] - Although we will see some good from AI, Chris has many concerns.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:33] - Chris describes some of the classes he teaches at the University of Arizona specifically about Social Engineering.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:17] - You can take classes online from Chris on Social-Engineer.com.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:21] - We need to understand social engineering to keep our children safe. Start having conversations early.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopherhadnagy/">Chris Hadnagy on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.social-engineer.com/social-engineer-team/">Social-Engineer LLC</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.innocentlivesfoundation.org/">Innocent Lives Foundation</a></p> </li> </ul> <p> </p>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Preventing Email Attacks with Kiri Addison</title>
			<itunes:title>Preventing Email Attacks with Kiri Addison</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 31 May 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[cc9fe107-99ec-42d1-b6be-eb37a7bed764]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/170]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Phishing emails are constantly evolving to take advantage of current trends, news, and holidays. Typically poor grammar or the time an email was sent could help you identify if it is authentic. But with AI, these obvious signs may soon disappear.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Kiri Addison. Kiri is the Detection and Efficacy Product Manager at Mimecast, working on security products to defend against new and evolving threats. Previously she was head of data science for threat intelligence and has worked in the public sector creating systems to detect and prevent cyber attacks and fraud. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:59] - Kiri shares her background and what her role is at Mimecast.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:03] - Email scams are still the number one attack method and they tend to follow trends, news, and holidays.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:17] - Technology is improving and there is better protection of basic attacks, but with how fast threats evolve, there are still areas of improvement.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:34] - Kiri shares some statistics on the improvement made after implementing phishing email training.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:26] - With the use of ChatGPT, our usual red flags to look for will change.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:12] - In the advice and training by Mimecast, they explain the impact on the end user.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:08] - Kiri explains some of the different types of security measures available.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:47] - A lot of companies only implement the training with their employees to check off the compliance.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:50] - Be suspicious and take some time. Don’t feel pressured.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:05] - Look for anything abnormal, even if it is something unusual from a sender you know.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:44] - If you receive word from someone you know but it seems odd, contact the person directly to find out what’s going on.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:10] - Mimecast works primarily with corporations and businesses, but there are some personal phishing email attempts.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:44] - Some attacks combine safe sights with malicious links.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:00] - Kiri describes some of the recent trends they are seeing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:58] - As AI evolves, it is going to become harder to protect. However, it all comes down to end user awareness.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-kiri-addison-19400a55/?originalSubdomain=uk"> Dr. Kiri Addison on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.mimecast.com/">Mimecast Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>The Balance Between Privacy and Protection with John Pizzuro</title>
			<itunes:title>The Balance Between Privacy and Protection with John Pizzuro</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 24 May 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c22bb863-52dd-40a4-8255-ac870ef382ac]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/169]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Age appropriate conversations need to be taking place with children on how technology is being used to groom them. Unfortunately, many are already addicted to the dopamine fix and their relationships with a device can numb them to being preyed upon. Today’s guest is John Pizzuro. John serves as CEO of Raven, a lobbying and advocacy group that focuses on protecting children from exploitation. John was a former commander of the New Jersey Internet Crimes Against Children task force and has created a framework for other countries to use to investigate child exploitation.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:57] - John shares his background in ICAC and current role as CEO of Raven.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:08] - With the changes of technology and the availability of it in every household, behavior has changed along with it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:01] - Using the internet at home makes the internet feel like a safe place.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:16] - People manipulate others through language.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:21] - It is simple to get hooked because of the dopamine fix met with social media.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:49] - Do social media companies do enough? John says they don’t do anything and they don’t have the ability to moderate.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:01] - AI is not yet fully understood. How can it be used for good or bad?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:13] - There has to be a balance between privacy and protection. This is true for everything.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:15] - Today, we are so polarized and the result is that a solution will not be found.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:45] - Parents need to have real conversations with their children and the earlier the better. Open communication is important.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:54] - It’s not talked about openly enough because it is scary to talk about child exploitation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:30] - Device addiction is a real problem and generally speaking, there’s a need for instant gratification that distracts us from real relationships.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:10] - There are communities where people share techniques for grooming and they are extremely popular on the dark web.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:53] - John shares some terrifying statistics.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:25] - There are task forces working together to protect children from child exploitation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:30] - The task to go through digital evidence is time and resource consuming.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:28] - What is needed in the US is age appropriate child protection legislation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:03] - John explains some of the challenges in current legislation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:17] - Do we hold all these tech companies liable?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:40] - The larger the bill, the more things that people will have a problem with.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:02] - If we can articulate things the right way, this legislation can make a huge difference.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:06] - Child advocacy centers are impactful but their funding gets cut.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:16] - The challenge with research is that researchers move from project to project. And action must be a result of theories.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:25] - John shares ways you can impact this cause and who to talk to.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/johnpizzuro/">John Pizzuro on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href="https://raven.us/">Raven Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

This is true for everything.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:15] - Today, we are so polarized and the result is that a solution will not be found.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:45] - Parents need to have real conversations with their children and the earlier the better. Open communication is important.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:54] - It’s not talked about openly enough because it is scary to talk about child exploitation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:30] - Device addiction is a real problem and generally speaking, there’s a need for instant gratification that distracts us from real relationships.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:10] - There are communities where people share techniques for grooming and they are extremely popular on the dark web.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:53] - John shares some terrifying statistics.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:25] - There are task forces working together to protect children from child exploitation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:30] - The task to go through digital evidence is time and resource consuming.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:28] - What is needed in the US is age appropriate child protection legislation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:03] - John explains some of the challenges in current legislation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:17] - Do we hold all these tech companies liable?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:40] - The larger the bill, the more things that people will have a problem with.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:02] - If we can articulate things the right way, this legislation can make a huge difference.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:06] - Child advocacy centers are impactful but their funding gets cut.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:16] - The challenge with research is that researchers move from project to project. And action must be a result of theories.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:25] - John shares ways you can impact this cause and who to talk to.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/johnpizzuro/">John Pizzuro on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href="https://raven.us/">Raven Website</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Intersection of AI and Cybersecurity with Paul Valente</title>
			<itunes:title>Intersection of AI and Cybersecurity with Paul Valente</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 17 May 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[4b6c9da9-9a03-4369-a20a-98b50d6b9069]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/168]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">AI creates opportunities as well as challenges. We may need to become more skeptical about what we see and hear knowing that images and words can be generated without transparency of its creation. Today’s guest is Paul Valente. Paul is the CEO and co-founder of VISO Trust, a former CISO of Restoration Hardware, Lending Club, and ASAPP with over 20 years of technology, financial services, ecommerce, and information security innovation. Paul holds several industry designations, including Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Systems Manager (CISM) and ISO 27001 Lead Implementer.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:02] - Paul shares his background and what he does now in his career.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:23] - One of the key learning opportunities for Paul was being a victim and being involved in scams and cyberattacks.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:28] - It’s getting harder and harder now to tell something’s legitimacy with the ability to use AI to generate content for scamming.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:54] - As a consumer, when you work with a company and share your data, you are sharing it with the whole ecosystem.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:16] - It is very hard for security to be managed when there is so much data.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:58] - Surveys sometimes give a false sense of security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:21] - At VISO, they remove the friction in order to make the process scale. There are so many third parties and vendors. Focus on real information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:02] - Security is not a solved problem. There are always imperfections.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:07] - There’s a variety of different responses to cybersecurity breaches.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:46] - Companies who are transparent about breaches tend to be seen as good companies. It’s how you handle it and take steps to communicate.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:27] - We’ve been trained to look for errors but today, with the use of generative AI, it is easier for scammers to create perfect messages.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:30] - We need to learn ways to improve our ability to discern real content from fake content.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:46] - AI also creates unique opportunities.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:47] - We still tend to have the idea of AI being a sentient being based on science fiction. So what is AI?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:12] - It’s all about shrinking the problem space.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:17] - AI growth and what is called the Cyber Kill Chain will happen incrementally.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:55] - Be aware of where you are communicating. You will need to look hard when it comes to social engineering.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://visotrust.com/">VISO Trust Website</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/pauldvalente/">Paul Valente on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Financial Vulnerability and Social Isolation with Marti DeLiema, PhD</title>
			<itunes:title>Financial Vulnerability and Social Isolation with Marti DeLiema, PhD</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 10 May 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1ad53ef9-e2ec-4e0b-b572-49d6c0006f9c]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/167]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">If you experience any high pressure tactics or urgency that someone needs you to make a financial decision fast, take a pause and realize that you might be talking to a scammer. Today’s guest is Professor Marti DeLiema. Marti is an Assistant Professor and Gerontologist at the University of Minnesota. Her work focuses on identifying the extent and cost of financial fraud in the US as well as factors related to financial victimization of the aging. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:48] - Marti shares her background and as a gerontologist, her focus on the aging.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:02] - When doing her research, Marti discovered that fraud is not limited to the elderly.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:16] - Why are older adults more likely to be targeted?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:50] - Executive functioning skills decline earlier than other abilities.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:30] - Social isolation can take form in a few different ways.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:47] - People who are grieving a loss are even more susceptible to scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:38] - Underreporting is a really big problem in the research and it is common among older adults and older victims.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:26] - Marti recommends reporting scams to the Federal Trade Commission.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:38] - To help prevent potential issues, start to think about who in your family or close circle can help make financial decisions.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:08] - Bringing people in actually makes you more in control.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:02] - There is a societal stigma about being a victim of a scam and it prevents older adults from sharing the situation for help.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:20] - There is a huge shift in our population in our demographics and the largest wealth transfer coming.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:09] - The world is very complex right now, especially when it comes to communication, technology, and finances.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:10] - Financial institutions can help prevent scams through strong customer service and education.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:36] - Marti shares an experience overhearing a retail manager explaining why he wouldn’t let an elderly customer purchase any more gift cards.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:50] - Scammers will warn victims that they will be asked specific questions about their gift card purchase. <strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/marti-deliema-95323535/">Marti DeLiema on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

Bringing people in actually makes you more in control.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:02] - There is a societal stigma about being a victim of a scam and it prevents older adults from sharing the situation for help.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:20] - There is a huge shift in our population in our demographics and the largest wealth transfer coming.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:09] - The world is very complex right now, especially when it comes to communication, technology, and finances.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:10] - Financial institutions can help prevent scams through strong customer service and education.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:36] - Marti shares an experience overhearing a retail manager explaining why he wouldn’t let an elderly customer purchase any more gift cards.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:50] - Scammers will warn victims that they will be asked specific questions about their gift card purchase. </p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey.
