		<item>
			<title>Employment Scams Are On The Rise with Mike Kiser</title>
			<itunes:title>Employment Scams Are On The Rise with Mike Kiser</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 03 May 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[ccb25be4-71f7-4ccb-9e87-f919d1ae5ba0]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/166]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Identities are under attack and with few ways to either validate or authenticate, it’s difficult to know whether a company or person you are communicating with is fake or not. Today’s guest is Mike Kiser. Mike Kiser is currently the Director of Strategy and Standards at SailPoint. He speaks regularly at events such as The European Identity Conference and The RSA Conference. He is a member of several standards groups and has presented identity related research at Black Hat and DevCon.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:46] - Mike shares his current role at SailPoint and what he does to help people protect themselves online.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:48] - As identity has risen in importance, so have job scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:44] - The rise is not surprising, as more people look for remote work.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:50] - Generally, employment scams are targeting remote and online applicants.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:10] - Mike describes some of the ways these scams work including receiving fake checks and wording to target those who are looking for side work.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:04] - Fake LinkedIn accounts are on the rise and it is very easy to target specific types of people and build off of common connections.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:01] - In 2019, Mike created a fake profile and he describes the easy infiltration to any organization’s LinkedIn connection.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:47] - There has been an obvious uptick in generic LinkedIn contact in the last few months.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:13] - Business people need to connect, so it can be tricky. Mike explains how to take a close look at new connections.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:13] - With generative AI, communications are even more convincing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:41] - Falsified job applications are also on the rise.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:33] - Fake identities are more and more in play for different malicious use cases, not just for jobs.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:58] - Mike shares the experience of a family member realizing that they were talking to a scammer.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:08] - We all customize a resume to match a job, but AI is making things much more challenging.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:05] - Applicants and potential new hires will be able to easily outsource and it will become more common.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:22] - The pandemic accelerated the importance of validating identity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:31] - There is also a unique opportunity for privacy to be changed right now and there is some good potential.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:40] - Multi-factor authentication fatigue is a real problem.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:27] - Eventually, Mike believes all things will shift to QR codes.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:17] - What are the pros and cons of QR codes and how can they change the user experience?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:24] - The job market is going to continually change and we have to learn how to interact with people differently.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.sailpoint.com/">SailPoint Website</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/mike-kiser/">Mike Kiser on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://mikekiser.org/">MikeKiser.org</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>The Impact of the Metaverse with Mark van Rijmenam</title>
			<itunes:title>The Impact of the Metaverse with Mark van Rijmenam</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 26 Apr 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[de450d19-7ae4-40b8-9426-49cc92d24f6e]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/165]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">With all of the AI advances and the metaverse, people will face the decision on how to embrace the technology because it will become unavoidable. Today’s guest is Dr. Mark van Rijmenam. Mark is The Digital Speaker. He is a leading strategic futurist who thinks about how technology changes organizations, society, and the metaverse. Mark is an international keynote speaker, five time author, and entrepreneur. He is the founder of <a href= "https://datafloq.com/">Datafloq</a> and the author of the book <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Step-into-Metaverse-Immersive-Trillion-Dollar/dp/1119887577"> Step Into the Metaverse</a>. His mission is to help organizations and governments benefit from the innovative emerging technology while ensuring that it is done ethically and responsibly. Recently he founded the Digital Futures Institute which focuses on ensuring a fair digital future for everyone. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:03] - Mark shares his background and current endeavors in the field.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:40] - Using ChatGPT, Mark wrote a book and you can’t really tell until the end.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:02] - After a while, the patterns are noticeable.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:49] - Start understanding the metaverse but understanding what it is not.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:40] - “What the metaverse is is when the physical and the digital world converge. It’s nothing more than the next iteration of the internet. We move from a 2D internet to a 3D internet.”</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:49] - When the digital comes into the physical, we get augmented reality and it has very interesting uses.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:37] - The problem with the next iteration of the internet is how to behave in this new world.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:32] - Right now, the newer generation has less distinction between the digital and physical world.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:03] - Some people’s behavior is unacceptable online and some don’t realize how public their actions are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:14] - We already see a problem with people not recognizing the distinction between digital and physical. Some are already addicted to social media.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:11] - With the heavy use of digital content with children, it will become harder for the next generation to separate the two.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:33] - The transition is so fast that we don’t know what the implications are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:18] - Education is crucial but no one is teaching us how to use this emerging technology.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:18] - Children and adolescents are particularly impacted by this transition.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:23] - When earning his doctorate, Mark had to have permission to do his research for ethical reasons.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:57] - We don’t have to use social media and emerging technology as it becomes available.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:20] - How can education keep up with the speed of change?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:30] - ChatGPT shouldn’t be banned. You have to embrace and adopt new technology so we can teach students how to use it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:48] - We are moving into a voice-world. What does that mean and how is it different from how we interact with the internet now?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:20] - Mark describes what is necessary for this to be successful. It’s possible but it requires a lot of work. We should act now.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:49] - There are things that need to change, specifically in education, verification, and regulation.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://datafloq.com/">Datafloq</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Step-into-Metaverse-Immersive-Trillion-Dollar/dp/1119887577"> Step Into the Metaverse by Mark van Rijmenam</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

He is the founder of <a href= "https://datafloq.com/">Datafloq</a> and the author of the book <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Step-into-Metaverse-Immersive-Trillion-Dollar/dp/1119887577"> Step Into the Metaverse</a>. His mission is to help organizations and governments benefit from the innovative emerging technology while ensuring that it is done ethically and responsibly. Recently he founded the Digital Futures Institute which focuses on ensuring a fair digital future for everyone. </p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:03] - Mark shares his background and current endeavors in the field.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:40] - Using ChatGPT, Mark wrote a book and you can’t really tell until the end.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:02] - After a while, the patterns are noticeable.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:49] - Start understanding the metaverse but understanding what it is not.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:40] - “What the metaverse is is when the physical and the digital world converge. It’s nothing more than the next iteration of the internet. We move from a 2D internet to a 3D internet.”</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:49] - When the digital comes into the physical, we get augmented reality and it has very interesting uses.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:37] - The problem with the next iteration of the internet is how to behave in this new world.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:32] - Right now, the newer generation has less distinction between the digital and physical world.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:03] - Some people’s behavior is unacceptable online and some don’t realize how public their actions are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:14] - We already see a problem with people not recognizing the distinction between digital and physical. Some are already addicted to social media.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:11] - With the heavy use of digital content with children, it will become harder for the next generation to separate the two.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:33] - The transition is so fast that we don’t know what the implications are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:18] - Education is crucial but no one is teaching us how to use this emerging technology.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:18] - Children and adolescents are particularly impacted by this transition.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:23] - When earning his doctorate, Mark had to have permission to do his research for ethical reasons.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:57] - We don’t have to use social media and emerging technology as it becomes available.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:20] - How can education keep up with the speed of change?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:30] - ChatGPT shouldn’t be banned. You have to embrace and adopt new technology so we can teach students how to use it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:48] - We are moving into a voice-world. What does that mean and how is it different from how we interact with the internet now?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:20] - Mark describes what is necessary for this to be successful. It’s possible but it requires a lot of work. We should act now.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:49] - There are things that need to change, specifically in education, verification, and regulation.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://datafloq.com/">Datafloq</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Step-into-Metaverse-Immersive-Trillion-Dollar/dp/1119887577"> Step Into the Metaverse by Mark van Rijmenam</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Questions to Ask When Vetting a Job or Business Offer with Jeff Lerner</title>
			<itunes:title>Questions to Ask When Vetting a Job or Business Offer with Jeff Lerner</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 19 Apr 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[66781ce3-df70-4bd4-af32-7141e9ad7bdb]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/164]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Business opportunities can entice you to believe that you can make large amounts of money in a short period of time. It’s important to verify proof of their claims before joining and knowing how to research this can save you time and money.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Jeff Lerner. Jeff is a five time Inc. 5000 CEO with over $100 million in sales. In 2019, he founded Entre Institute, the world’s first institute of higher learning for entrepreneurs which is now one of the fastest growing education and technology companies in the world.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:12] - Jeff shares his background as an entrepreneur and the creation of Entre Institute.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:26] - When you do the entrepreneurship work legitimately, it can be very lucrative.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:18] - The way people work in their chosen industry works a lot differently in this generation than it did in the past, with people changing companies often.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:25] - There are four ways to earn money in the entrepreneurial industry.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:25] - Jeff thinks about the current economy as wilderness. The key is to have a guide and a map.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:57] - The number one thing when vetting opportunities is to verify social proof.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:10] - The responsibility is on the provider of the opportunity, but vetting them is on you.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:29] - If you understand the mechanics of business, you'll see through the smoke screen. If not, you’ll be enticed by the smoke screen.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:49] - There are a lot of people who are coming from a place of desperation who will say whatever needs to be said to bring in an income.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:00] - How do you know the right questions to ask?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:44] - There are job scams and business opportunity scams. </p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:39] - If you are offered a commission but it’s not a sales job, question what you are being asked to do.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:12] - You should never have to spend money to make money in a legitimate business opportunity.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:42] - It’s okay to have a level of attractive compensation as long as it is coupled with skills needed to realistically bring in that amount.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:10] - A lot of people feel very discouraged and frustrated with the management of the economy and entrepreneurship sounds appealing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:20] - There are a lot of amazing stories of people making tons of money with few skills, but they are few and far between.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:14] - Nothing worthwhile is easy. If you embrace getting better rather than things being easier, you will be scam proof.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/@JeffLernerofficial">Jeff Lerner on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.entreinstitute.com/">ENTRE Institute Website</a></p> </li> </ul> <p> </p>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Predicting Network Vulnerability with Hari Ravichandran</title>
			<itunes:title>Predicting Network Vulnerability with Hari Ravichandran</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 12 Apr 2023 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[a250a85c-fa85-4984-8baa-d5d903e4b555]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/163]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">If AI knows your data patterns, it can help keep families safe online by preventing cyber security incidents from happening rather than just reacting once they do. Today’s guest is Hari Ravichandran. As an engineer by trade and entrepreneur by nature, Hari has a track record of founding successful businesses in technology and security. After a painful personal experience with identity theft, Hari founded Aura, a way to simplify digital security for consumers. He has since grown Aura into a business worth over 2.5 billions dollars dedicated to creating a safer internet for everyone through an intelligent, proactive platform.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:57] - Hari shares his role as founder and CEO of Aura as well as his experiences that created the drive to launch the organization.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:47] - There’s no real way for Hari to know how his identity was stolen, but he has a theory.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:08] - The ones responsible for this had several months of impacting Hari’s credit.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:09] - This situation was a lengthy ordeal.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:38] - Aura began as reactive as are many security programs. But now they have morphed into being proactive.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:48] - Based on patterns they see, Aura predicts what could happen to the consumer and gives a direction on where to focus protection.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:08] - AI can even determine the intent of a conversation as it's happening on the phone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:40] - Chris shares an example of a time when a credit card of his was cloned and how it was used.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:08] - Alerts are really helpful but too many could become an annoyance and then ignored.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:09] - It is advised to contact your banks and credit card companies when you travel to notify them that the alerts won’t shut things off.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:50] - Hari continues to be amazed by how many scams there are and how ingenious and clever they are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:32] - Without AI and learning systems, it would be impossible due to how many variants of scams there are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:09] - Do not use the same password across devices and services.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:22] - When it comes to two-factor authorization, it has to be usable.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:31] - Some security is better than no security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:17] - Hari describes the book he has available that acts as a guide for consumers.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:24] - Take a look at things that need firmware updates and how long they have gone without one.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:03] - Do you have enough sentries in place that can help protect?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:39] - Aura takes into consideration everyone’s unique needs based on how they use the internet.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:18] - Ease of use is a compromise to security.<strong><br /></strong></p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">If AI knows your data patterns, it can help keep families safe online by preventing cyber security incidents from happening rather than just reacting once they do. Today’s guest is Hari Ravichandran. As an engineer by trade and entrepreneur by nature, Hari has a track record of founding successful businesses in technology and security. After a painful personal experience with identity theft, Hari founded Aura, a way to simplify digital security for consumers. He has since grown Aura into a business worth over 2.5 billions dollars dedicated to creating a safer internet for everyone through an intelligent, proactive platform.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:57] - Hari shares his role as founder and CEO of Aura as well as his experiences that created the drive to launch the organization.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:47] - There’s no real way for Hari to know how his identity was stolen, but he has a theory.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:08] - The ones responsible for this had several months of impacting Hari’s credit.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:09] - This situation was a lengthy ordeal.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:38] - Aura began as reactive as are many security programs. But now they have morphed into being proactive.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:48] - Based on patterns they see, Aura predicts what could happen to the consumer and gives a direction on where to focus protection.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:08] - AI can even determine the intent of a conversation as it's happening on the phone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:40] - Chris shares an example of a time when a credit card of his was cloned and how it was used.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:08] - Alerts are really helpful but too many could become an annoyance and then ignored.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[18:09] - It is advised to contact your banks and credit card companies when you travel to notify them that the alerts won’t shut things off.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:50] - Hari continues to be amazed by how many scams there are and how ingenious and clever they are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:32] - Without AI and learning systems, it would be impossible due to how many variants of scams there are.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:09] - Do not use the same password across devices and services.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:22] - When it comes to two-factor authorization, it has to be usable.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:31] - Some security is better than no security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:17] - Hari describes the book he has available that acts as a guide for consumers.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:24] - Take a look at things that need firmware updates and how long they have gone without one.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:03] - Do you have enough sentries in place that can help protect?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:39] - Aura takes into consideration everyone’s unique needs based on how they use the internet.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:18] - Ease of use is a compromise to security.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/hari-ravichandran/">Hari Ravichandran on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.aura.com/">Aura Website</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Intelligent-Safety-Protect-Connected-Cybercrime/dp/1510774963"> Intelligent Safety: How to Protect Your Connected Family from Big Cybercrime</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>The Importance of Testing Your Cybersecurity Response with Steve Orrin</title>
			<itunes:title>The Importance of Testing Your Cybersecurity Response with Steve Orrin</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 05 Apr 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[2d21b9d2-a5b8-4b7e-88cc-c8e9bba89aaa]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/162]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Cyberattacks can happen to an individual computer or an entire network. It’s vital to have well-tested plans in place before ransomware rears its ugly head. Today’s guest is Steve Orrin. Steve is Intel’s Federal CTO and Senior Principal Engineer. He leads public sector solutions architecture, strategy, and engagement and has held technology leadership positions at Intel. Steve was previously CTO, CSO, and co-founder of several successful security startups and is a recognized expert and frequent lecturer on enterprise security.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:01] - Steve shares what his current role is at Intel Corporation and how he became drawn to the field.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:52] - There are risks everywhere. Where do we start when it comes to cybersecurity for a business?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:54] - Steve describes risk profiles and what you need to understand what you’re trying to protect.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:21] - Once you know your environment and risk profile, it’s time to look at the key things above security “hygiene” and the processes to raise the bar.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:48] - There are benefits to microsegmentation, including smaller network enclaves.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:44] - Steve makes a suggestion for network segmentation when it comes to state of the art equipment.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:07] - Ideally, you want sensors in every network enclave but that isn’t always realistic.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:57] - Having network segmentation will also give you the information needed to find which part of your business receives an attack.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:39] - How do we protect data in the cloud?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:04] - It all goes back to understanding the data you need to protect.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:01] - Just like in your business, you need to know how your IT resources are being used and which ones are not right.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[23:20] - These building blocks help you see how you are utilizing security and it needs to be built in from the beginning.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:55] - Changing approaches in large organizations can seem challenging, but Steve says they are constantly modernizing and it’s all about perception.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[26:24] - Literally any type of company can be attacked because of every industry’s reliance on digital tools and infrastructure.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:16] - There are different types of attackers - those who target someone specific, those who are opportunistic, and those who are purely automated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:44] - Everyone is a potential target even if you aren’t being targeted.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:33] - Planning will also help answer the question of how to continue running the business while ransomware is active.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:21] - Companies need to adopt a gamified system to train everyone in the organization on how to respond to an attack.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:13] - Supply chain issues exist in cybersecurity, but it’s not the same as other industries. They are problems that they are actively searching for a solution for.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[38:26] - When it becomes a requirement and in a contract, it will be adhered to. </p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:26] - There are a lot of programs out there looking for the anomaly, but Steve says we aren’t looking in the right place.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:33] - Take all reports of suspicious activity seriously.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/sorrin">Steve Orrin on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/government/public-sector-solutions-overview.html"> Public Sector on Intel’s Website</a></p> </li> </ul> <p> </p>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Crypto Fraud and Recovery Scams with Nick Smart</title>
			<itunes:title>Crypto Fraud and Recovery Scams with Nick Smart</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 29 Mar 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[145a5f3a-e367-4ece-aa20-55b3445a672f]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/161]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">We are all being targeted by imposters on social media, websites, and dating sites. Once a person has been scammed, your information can be added to a database where criminals can purchase your data and then offer you “recovery assistance” from that scam. Today’s guest is Nick Smart. Nick has 18 years experience as a professional Intelligence and Security Analyst working for government agencies and private companies as well as experience as a compliance officer.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[0:57] - Nick describes his current role and his background in security.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:41] - Nick admits that he is generally very pessimistic and initially wasn’t drawn to the crypto industry.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:55] - 			<title>A Mentalist, Psychic, and Magician Walk Into a Bar… with Mark Edward</title>
			<itunes:title>A Mentalist, Psychic, and Magician Walk Into a Bar… with Mark Edward</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 22 Mar 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[b11923ab-0fbb-487e-b075-34b8f041e3b7]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/160]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">There’s one common desire that allows you to be taken advantage of or to be manipulated that leaves you wanting to kick yourself for not doing one simple thing to prevent it. Today’s guest is Mark Edward. Mark is a professional mentalist who has specialized in magic of the mind for over 35 years. He travels internationally as a skeptical activist using his skills as a mentalist to teach and promote critical thinking.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:01] - Mark shares his interesting background in magic and as a mentalist.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:03] - As a starving artist, Mark formed a group with other magicians and began street performing.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:33] - If people want to believe in it, it’s mentalism.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:09] - When working as a medium, Mark learned about people’s desire for things to be true.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:41] - Mark describes the 900 years where people could call psychics on the phone.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:27] - After his years in the field, Mark wrote a book.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:42] - Mark shares his experience moving over into the skeptic community.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:20] - Scams are like magicians because it’s all manipulation and performance.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:35] - In some cases, Mark investigated people who claimed to be able to do something that genuinely believed they could.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:14] - Don’t be fooled by those who know things about you. A lot of things can be determined through observation.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:13] - These days there are Zoom calls for sessions with psychics and they have the internet at their fingertips to search for information.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[31:08] - Mark explains what a pre-show is and some of the ways to manipulate getting information ahead of time.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[33:19] - What is the difference between a mentalist and a psychic?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[37:28] - No matter what you know, you can still fall for things if you really want to believe them.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[40:40] - Generally speaking, most Americans don’t want to be told the truth, but rather be told what they want to hear.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[42:44] - Manipulation is the lowest form of humanity.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "http://themarkedward.com/">Mark Edward’s Website</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Psychic-Blues-Confessions-Conflicted-Medium/dp/1936239272"> Psychic Blues by Mark Edward</a></p> </li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Cybercrime is Costing Us More Than Just Money with Rory Innes</title>
			<itunes:title>Cybercrime is Costing Us More Than Just Money with Rory Innes</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 15 Mar 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[4aed911d-38fa-4e05-a397-f47d0405d952]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/159]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">After being scammed, embarrassment can prevent people from getting the help they need, but in order to destigmatize the painful mistake, more people need to report incidents and understand that it happens to even the most technically savvy. </p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Rory Innes. Rory has spent his entire career in cybersecurity and has worked for leading global cybersecurity companies in a range of senior management positions. Rory spotted the huge gap in support for victims of cybercrime and online harm and created the Cyber Helpline to mobilize the cybersecurity community to step in and fill the gap. As CEO, Rory is responsible for the strategic, direction, performance, and operational effectiveness of the Cyber Helpline. Rory often provides comment and opinion for the press and has appeared on live TV and documentaries providing his expert opinion on cybercrime.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:10] - Rory shares what Cyber Helpline is and his motivation to start it up.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:26] - There are different types of cybersecurity such as commercial issues and personal concerns.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:31] - Now, Cyber Helpline sees an average of 2,000 reports a month.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[5:53] - Cyber Helpline began as a UK only organization, but they are now looking to help globally.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:11] - Rory shares the types of things reported and the things that have been surprising over the last five years.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:35] - In many places across the world, Covid-19 had a huge impact on the economy and the rise of scams.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:46] - Hacked social media accounts are really common and can be really detrimental to the people in your network.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:00] - Investment scams are also very commonly seen and you may not see the problem for a while.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:43] - Hypervigilance from the threat of cyberstalking makes things mentally draining, scary, and creates difficulty for them to be believed.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:36] - Rory describes the process of investigating and helping a victim through a cyberstalking case.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:50] - Misconceptions are created and then spread wide through crime stories, social media, and crime shows or movies.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:46] - Rory has spent his entire career in cybersecurity and has worked for leading global cybersecurity companies in a range of senior management positions. As CEO, Rory is responsible for the strategic, direction, performance, and operational effectiveness of the Cyber Helpline. 			<title>The 4 P’s of Scams with Anthony “AJ” Monaco</title>
			<itunes:title>The 4 P’s of Scams with Anthony “AJ” Monaco</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 08 Mar 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[06d22d43-3629-4f16-b8c6-efe26d2d1f44]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/158]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Scamming is a multi-billion dollar industry that is creative and evolving. The National Consumer Protection Week is geared toward education and the National Slam the Scam Day focuses specifically on government imposter scams. Today’s guest is Anthony “AJ” Monaco. AJ currently serves as a special agent in charge of the major case unit at the Social Security Administration Office of Inspector General. His unit investigates complex fraud cases with a particular emphasis on Social Security Administration imposter scams and organized fraud rings. AJ has over 30 years of combined federal law enforcement, Marine officer, and legal experience. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:00] - AJ shares his current role and what he manages at the Social Security Administration.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[2:59] - The Secret Service is also a leader in financial fraud.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:01] - Government imposter fraud is when a scammer presents themselves as a government official, specifically from the Social Security Administration.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:04] - Scams evolve the way business evolves. Scammers take notice of human nature.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[7:56] - Scammers pay great attention to everything including social media and the news.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[9:09] - Sometimes these government imposter scammers will present fake credentials but real officials won’t send credentials through text or email.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[11:02] - Scammers have shifted back to physical mail because that is generally the way the government contacts you.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:21] - You can report calls from phone numbers that you suspect are fraudulent.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[14:26] - For any phone call or text you get, do a search online to see if there’s anything that the phone number comes back as.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[16:50] - If you get physical mail, there will be some minor things that could stand out as suspicious.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:39] - Once scammers get past your initial barriers, they are easier to believe.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:40] - The 4 P’s are the “Phony Phundamentals” and they are Pretend, Problem, Pressure, and Pay.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[22:01] - When it comes to the Pay step, scammers will ask for money in a way that is not standard for sending money to a real government official.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:37] - Gift card scams seem like they wouldn’t be easy to fall for, but once a scammer gets past the barrier, it is easier to convince targets.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[28:01] - Purchasing and sending gift cards are almost impossible to trace.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[30:09] - AJ describes a recent organized crime ring that they were successful in shutting down.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:58] - How likely will a victim of fraud get their money back when investigated by the Social Security Administration?</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[36:02] - Be suspicious if someone reaches out to tell you that they will be able to get your money back.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[39:40] - AJ explains what Slam the Scam Day is.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[41:09] - <a href= "https://consumer.ftc.gov/features/national-consumer-protection-week"> National Consumer Protection Week</a> is this week and Slam the Scam Day is soon!</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://consumer.ftc.gov/features/national-consumer-protection-week"> National Consumer Protection Week: Slam the Scam Day</a></p> </li> </ul> <p> </p>]]></description>

			<title>5 Ways to Manage Your Reputation with Darren Dunner</title>
			<itunes:title>5 Ways to Manage Your Reputation with Darren Dunner</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 01 Mar 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[15eebf3b-6ad5-4b3e-9898-1a57b8778787]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/157]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p dir="ltr">Have you ever Googled yourself to see what information is available about you? Knowing how to remove some of your private information or negate the impact of a negative review can make a big difference to your personal or professional reputation.</p> <p dir="ltr">Today’s guest is Darren Dunner. Darren is a digital marketing and SEO guru with a track record of results-driven leadership. As Net Reputation’s VP of Reputation Management Operations, he provides expert insight and mentorship needed to consistently prove and optimize deliverables. He helps people and companies protect and correct their online reputation.</p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[1:04] - Darren shares his background and what his current role is in Reputation Management.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[3:44] - If you follow their guidelines, Google can follow and understand what you are trying to accomplish. </p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[4:53] - Online reputation for a company could be reviews, information in articles, blog posts, or videos.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[6:04] - Posts without consequences in mind can be detrimental.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[8:28] - Darren and Chris describe a scenario of someone needing to do damage control.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[10:19] - Negative sentiments are click bait and move through Google faster.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[12:09] - There’s a lot more impact for public figures due to notoriety.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:06] - Digital marketing and reputation management is surprisingly complicated.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[13:58] - Reputation management takes a long time, usually at least more than a year.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[15:52] - Darren lists some of the things he does to help manage reputation and how much work it really is.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[17:46] - Life online means that other people find out about what is going on in your life and that could have both good and bad consequences.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[19:07] - Darren’s advice is to only focus on putting out positive things online.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[20:01] - Searches are geo targeted so your search results will be different than someone searching the same thing in a different location.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[21:44] - For a company, it is important to have enough things out there that are connected properly to Google so your page is top in searches.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[24:01] - Location is important to keep in mind for potential customers or clients to search.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[25:18] - Darren explains a situation with a negative piece used in email marketing that brought up a huge uproar.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[27:29] - You can catch things ahead of time as long as you prepare for it.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[29:14] - You can’t always prepare for a bad review, but train employees and team members that things they do can be used against them and the company.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[32:44] - Two factor authorization is crucial to keep your assets protected.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[34:00] - No one you know will ever ask you for any authentication code.</p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation">[35:07] - If you have a social media account, use it. Don’t let it sit unused.</p> </li> </ul> <p dir="ltr">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ">Easy Prey on YouTube</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></p> </li> <li dir="ltr" aria-level="1"> <p dir="ltr" role="presentation"><a href= "https://www.netreputation.com/">NetReputation.com</a></p> </li> </ul> <p> </p>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>3 Steps to Take After a Data Breach with Robert Anderson Jr.</title>
			<itunes:title>3 Steps to Take After a Data Breach with Robert Anderson Jr.</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 22 Feb 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[8a3c8d0c-04cb-4c18-920d-62c3e8e1cf1d]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/156]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Taking a proactive approach versus a reactive approach to cybersecurity makes a big difference for the stress levels of employees and customers. The daily conversations that take place with management can change the impact of a ransomware attack remarkably. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Robert Anderson Jr. Robert is a national security expert, author, and business leader dedicated to helping companies improve cybersecurity and reduce business risk. As Chairman and CEO of Cyber Defense Labs, he brings decades of executive leadership and operational experience in cybersecurity, counterintelligence, economy espionage, and critical incident response. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:57] - Robert describes his current role as CEO of Cyber Defense Labs and his background in the FBI.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:14] - The plan for Robert going into cybersecurity evolved over the decades of his career as a direct result of the evolution of how crime is committed.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:52] - Anything you can do before something bad happens is the best thing for your company.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:42] - Once a breach happens, it goes beyond inconvenience and risk for clients. It could mean the end of a business.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:01] - In Robert’s experience, most companies have a plan but the plan hasn’t been tested and doesn’t hold up to an actual data breach.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:01] - Robert describes scenarios while working in the FBI in companies choosing to pay ransoms after being hit with ransomware.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:10] - The larger the company, the more complicated this becomes.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:50] - Breaches have changed in recent years and now ask for millions of dollars.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:45] - Chris and Robert recommend approaching practicing for possible breaches like fire drills.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:03] - Robert advocates for being informed and understanding all laws when getting involved with ransomware.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:57] - The reason why ransomware is so prevalent is it's a trillion dollar industry. Bad guys are making a lot of money.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:26] - Hacking ability or high level hacking is not necessary to perform a breach anymore.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:10] - Skilled hackers make even more money because they are often contracted for jobs.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:36] - Robert believes there should be a global set of norms similar to the UN when it comes to what the world will tolerate when it comes to cybersecurity.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:30] - The first call a company makes is not for help. It’s for mitigation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:18] - In Robert’s organization, cybersecurity is a daily conversation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:03] - Robert will not open a single email if he does not know who it is from.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:10] - Logging onto public wifi can be dangerous.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:55] - Your frontline of your company is made up of your employees. Educate them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:58] - You must have an internal and external communication plan.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:31] - What are three things you can do</span> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">after</span></em> <span style="font-weight: 400;">a breach?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[42:31] - Chris gives an example of proper communication from a company that included their proactive approach and a timeline.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[45:32] - Communicating with customers is important but it is equally as important to communicate with your team.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[46:36] - When it comes to class action lawsuits, nowadays, even employees can sue the company.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://cyberdefenselabs.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Cyber Defense Labs Website</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Top 10 Amazon Scams with Abigail Bishop</title>
			<itunes:title>Top 10 Amazon Scams with Abigail Bishop</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 15 Feb 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f2cf53a3-b73a-4c32-b4e1-2c5b84a5bda4]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/155]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Scammers are creatively trying to deceive and manipulate Amazon customers by getting them to do activities outside the Amazon ecosystem through texts, emails, and phone calls. Hopefully by looking at how the top scams are implemented, we can create more awareness and prevent loss.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today's guest is Abigail Bishop. Abigail is the Head of External Relations for Scam Prevention at Amazon, where she leads the organization’s outreach work to protect customers from falling victim to scams globally. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:56] - Abigail shares her background and what she does at Amazon as the Head of External Relations for Scam Prevention.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:46] - Her background was originally in Public Affairs so her path to her current role in scam prevention is non-traditional.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:50] - There are over 12,000 employees behind the scenes at Amazon that work on scam prevention.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:32] - Working across borders to find perpetrators is extremely difficult and sometimes impossible.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:32] - Over 50% of the scams reported to Abigail’s team are order confirmation scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:41] - Gift card scams continue to be common. Amazon will never ask you for payment in gift cards.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:04] - Amazon will never ask you to install an app or allow them to access your computer.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:30] - Verify any purchases on your Amazon account and report any malicious communication to Amazon’s message center.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:46] - If you are ever contacted about Amazon for any reason, they will be able to verify all information and you can cross verify it on your account.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:20] - You can always reach out to Amazon’s report a scam to verify any interaction you’ve had.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:45] - Amazon is driven to protecting all Amazon users.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:48] - Amazon Scam Prevention also sends out emails and information to help educate consumers on best practices.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:01] - Abigail describes some of the steps that they have taken at Amazon to offer customers validation that any contact from them is legitimate.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:05] - In 2022, over 20,000 phishing sites were found and shut down as well as over 10,000 phishing phone numbers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:01] - Current events play a role in when and how scammers approach their attacks.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:21] - Because of the size and popularity of Amazon, they have the opportunity to act swiftly and cooperatively with other entities.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:13] - Abigail shares what Amazon has been able to develop in cooperation with BBB and other corporations publicly.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:30] - Amazon does have processes in place to help mitigate damage or prevent entirely data breaches.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:41] - The scam reporting feature on Amazon is new within the last year. They rely heavily on consumers reporting for them to be able to track scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:10] - Because of the volume of scam attempts, especially through text and email, many consumers don’t have time or desire to report every single one and would rather delete and ignore.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:17] - What scams should be reported or prioritized to report?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:14] - Always check your account directly on Amazon.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey.
