		<item>
			<title>The Tinder Swindler with Ayleen Charlotte</title>
			<itunes:title>The Tinder Swindler with Ayleen Charlotte</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 08 Feb 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c3c1cb04-9261-49d3-b57b-96a33b894c33]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/154]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We like to think that we’re too smart to be taken advantage of by a scammer, but some are willing to invest a tremendous amount of time and effort for a payout. Many do not come forward because of the fear, shame, and victim-blaming, but that’s not true with today’s guest.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Ayleen Charlotte. Ayleen was one of the women featured in the Netflix documentary The Tinder Swindler. She made a radical choice between victimhood or becoming a beacon of female empowerment. After what became five years of misery, she decided not only to tell her story, but to make a lifelong entrepreneurial dream come true.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:20] - When Ayleen contacted, there were already other women victimized, but Ayleen was a big part of the Tinder Swindler’s arrest.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:49] - She had three goals that participating in the documentary helped achieve.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:27] - Ayleen met this scammer five years ago and started a relationship with him.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:19] - Because he claimed to have many enemies, he moved in with Ayleen and used her money and credit cards to “stay under the radar.”</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:58] - The lavish lifestyle he lived made sense with the story he provided to the women he victimized.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:15] - One indicator that something was wrong was that money given back to her in the form of a check would never go through.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:40] - He always had an operation to start and Ayleen took several personal loans to help with these endeavors.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:27] - He laid a foundation of trust with the small things.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:15] - Ayleen says that in the beginning, he really made her feel special. The development of the relationship was going well and very believable.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:18] - There is a big difference between this situation and other types of fraud, as there was a real relationship built.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:15] - The Tinder Swindler used the same stories over and over again with every victim.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:08] - Even when he had “interactions” with enemies, he would show up with real injuries.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:15] - Some of the people on his team did not know they were part of this, although Ayleen says his bodyguard and his right-hand were aware.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:51] - An article was released about him and Ayleen saw it and immediately knew.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:18] - Ayleen lists some of the reasons he gave for the article being released. In this instance, Ayleen trusted the article over him.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:43] - When he continued to ask for money, Ayleen was in contact with the police. She wound up tricking him and, in a way, taking some of her money back.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:58] - If Ayleen didn’t give him money, he made it clear that she would be in danger from his enemies.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:18] - If someone is asking you for money and trying to push you, take a step back, shut down your phone, and think about it for a few days.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:38] - Over time, Ayleen saw a change in character, especially when she stopped sending him money.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:44] - The Tinder Swindler started his fraud schemes at the age of 15 and did not only target women. He swindled men as well as organizations and charities.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:26] - He is not able to get a real job or career at this point. This is the only thing he can do and he will continue. He is still out there, living in Israel.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:50] - The documentary has helped in slowing his scam.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:39] - Ayleen’s trust of other people has not been impacted. She knows that she has experienced the worst already.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:29] - Ayleen says the best thing you can do in a situation like this is to talk about it.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

Many do not come forward because of the fear, shame, and victim-blaming, but that’s not true with today’s guest.</p> <p>Today’s guest is Ayleen Charlotte. Ayleen was one of the women featured in the Netflix documentary The Tinder Swindler. She made a radical choice between victimhood or becoming a beacon of female empowerment. After what became five years of misery, she decided not only to tell her story, but to make a lifelong entrepreneurial dream come true.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[1:20] - When Ayleen contacted, there were already other women victimized, but Ayleen was a big part of the Tinder Swindler’s arrest.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[2:49] - She had three goals that participating in the documentary helped achieve.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[4:27] - Ayleen met this scammer five years ago and started a relationship with him.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[5:19] - Because he claimed to have many enemies, he moved in with Ayleen and used her money and credit cards to “stay under the radar.”</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[6:58] - The lavish lifestyle he lived made sense with the story he provided to the women he victimized.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[8:15] - One indicator that something was wrong was that money given back to her in the form of a check would never go through.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[9:40] - He always had an operation to start and Ayleen took several personal loans to help with these endeavors.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[11:27] - He laid a foundation of trust with the small things.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[13:15] - Ayleen says that in the beginning, he really made her feel special. The development of the relationship was going well and very believable.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[14:18] - There is a big difference between this situation and other types of fraud, as there was a real relationship built.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[16:15] - The Tinder Swindler used the same stories over and over again with every victim.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[17:08] - Even when he had “interactions” with enemies, he would show up with real injuries.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[18:15] - Some of the people on his team did not know they were part of this, although Ayleen says his bodyguard and his right-hand were aware.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[19:51] - An article was released about him and Ayleen saw it and immediately knew.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[21:18] - Ayleen lists some of the reasons he gave for the article being released. In this instance, Ayleen trusted the article over him.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[22:43] - When he continued to ask for money, Ayleen was in contact with the police. She wound up tricking him and, in a way, taking some of her money back.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[25:58] - If Ayleen didn’t give him money, he made it clear that she would be in danger from his enemies.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[27:18] - If someone is asking you for money and trying to push you, take a step back, shut down your phone, and think about it for a few days.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[28:38] - Over time, Ayleen saw a change in character, especially when she stopped sending him money.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[30:44] - The Tinder Swindler started his fraud schemes at the age of 15 and did not only target women. He swindled men as well as organizations and charities.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[32:26] - He is not able to get a real job or career at this point. This is the only thing he can do and he will continue. He is still out there, living in Israel.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[33:50] - The documentary has helped in slowing his scam.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[35:39] - Ayleen’s trust of other people has not been impacted. She knows that she has experienced the worst already.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[37:29] - Ayleen says the best thing you can do in a situation like this is to talk about it.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"> Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Cybersecurity Leadership is Broken with Richard Brinson and Rachel Briggs</title>
			<itunes:title>Cybersecurity Leadership is Broken with Richard Brinson and Rachel Briggs</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 01 Feb 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f4c82ddc-3d7b-4195-83d6-8ba7052c74b8]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/153]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Pending legislation mandating cybersecurity representation at the top levels of an organization in a relatively young field and understanding that field are testing the bounds of practical cybersecurity leadership.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guests are Richard Brinson and Rachel Briggs. Richard is an experienced executive, board advisor, and global top 100 Chief Informations Security Officer. He has been providing strategic guidance to many of the world’s largest global organizations for over 20 years with core expertise in cybersecurity, technology infrastructure, and enterprise architecture. Richard leads Savanti’s cybersecurity practice, helping large organizations to transform and modernize their security functions for the digital age. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Rachel is a leading expert on security and has advised governments and multinational corporations on security, resilience, terrorism, and responses to extremism. She is an Executive Advisor with Savanti and founder and CEO of The Clarity Factory, which provides and arranges services to its clients including research, consultancy, and thought leadership. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:35] - Richard shares his background and what Savanti is known for.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:30] - Rachel works with Richard and his team on thought leadership products.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:01] - Organizations reach out to Savanti and don’t know if what they are doing is right or wrong. SISOs seemed to be coming and going.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:35] - There were 6 key factors that were causing this churn in the industry.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:50] - The supply in demand problem for cybersecurity leaders is one issue in retaining professionals as SISOs.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:45] - For every three years, a company is really only moving forward one.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:05] - Rachel shares data that shows the importance of strong cybersecurity and leadership that does it right.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:37] - It’s not just about security. It’s actually part of a good business model now.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:03] - When cybersecurity isn’t a part of leadership, the board's understanding creates a problem with delegating and solving problems.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:20] - Richard is a board advisor on many organizational boards to help with this lack of understanding.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:48] - There are fewer than 100 SISOs with effective boardroom expertise.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:02] - When speaking with SISOs and others in leadership, things are lost in translation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:28] - We tend to just expect people to be good communicators but it is a skill that needs to be trained. </span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:43] - There are leadership training companies that organizations can work with to coach a leadership team.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:30] - SISOs can and should be taught to communicate effectively in the boardroom and that should be something the organization provides.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:20] - There is pending legislation that will mandate the requirement of cybersecurity in leadership, but Richard shares some possible problems.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:04] - Savanti helps demystify this problem with communication.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:42] - For smaller companies who cannot afford a full time SISO, fractional SISO roles that are usually virtual are offered by Savanti.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:18] - If an incoming SISO does not have the support of the board, they cannot be effective or successful.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:50] - The turnover rate for this role is quite high.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:02] - Companies who aren’t willing to implement recommendations or bring in a qualified SISO leads to a number of costs and risks.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:02] - Changing SISOs so often is destabilizing.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:35] - With solid security, a company can take more business risks safely.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[40:03] - Regulations can be helpful but not helpful in many ways.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[41:52] - If you are considering a role as a SISO in leadership, round yourself off as a business leader with effective communication skills.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[43:53] - You can read the recent report that Richard describes by clicking</span> <a href= "https://info.savanti.co.uk/hubfs/Savanti%20Insight%201.pdf?utm_referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fsavanti.co.uk%2F"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">here</span></a><span style= "font-weight: 400;">.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= 		<item>
			<title>Synthetic Fraud with Mike Cook</title>
			<itunes:title>Synthetic Fraud with Mike Cook</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 25 Jan 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[bca49f58-ffa2-48a1-9b9b-211674fcb1cf]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/152]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Millions have been impacted by data breaches. Many of us know how fraudsters work and how they utilize this information. But our parents and children become victims because of their fear or urgency inflicted by the scammers. Today’s guest is Mike Cook. Mike is an entrepreneur with over 30 years of experience working and serving in the financial services, wireless, cable/satellite, and auto financial industries. He has built several data breach applications in compliance, manual verification, and account management solutions.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:56] - Mike shares his background and what he currently does.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:10] - When Mike talked to a fraudster who stole cars, he immediately became interested in fraud and scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:47] - Mike’s daughter was a victim of a scam and lost a lot of money, but the biggest impact was how fearful she was.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:20] - In years past, fraud was easier to stop, but now everyone’s data is available somewhere online.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:04] - Once data is breached, that information can be copied and sold over and over again.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:30] - What is a citizen fraudster?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:01] - Lenders and consumers are both heavily impacted by data breaches.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:31] - As a consumer, you need to listen to every word. If it sounds too good to be true or too scary and urgent, it’s a scam.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:08] - It is so easy to click on things without thinking about it.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:19] - Don’t ever feel bad about choosing not to give someone information.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:57] - When the economy goes down, fraud goes up.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:55] - Fraud has never been harder to stop, has never been smarter, never been swifter to change patterns. It is on fire right now.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:04] - Covid resulted in everyone moving to remote working, learning, and everything being online. 			<title>AI Fake News and Reviews with Peter Sisson</title>
			<itunes:title>AI Fake News and Reviews with Peter Sisson</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 18 Jan 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[53f68d93-74b1-4e9f-aa11-cc19cafb0841]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/151]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">With AI having the ability to search the internet and write a paper, create an image, or even a video having someone say what they didn’t say, we can no longer use the phrase that seeing is believing. Today’s guest is Peter Sisson. As a serial entrepreneur with a master’s in AI from Stanford, Peter is working to fight fake news, fake reviews, and fake products. Misinformation and polarization have exploded since Peter began his career in Silicon Valley more than 20 years ago and his latest company CertifyIt offers an app that can help stop it.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:08] - Peter shares his background in AI and as a serial entrepreneur.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:01] - We believe what we see and it is already getting hard to determine what is real.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:38] - The biggest concern is faking videos and faking images is already happening.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:04] - The technology isn’t there yet and usually you can tell when an image or video is fabricated.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:55] - AI has been trained by the entire internet. AI can write anything you want it to, but none of it is original.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:18] - AI doesn’t actually know anything. It uses what is already available to learn patterns. Peter explains how it works.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:25] - There are a lot of ethical concerns about using AI to create content.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:51] - News providers use CertifyIt to know that content they release is accurate before they break fake news.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:08] - Peter shares the story of CNN breaking news that wasn’t true but really appeared to be accurate.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:16] - How does CertifyIt use metadata to confirm accuracy?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:07] - Chris and Peter discuss some examples of how people need to use CertifyIt, which is a public benefit corporation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:01] - It is a simple concept, but it works and is a viable solution to ensure content is accurate.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:25] - The sooner the video is determined to be true, it is news that can be broken faster.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:46] - Fake reviews are a big problem right now where people are even hired to write them for companies or products.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:21] - Certified location videos could be beneficial for certain products or services.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:50] - A third party like CertifyIt is necessary as people won’t believe the vetting if it’s done by the news organization.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:16] - You can trick people’s brains pretty easily as we are designed to believe what we see. This is especially easy if the viewer is tired or distracted.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:50] - The more people get fooled, the more they will need a tool to vet the accuracy of a video they view.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:29] - There will be false positives and false negatives as the technology gets better and better.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:54] - The things that AI can create are truly very cool and can be entertaining, but the way people use it will change and probably not for the greater good.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[38:21] - It will be possible to create alternate realities that are very convincing.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:23] - It will probably take something major happening to bring this problem to light for the general public.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[41:03] - The CertifyIt app can be used in a multitude of ways to provide a sense of confidence that the content you are viewing is true.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://certifyit.org/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">CertifyIt Website</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://apps.apple.com/us/app/certifyit/id1631685409"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">CertifyIt on Apple App Store</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Protecting Your Health Data with Katie Lips</title>
			<itunes:title>Protecting Your Health Data with Katie Lips</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 04 Jan 2023 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[22cc884c-ace0-4030-97c8-93ede49a0a1f]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/149]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Many people are comfortable sharing data in an environment that they believe to be a safe space. But not everyone considers where that health data goes after it has been collected. Today’s guest is Katie Lips. Katie is an author and entrepreneur who helps consumers to understand the value of their data and protect themselves online. She is currently creating a data-centric health app with her extensive experience.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:51] - Katie shares her broad and diverse career in technology.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:06] - The growth of the internet has changed exponentially since its inception.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:04] - Covid opened up everyone’s eyes on how useful data is in the health space.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:16] - For many, sharing health data during the pandemic made them nervous.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:19] - Many of us have health tracking apps and devices that collect an enormous amount of data.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:57] - Sharing data means that it could land in the hands of companies that you may not want to have so much information on you.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:43] - Consider who will see your data as it can paint a picture of who you are and your life.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:00] - Fitness trackers use a GPS which is a great tool for runners, but Chris shares an example of how it puts military personnel at risk.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:29] - If you share health data online, like on social media, it is considered personal data and isn’t strictly governed.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:05] - Some companies may use social media to determine how healthy someone is.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:36] - The truth is, we don’t know who can take that data and use what they want.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:01] - Chris and Katie discuss an example of unintended consequences of using health tracker apps.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:50] - What is a data play?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:23] - Some data is best preserved as saved on a device rather than online.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:52] - It’s important to consider what data would be accessed in a breach as a consumer and a business owner.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:14] - The possibility of data being sold to health insurance companies is a scary concept.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:47] - There is a difference between sick care and health care and this space has changed in recent years.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:37] - Can your health choices be held against you with your health provider?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:44] - Chris describes an insurance company incentivizing healthier choices.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:56] - Companies need to be more upfront on what the data shared will be used for. Chris and Katie believe that is something that will become more common.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:30] - Katie describes her startup and health journey.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:07] - Something can be data driven, but doesn’t collect a lot of unnecessary data.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Many people are comfortable sharing data in an environment that they believe to be a safe space. But not everyone considers where that health data goes after it has been collected. Today’s guest is Katie Lips. Katie is an author and entrepreneur who helps consumers to understand the value of their data and protect themselves online. She is currently creating a data-centric health app with her extensive experience.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[0:51] - Katie shares her broad and diverse career in technology.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[2:06] - The growth of the internet has changed exponentially since its inception.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[4:04] - Covid opened up everyone’s eyes on how useful data is in the health space.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[5:16] - For many, sharing health data during the pandemic made them nervous.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[6:19] - Many of us have health tracking apps and devices that collect an enormous amount of data.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[7:57] - Sharing data means that it could land in the hands of companies that you may not want to have so much information on you.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[8:43] - Consider who will see your data as it can paint a picture of who you are and your life.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[10:00] - Fitness trackers use a GPS which is a great tool for runners, but Chris shares an example of how it puts military personnel at risk.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[12:29] - If you share health data online, like on social media, it is considered personal data and isn’t strictly governed.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[14:05] - Some companies may use social media to determine how healthy someone is.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[15:36] - The truth is, we don’t know who can take that data and use what they want.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[17:01] - Chris and Katie discuss an example of unintended consequences of using health tracker apps.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[19:50] - What is a data play?</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[21:23] - Some data is best preserved as saved on a device rather than online.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[22:52] - It’s important to consider what data would be accessed in a breach as a consumer and a business owner.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[24:14] - The possibility of data being sold to health insurance companies is a scary concept.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[25:47] - There is a difference between sick care and health care and this space has changed in recent years.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[27:37] - Can your health choices be held against you with your health provider?</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[29:44] - Chris describes an insurance company incentivizing healthier choices.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[31:56] - Companies need to be more upfront on what the data shared will be used for. Chris and Katie believe that is something that will become more common.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[34:30] - Katie describes her startup and health journey.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[37:07] - Something can be data driven, but doesn’t collect a lot of unnecessary data.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"> Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.weareeatiful.com/">Eatiful Website</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://katielips.com/">Katie Lips Website</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/katielips/?hl=en">Katie Lips on Instagram</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/katielips/?originalSubdomain=uk"> Katie Lips on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>How Cybercriminal Networks Are Organized with Peter Taylor</title>
			<itunes:title>How Cybercriminal Networks Are Organized with Peter Taylor</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 28 Dec 2022 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[999da96d-aa4d-43b5-b572-9e621894096b]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/148]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Virtual networks with anonymous accounts allow cybercrime gangs the ability to work together without even knowing who they work with. This could be how the good guys infiltrate these networks.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Peter Taylor. Peter is a former police detective and Director of Fraud Management for major UK companies. Ten years ago he set up his own consultancy and has established a reputation as “The Fraud Guy” specializing in research, training, and investigation around organized crime.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:50] - Peter shares his background and why he’s known as The Fraud Guy.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:10] - Throughout his career, Peter spoke with former cybercriminals and hackers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:51] - Cybercriminals are applying advanced business techniques to their organizations.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:40] - What gets ignored is what cybercriminals and former criminals can tell us.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:46] - We know that cybercriminals can watch what we’re doing, but what we don’t think about is that we can do the same to them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:49] - The first function of these organized cybercrime gangs is to steal data. Next is to buy and enhance the data. And the third is to cash out.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:50] - There are some exceptions to the rule.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:50] - The purpose of creating false identities has changed over the years.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:53] - The biggest advantage that cybercriminals have is they get things done, while the good guys abide by time-consuming policies.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:14] - Peter feels like the “good guys” need advice on how to help this problematic trend.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:28] - The more sophisticated areas of cybercrime, the more elitist are actually a small portion. The largest portion of cybercrime is actually several years old.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:11] - Peter shares an example of how organized cybercrime has impacted corporations as well and the rise of check fraud.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:07] - The common Nigerian prince scam still works! </span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:13] - Guilt and fear are commonly triggered emotions.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:03] - Another reason the Nigerian prince scam works is the trigger of a victim’s ego.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:36] - The use of bots and automated messaging can hit so many people at one time with very little effort.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:50] - Talk to the people who are important to you that may not be aware of these scams. Just because we know it, doesn’t mean they do.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:56] - Millennials are now the highest target age bracket of those being targeted by scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:40] - Cybercriminals reach a point of success where it’s no longer about the money. It’s about their ego.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:00] - We have to understand the difference in lifestyle and how cybercriminals recruit more people.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:43] - There is little to no support for scam victims and in many countries there are no laws stating that this is even illegal.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[40:18] - What role does machine learning play?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[43:01] - Peter shares some experiences in changing up his spending habits.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[45:12] - There are many different types of ways to access data that Peter lists here.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[46:52] - There is a lot more going on before, during, and after every single transaction, especially those done online.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[48:59] - Peter initially got into fraud because of an increase in the apparent theft of thousands of vehicles.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[50:20] - Insurance fraud is also a very common problem.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[52:53] - Obligatory security is a form of protection that could be a solution to many problems.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[54:08] - Peter is optimistic about the future of cybersecurity.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[55:35] - If we can decrease the money taken by cybercriminals through fraud, the money can be used for better things.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[57:56] - There are some varying opinions on the politics of scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[59:49] - Many scammers are in the industry out of desperation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[61:35] - We can’t continue to be in a world where this industry grows.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/insuranceinvestigator_thefraudguy-fraud-cyber-activity-6882306396709249024-imQe/"> Peter Taylor The Fraud Guy on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Vehicle Hacking with Derrick Thiecke</title>
			<itunes:title>Vehicle Hacking with Derrick Thiecke</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 21 Dec 2022 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[2382862b-d8b5-4419-bdef-64a5ca4a1044]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/147]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We understand that hackers look for weaknesses in networks to manipulate or take data, but understanding the ways that vehicles can also be accessed either remotely or physically can be a bit surprising.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Derrick Thiecke. Derrick works as an Embedded Systems Security Tester in the automotive industry where he found himself after spending over a decade in the corporate IT world. When Derrick isn’t data dumping ROM chips, scouring through vehicle log data, or fuzzing CAN networks, he can be found as a brief blur passing by you on the highway.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:58] - Derrick shares his background and current role as a security tester for automotive controllers and devices.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:30] - There are differences between vehicle networks and home networks. The main network for vehicles is CAN bus.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:12] - Because it is a bussed network, Derrick explains how all devices on the network can access all the data.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:50] - 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>We understand that hackers look for weaknesses in networks to manipulate or take data, but understanding the ways that vehicles can also be accessed either remotely or physically can be a bit surprising.</p> <p>Today’s guest is Derrick Thiecke. 			<title>Global Scammer Impact with Jorij Abraham</title>
			<itunes:title>Global Scammer Impact with Jorij Abraham</itunes:title>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Scammers are brilliant at targeting the vulnerable and then often using the fear of exposure to extort even more out of them. Education about these manipulators isn’t enough. Can we do more to make a global impact knowing that less than 0.1% of scammers are ever prosecuted?</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Jorij Abraham. Jorij Abraham is the Managing Director of the Global Anti-Scam Alliance with a mission of preventing consumers worldwide from getting scammed. He is also the General Manager at ScamAdvisor.com, the global blacklist for malicious websites. In addition, Jorij is an ecommerce professor at University of Applied Sciences TIO.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:01] - Jorij shares his current roles and background in the field.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:27] - He fell into ScamAdvisor when working in ecommerce.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:42] - Scammers are remarkably smart when it comes to marketing fake sites.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:12] - Subscription scams are specifically successful in getting quite a lot of money from victims.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:18] - Scammers tend to take advantage of current events such as the energy crisis and abortion and then extort their fear of exposure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:26] - ScamAdvisor.com sees over 4 million visitors per month and they are from all over the world.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:24] - In most countries, victims of scams are unable to get any help.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:49] - Jorij explains how the laws work regarding scammers and the pitfalls of the process.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:40] - It’s important to educate consumers, but there’s only so much that can be learned.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:56] - The tips and tricks that helped just a few months ago are already not working all the time.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:33] - Jorij describes a Ponzi scheme that took down the government in Albania.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:10] - One little bump in supply and demand has drastic ripple effects.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:32] - Scams are not simple anymore. The marketing power is extremely impactful and mostly successful.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:11] - Even in the Netherlands, FBI phone scams are successful.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:00] - Jorij predicts that legislation will be necessary.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:10] - Awareness is good, but consumers need more protection.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:35] - Phishing scams are created to filter out specific groups of people.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:37] - Jorij shares his thoughts on retraining scammers to do good, especially since they are skilled hackers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:34] - How can we reduce scams?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:41] - The Global Anti-Scam Alliance is a networking organization with the goal of pushing everyone together to define new ways to combat scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:17] - Jorij describes the changes coming to ScamAdvisor.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 			<title>How to Spot Fake Dating Profiles with Kathy Waters and Bryan Denny</title>
			<itunes:title>How to Spot Fake Dating Profiles with Kathy Waters and Bryan Denny</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 30 Nov 2022 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c4818f64-b390-4239-a725-82cb01225a61]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/144]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Online dating has become more complicated than ever. Learning how to verify that the person you’re talking to is actually the person in the dating profile can save you from heartbreak and financial loss.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guests are Kathy Waters and Bryan Denny. Kathy Waters is an expert advocate and an educator on the subject of online romance scams. Kathy is co-founder, along with retired Colonel Bryan Denny, of the non-profit organization Advocating Against Romance Scammers. Both have been working for safer platforms since 2016 with the same goals in mind: justice for victims and educating all online of the cybercrime known to tear people down emotionally, psychologically, and financially.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:18] - Bryan shares his experience with someone using his name and images in fake profiles.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:00] - Kathy’s mother’s friend was a victim of a romance scam that used Bryan’s photos.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:36] - AARS became a non-profit last year and works to educate not only users, but lawmakers, too.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:01] - Dating profiles of someone in military uniform is a red flag.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:41] - There are many red flags to look for and there will often be more than one indicator.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:50] - Ask a friend in the military about an unusual profile or reach out to Kathy and Bryan.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:23] - It’s tough to get people to report these interactions.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:40] - Prior to Covid, the demographic was more elderly aged people. But a younger crowd has been affected since Covid.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:22] - Younger people are more likely to come forward and talk about their experiences than an older demographic.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:41] - It is also therapeutic to come forward and talk about it.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:07] - Scammers tend to have a similar story, working out of the country.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:51] - Bryan shares that he continues to receive messages about his photo circulating on fake profiles and the stories are all very similar.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:07] - Bryan explains how scammers manipulate videos to pretend to be interacting on video calls.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:23] - If you’re concerned about interacting with someone through video calls, you can ask them to do something like touch their head or look a certain way.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:01] - What do you do if you know you are interacting with a scammer?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:04] - Scammers share where they have had success with other scammers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:43] - If you are watching this happen to someone else, there are ways to approach it with them. Outsiders tend to see the red flags sooner.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:54] - Unfortunately, they may not believe you. Try to educate them on red flags.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:46] - There are support groups for helping manage the emotional toll this takes on a victim.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:09] - What laws are in place for this?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:19] - Scammers are typically in another country. They are hard to go after legally because they are not in the United States.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:49] - On their website, there are commonly used photos in fake profiles and ways to report a scam.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://advocatingforu.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Advocating Against Romance Scammers (AARS) Website</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>The Danger of Errors on Your Credit Report with Steve Baker</title>
			<itunes:title>The Danger of Errors on Your Credit Report with Steve Baker</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 23 Nov 2022 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[e5e98540-92a6-4cd2-9c00-b5076c55fd1f]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/143]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Every time you pay a bill, data is sent to a credit reporting agency. Errors can be made. It’s important to know where to look to see if your credit information is correct, stolen, or purchased. Today’s guest is Steve Baker. Steve is chairman of the Privacy Rights Institute. He is a lawyer and previously served as a leader at the FTC for over 27 years addressing consumer fraud in areas like telemarketing and spamming. Steve now writes The Baker Fraud Report, a free weekly newsletter covering consumer fraud from around the world.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:08] - Steve shares what he currently does with The Baker Fraud Report and his career background.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:46] - In the field of consumer fraud, there is always something to learn.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:27] - The Privacy Rights Institute is meant to educate people on their rights regarding credit reporting.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:02] - With tons of pieces of data, errors can occur.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:05] - Steve shares some of the people who can pull your credit report.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:34] - One error happens when people with the same name get mixed up.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:04] - Steve explains how the system is supposed to work.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:07] - Unfortunately the credit reporting agencies have poor customer service.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:54] - Credit reports can also be pulled by employees and associates at places like car dealerships. There’s no stopping them from searching anyone.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:40] - Data breaches are also a concern and can lead to identity theft.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:27] - The Los Angeles school district recently experienced a data breach through ransomware.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:25] - There are some alternatives that are starting to come out for security.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:56] - With the increase in people changing jobs and the economy in its current state, credit reports are being pulled more frequently at the moment.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:09] - You can get a copy of your credit report once a year. Do this at</span> <a href= "https://www.annualcreditreport.com/index.action"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">AnnualCreditReport.com</span></a><span style= "font-weight: 400;">.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:26] - If you see an error, reporting it to one agency is good. Keep an eye on your credit card bills.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:24] - Scammers have also been known to alter recordings of your voice on the phone.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:04] - If you see an unusual charge, don’t try to locate or contact the person who made the charge.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:48] - Currently, the best way for scammers to get your money is through cryptocurrency.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:07] - Immigrants are particularly hit hard by scammers and credit report confusion.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:01] - Keep an eye on your credit reports and periodically check for errors.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:06] - Steve explains how credit repair works and what to look for.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.annualcreditreport.com/index.action"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">AnnualCreditReport.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://bakerfraudreport.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Baker Fraud Report</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Security Planning with Consumer Reports with Amira Dhalla</title>
			<itunes:title>Security Planning with Consumer Reports with Amira Dhalla</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 16 Nov 2022 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[385dbeca-9483-4913-8ac8-41e201f50656]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/142]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Consumer Reports is known for the research and comparisons of products and services, but they also offer a free personalized security and privacy planner. Today’s guest is Amira Dhalla. Amira is the Director of Impact Partnerships and Programs at Consumer Reports focusing on digital privacy and security. Amira works on projects that improve the cybersecurity and privacy products and tools on the marketplace while also tackling topics like discriminatory technologies, deceptive design, trust, and safety.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:57] - Amira shares her background and her role at Consumer Reports.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:10] - The internet is incredible, but the quality isn’t always what it should be.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:26] - Technology has expanded at an unprecedented rate.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:14] - Amira explains some of the fears that people had in different countries when learning about internet use.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:21] - Security Planner has been around for a long time and Consumer Reports brought it into their toolset a few years ago.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:29] - Constant updates as technology changes and trends emerge is crucial.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:19] - Consumer Reports studies tools people use. MFA is becoming much more commonly used.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:30] - MFA is also required by many organizations for their employees.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:40] - Password managers are not trending as more commonly used.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:14] - Amira shares Consumer Report’s picks for password managers and VPNs.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:12] - Online shopping has increased since the pandemic and is prime time for scammers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:31] - There are ways to be smarter online shoppers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:45] - What is a Grinchbot?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:59] - Once you go to a third party site, you are no longer secure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:07] - Amira describes some of the things to look for to determine if you are looking at a fake site.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:20] - Question yourself on why a site needs the information they are asking for.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:54] - Charity scams are a huge problem particularly during the holiday season.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:10] - Always go to the site you know directly.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://securityplanner.consumerreports.org/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Security Planner</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

She got frustrated by the system in relation to support of scam victims and started what is now the National Trading Standard Scams Teams, and she was awarded an MBE for protecting vulnerable consumers from financial abuse. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:10] -
