		<item>
			<title>Is AI Going to Take Over the World? with Daniel Hulme</title>
			<itunes:title>Is AI Going to Take Over the World? with Daniel Hulme</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 03 Aug 2022 10:00:06 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[d811ee41-400a-421b-ad13-d382e4823ec1]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/127]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Can understanding someone’s digital footprint really make it easier for it to predict what they’ll be doing using AI? Today’s guest is Daniel Hulme. Daniel has a PhD in Computational Complexity and works in the field of AI, applied technology, and ethics. He is the CEO and founder of Satalia, a Tedx speaker, and educator at Singularity University. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:50] - Daniel has already been interested in how humans behave and describes how he got into AI.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:05] - AI gets grouped into technology but there are a lot of different types of AI.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:50] - The ultimate goal of AI is to have computers make decisions and learn from the decisions, but that’s not commonplace right now.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:31] - Someone’s digital footprint can be used to learn a lot about them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:51] - The challenges that we are facing with AI are not ethical challenges, they are safety issues.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:29] - AI is super complex and is becoming more difficult to test.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:03] - AI’s learning isn’t usually the problem. It’s the framework put in place.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:36] - Machine learning is a generalization of the world which can create biases.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:26] - Building explainable systems is incredibly important.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:20] - Daniel gives an example of how AI can use data but why human decisions are still important.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:16] - It’s much more cost effective to have simple solutions than complex ones.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:35] - What is the effect of building a super intelligence? We don’t know. Daniel explains the singularities involved.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:45] - These technologies are replacing people in completing some tasks. This is arguably a good or bad thing, depending on how you think about it.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:47] - There are different safeguards against each of these singularities.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:56] - Daniel shares what he thinks will be the solution.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:07] - Who is going to make this “glorious future”?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:36] - As AI takes the roles of employees in some companies, Daniel believes it will balance out again.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:01] - There are jobs that may be impacted more than others.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:46] - Something else that Daniel thinks may happen is a new economic structure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:12] - The highest cost for many organizations is human labor.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:42] - There’s a possible paradigm shift that will have to change the way we think about work and money.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:30] - Daniel is optimistic that we’re headed in the right direction.</span><span style= "font-weight: 400;"><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.satalia.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Satalia Website</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/thesolveengine?lang=en"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Daniel Hulme on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/danielhulme/?originalSubdomain=uk"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Daniel Hulme on LinkedIn</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>How to Avoid Scammy Tech with Ken from Computer Clan</title>
			<itunes:title>How to Avoid Scammy Tech with Ken from Computer Clan</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 27 Jul 2022 10:00:56 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c152885e-a0d3-4d02-ad40-3d7310da68aa]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/126]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Advertisements can manipulate us and depict a product that doesn’t actually work. The challenge is knowing if the technology does what they say it does. Today’s guest is Ken from Computer Clan. Ken, or commonly known as Crazy Ken, has been running the Computer Clan YouTube channel since September of 2007. He posts tech videos about rare and retro tech, new tech, and even has a series about scammy tech products. Whether you are a tech whiz or a beginner, it doesn’t matter. Ken will bring the knowledge, science, entertainment, and even debunk a few scams along the way. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:51] - Computer Clan is one of the longest running tech focused YouTube channels. Ken shares the channel’s background.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:28] - The channel is celebrating its 15th anniversary and now is Ken’s full time job.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:06] - Ken shared how a tech product advertisement gave him the idea to debunk false advertisements in videos.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:27] - When he was younger, Ken made a purchase and experienced the disappointment of advertisements that promise more than they offer.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:38] - A big red flag to look for is the cheesy video ad that promises things that seem miraculous.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:40] - Another ad feature that can be used ethically, but can also be abused are those fake countdown timers on websites.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:47] - Review sections of a product are not always accurate. If you take a closer look, some of the comments are the same.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:45] - If there is a bad experience, even if there isn’t a review, people do tell their friends. Be careful about perfect reviews.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:37] - Ken shares a story about ads that steal video footage from other companies.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:10] - There are a lot of ways to find stock footage, but many fake ads pull footage from copyrighted material.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:57] - Some of the products might not be odd, but Ken says that some of the clickbait ads are strange.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:21] - In the early days of Covid, people took advantage to create ads that claim more than is possible.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:25] - Ken shares some products that he thought would be a scam that actually turned out to work fine, but the ads were misleading.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:40] - During his videos, Ken even sometimes has a fire extinguisher handy.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:19] - Urgency could be a red flag.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:30] - Ken shares some of the products he is looking at to debunk the ad and the product.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:20] - The educational element of the Computer Clan YouTube channel can show you that although not all products are fake, they may not be what you need.</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Advertisements can manipulate us and depict a product that doesn’t actually work. The challenge is knowing if the technology does what they say it does. Today’s guest is Ken from Computer Clan. Ken, or commonly known as Crazy Ken, has been running the Computer Clan YouTube channel since September of 2007. He posts tech videos about rare and retro tech, new tech, and even has a series about scammy tech products. Whether you are a tech whiz or a beginner, it doesn’t matter. Ken will bring the knowledge, science, entertainment, and even debunk a few scams along the way. </p> Show Notes: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[0:51] - Computer Clan is one of the longest running tech focused YouTube channels. Ken shares the channel’s background.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[2:28] - The channel is celebrating its 15th anniversary and now is Ken’s full time job.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[3:06] - Ken shared how a tech product advertisement gave him the idea to debunk false advertisements in videos.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[4:27] - When he was younger, Ken made a purchase and experienced the disappointment of advertisements that promise more than they offer.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[7:38] - A big red flag to look for is the cheesy video ad that promises things that seem miraculous.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[8:40] - Another ad feature that can be used ethically, but can also be abused are those fake countdown timers on websites.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[9:47] - Review sections of a product are not always accurate. If you take a closer look, some of the comments are the same.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[11:45] - If there is a bad experience, even if there isn’t a review, people do tell their friends. Be careful about perfect reviews.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[12:37] - Ken shares a story about ads that steal video footage from other companies.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[14:10] - There are a lot of ways to find stock footage, but many fake ads pull footage from copyrighted material.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[16:57] - Some of the products might not be odd, but Ken says that some of the clickbait ads are strange.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[18:21] - In the early days of Covid, people took advantage to create ads that claim more than is possible.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[20:25] - Ken shares some products that he thought would be a scam that actually turned out to work fine, but the ads were misleading.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[22:40] - During his videos, Ken even sometimes has a fire extinguisher handy.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[24:19] - Urgency could be a red flag.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[25:30] - Ken shares some of the products he is looking at to debunk the ad and the product.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[27:20] - The educational element of the Computer Clan YouTube channel can show you that although not all products are fake, they may not be what you need.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>Former FBI Agent Shares Cybercrime Trends with Eric O’Neill</title>
			<itunes:title>Former FBI Agent Shares Cybercrime Trends with Eric O’Neill</itunes:title>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Working from home has increased the ability for cyber criminals to exploit companies. Listen on for how to be sure that the email you received isn’t from someone impersonating someone else. Today’s guest is Eric O’Neill. Eric is a security expert and author that presents keynotes internationally about espionage, national security, cyber security, fraud, corporate diligence and defense, and of course, hacking. Eric has worked as an FBI counterterrorism and counterintelligence operative, national security attorney, and a corporate security consultant. He founded The Georgetown Group, a premier investigative and security business firm. Eric is also the national security strategist for Carbon Black, the leader in next gen endpoint security and serves on the general council for global communities and international security.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:05] - Eric shares his background and how he got involved in cybersecurity. He describes his previous role in the FBI.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:47] - Moving on after his career in the FBI, Eric currently wears many different hats in various roles.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:58] - Using his interest in hacking, he was able to catch the biggest FBI spy in history.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:48] - Everything changed about how we work since the pandemic.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:46] - In many cases, people were working and kids were learning from mobile devices. We weren’t ready for this to happen.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:09] - The massive increase in people working from home, increased the number of attacks.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:25] - Eric shares some statistics of reported cyber attacks in the last couple of years.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:38] - Romance scams are the second-highest attack trend since the start of the pandemic.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:50] - One of the positives that came from this change to remote, is in hiring talent from around the world.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:10] - Eric thinks we will see more scams of people impersonating CEOs or higher ups in a company.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:27] - Passwords are useless without multi-factor authentication.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:03] - SMS authentication isn’t great, but it's better than nothing.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:53] - Eric shares how people can mine data they purchase from the dark web and how easy it could be.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:48] - Cyber criminals want to take down an entire critical infrastructure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:42] - Criminals are getting much more clever in throwing people into chaos by attacking critical infrastructure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:32] - Eric believes that cyber attacks will be the method of attack in the next major war.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:05] - He uses the example of the colonial pipeline to demonstrate what chaos these attacks can create.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:10] - There is some speculation of possible attacks on critical infrastructure and the possibility of them maintaining presence.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:19] - Chris shares the issues with power in his area.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:25] - Jokingly but accurately, Eric shares that your children are great hackers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[38:42] - Some apps change the location of numbers for entering a PIN so people can’t pick up patterns.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[40:54] - There are some medical devices that could be compromised.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[42:50] - The average person doesn’t think about the ways someone can have malicious intent.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[44:41] - Cyber espionage is definitely a problem, but cybercrime is what the average person needs to be aware of.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[46:09] - Don’t click on links. Known vulnerabilities are the most commonly successful attack.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[48:20] - The Dark Web is the third largest economy in the world.</span><span style= "font-weight: 400;"><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 		<item>
			<title>The Impact of AI on Scamming with Ran Levi</title>
			<itunes:title>The Impact of AI on Scamming with Ran Levi</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 13 Jul 2022 10:00:11 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[798ece7f-c33a-421a-bfbb-204f87134196]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/124]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The thought of your computer getting a virus implies something biological, but the fear of infection is real. Are there prevention techniques that you need to be implementing now? Today’s guest is Ran Levi. Ran has been podcasting since 2007 and started with a podcast regarding history and technology. He is the co-founder of PI Media LTD, helping other people do podcasts. He is the editor and host of the popular podcast Malicious Life that tells the stories of the histories of cyber security with commentary by hackers, security experts, journalists, and politicians. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:02] - 			<title>Attack Techniques Scammers Are Using with Joel Hollenbeck</title>
			<itunes:title>Attack Techniques Scammers Are Using with Joel Hollenbeck</itunes:title>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Reusing passwords makes it easier for threat actors to gain access to your accounts. They may not actually be using it to take money. They may be impersonating you to scam others in your network. Today’s guest is Joel Hollenbeck. Joel is a cyber security executive with over 25 years experience in multiple disciplines. He is the CTO at Check Point Software Technologies and leads a global team of cyber security experts dedicated to understanding the challenges that customers face and helping them stay ahead of the ever-evolving threat curve.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:01] - Joel shares his background and his current role.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:38] - Joel has teenagers at home and describes the challenges of communicating threats including one that wound up being an attack.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:06] - His credit card company alerted him of fraud and he looked further into it.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:29] - Threat actors have to constantly change up their tactics.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:53] - The latest report shows that the number one brand that scammers are using is LinkedIn. They are trying to harvest accounts to get in under the radar.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:06] - Brands themselves need to also be aware to keep their customers safe.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:36] - Every major holiday, shopping event, or global event creates new opportunities for phishing attempts.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:09] - Joel shares some of the information threat actors gather.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:33] - A great many people don’t trust SMS messages.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:30] - The reuse of passwords has been proven to be a huge mistake.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:37] - Chris shares an experience with a password reset issue.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:28] - Social media companies do not have a public facing customer service line.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:46] - On the other end of the spectrum, there is the issue of being overwhelmed by multi-factor authentication.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:18] - Product links on social media are also something to be wary of.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:37] - Think of it as a risk assessment and know that sometimes it will feel very cynical.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:59] - You don’t know if the person on the other end of a message is from the person you actually trust.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:48] - Threat actors strive to gain access to high value accounts.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:42] - Some LinkedIn or other social media account hacks, they will be used for simple phishing attacks. But some will be used for something very sophisticated.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:06] - Awareness of these issues is critically important to try to stay ahead of scammers.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 			<title>Security Challenges and Risks with Robert Siciliano</title>
			<itunes:title>Security Challenges and Risks with Robert Siciliano</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 29 Jun 2022 10:00:22 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[41d5c20d-0a06-4973-b812-96dbbdcdfb16]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/122]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">All security is personal. It’s important for each individual to understand the risk of predators so we can protect ourselves, our data, and our finances. Today’s guest is Robert Siciliano. Robert is a security expert and private investigator, number 1 Amazon best-selling author of five books, and an architect of the CSI Protection Certification, a cyber-social identity and personal protection security awareness training program. He is a frequent speaker and media commentator and the CEO of Safr.me. 			<title>The Constantly Evolving Subject of Cyber Security with Stephen Cobb</title>
			<itunes:title>The Constantly Evolving Subject of Cyber Security with Stephen Cobb</itunes:title>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">There’s always risk when using technology, but your perception of the exposure will determine how active you are at minimizing the danger. Today’s guest is Stephen Cobb. Stephen is a best-selling author and award winning technologist with over 30 years experience in digital security and data privacy. He has authored more than a dozen textbooks on PC and LAN security as well as software usage. As a CISSP since 1996, he co-founded two successful security startups and earned a Master’s in security and risk management. Stephen now researches harm caused by the abuse of digital technology.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:02] - Stephen shares his background and how he wound up in the world of cyber security.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:17] - In the earlier days of his career, he learned the niche of the risks of technology.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:13] - Privacy violations were becoming a HIPPA category.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:14] - Stephen shares more about the companies he worked for and his experience in cyber security.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:44] - Stephen continues researching risk perception.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:01] - Understanding the limits of technology and human behavior have helped guide his research.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:02] - Covid was a very eye opening experience in that it revealed who was willing to exploit and who was willing to come together.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:26] - The new ideas of solving problems are coming out of smaller companies.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:41] - Growth of security is evolving but is it keeping up with the use and diversity of technology?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:23] - Different countries have a different approach to tracking cyber crime.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:05] - The data isn’t accurate as much cyber crime goes unreported.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:23] - Stephen believes the amount of monetary loss from cyber crime can be doubled in individual wellbeing.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:41] - The effect of being targeted has led to health problems.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:30] - Some countries are doing a better job cracking down on cyber crime, but many kinds of scams, particularly romance scams, continue to go unreported.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:50] - Crypto currency has been abused since it’s onset.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:51] - Tech support scams are also going strong.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:25] - Crypto scams are cumulative. They don’t replace a scam, they add to existing ones.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:48] - People aren’t thinking about what a mess that malware will create in upcoming technology.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:08] - Cyber crime is now organized crime.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:04] - Stephen describes his experience showing NPR the industry of the Dark Web.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[38:52] - People continue to be shocked and amazed by how organized the industry of cyber crime is.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[40:10] - There has been a drop in enthusiasm and trust in technology companies from the general public.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[44:10] - When we push technology on people who do not have a lot of experience with it, security becomes complicated and it becomes an ethical dilemma.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[46:39] - Nothing has been done to make these ethical issues become morally reprimanded.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[48:10] - Cyber crime is a huge challenge that is a relatively recent phenomenon.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[50:40] - Although foreign scammers cannot be arrested in your country, Stephen still thinks they should be sought after.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[52:08] - We need growing economies and full employment in all countries.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>Corporate Spying with Robert Kerbeck</title>
			<itunes:title>Corporate Spying with Robert Kerbeck</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 15 Jun 2022 10:00:21 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[9b576280-34e3-4851-8f0c-34a441397f76]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/120]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Corporate spies are regularly hired by competitors to help poach employees with the best ideas. Listen on to know if it is happening at your company and how to prevent it. Robert Kerbeck is the founder of Malibu Writers Circle and his essays have been featured in numerous magazines and newspapers including Los Angeles Times, San Francisco Chronicle, and Los Angeles Times Magazine with one story adapted in the award winning film Reconnected. His newest memoir</span> <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1586423169?tag=randohouseinc7986-20"> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Ruse: Lying the American Dream From Hollywood to Wall Street</span></em></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">is a look at the world of corporate espionage and his career as a corporate spy. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:08] - Robert never thought he would become an infamous corporate spy. He shares his background and what led him there.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:42] - He was hired and realized it was not the ordinary marketing job he thought it would be.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:46] - The job was determined to be in a “gray area” legally.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:00] - A lot of Robert’s job was over the phone trying to get information out of employees.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:04] - Eventually, Robert would imitate major executives over the phone.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:48] - A lot of the information gathered at the time was employment information.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:07] - Some employees are not listed as team members to avoid being poached.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:11] - Although so much data is available publicly online now, there are still pieces of valuable information that corporate spies can use.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:49] - Corporate plans are valuable to competitors.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:58] - In Robert’s case, blackmail wasn’t utilized, but rather poaching talent.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:54] - Robert describes some of the information that he was gathering. He viewed himself as an actor.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:38] - Sometimes the more outlandish something seems, in a strange way, it becomes more believable.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:24] - In order to target the right person and use the right strategies, Robert had to do a lot of research on the companies he was contacting.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:53] - There are certain areas in a firm where people aren’t following company protocol.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:17] - In the corporate world, there are qualities that create a toxic culture.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:53] - There should be training in place to ensure that employees do not reveal information if they do not know the person.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:18] - Once someone has access to an organizational chart, not only employee names are available.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:02] - The more time spent trying to break a company for the information desired, a corporate spy is gathering small pieces of data.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:23] - There are scams that are designed to target people who have previously been a victim of a scam.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:04] - Robert explains that he never used these skills in his personal life.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:12] - In 2008, jobs were harder to find and Robert left his career as a corporate spy.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:41] - Robert describes his experience in Corporate America.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:27] - Through his experiences, Robert says it was very nerve wracking to attend corporate events as somebody else.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[38:46] - Find Robert’s new book on his website.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 		<item>
			<title>Risk Review Helps Discover Weakness with Ralph Russo</title>
			<itunes:title>Risk Review Helps Discover Weakness with Ralph Russo</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jun 2022 10:00:18 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[3b337736-b408-4304-aa7a-089c95475a76]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/119]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If you are addressing the blindspots in your online security, you cannot prevent the costly impact of lost or hacked data. Today’s guest is Ralph Russo. Ralph retired from the New York Police Department after over 20 years and served as the commanding officer of an organized crime control task force of local, state, and federal law enforcement. He is currently the Director of Tulane University’s School of Professional Advanced Information Technology where he has taught in both homeland security and information technology programs. Ralph holds a bachelor’s of Business Administration and a master’s degree in Information Technology. As an entrepreneur he has co-owned two startup technology firms. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:01] - Ralph shares his current role at Tulane University and shares his interest in information technology.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:15] - As more people become dependent on online systems, the more valuable it becomes.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:50] - As an educator, Ralph engages students in the growing field of cybersecurity.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:42] - Ralph describes qualities of great cybersecurity students.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:32] - Cybersecurity can be compared to traditional security.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:48] - Using traditional security as an example, Ralph says that a single door just isn’t enough.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:41] - “It is so much harder to secure something when you have to retrofit it rather than designing it for security.”</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:02] - In some ways it is harder to bring older companies that work more traditionally on board with updated cybersecurity.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:12] - Ralph believes there is a misunderstanding that small and medium sized businesses may not believe they are a target.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:22] - Sometimes the target is not money, it’s data.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:53] - Now, there is cybersecurity insurance offered which Ralph believes is a good thing.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:01] - In the near future, Ralph believes that if you do not have the most updated software, you will be denied access.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:40] - At Tulane University, the program is designed to have graduates provide value to cybersecurity immediately.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:44] - The separation of tech and cybersecurity from a company’s team is over.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:35] - From a leader’s perspective, a data breach is also a loss of money.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:31] - If you lose your company’s server, can you afford to be down for a week? Likely not.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:08] - In the cloud does not always mean secure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:40] - Hacking is now being done by massive criminal organizations.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:21] - Malware is coming from every direction.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:27] - Responsible disclosure is extremely important.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:05] - Your backup should not be in the same place as your primary location for stored data.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:45] - Ralph shares his ideas on what cybersecurity governance will look like in the future.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:33] - There are daily news stories of cyberattacks. Ralph shares an example.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:33] - Phishing is still a huge problem, but awareness is being raised constantly to help.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[41:06] - Cybercrime undermines a lot of the good that technology does. It reduces trust and introduces fear and confusion.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[43:40] - Courses and resources are available no matter where you are.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://sopa.tulane.edu/degrees-programs/programs-study/information-technology"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Tulane University Information Technology Program</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

Ralph retired from the New York Police Department after over 20 years and served as the commanding officer of an organized crime control task force of local, state, and federal law enforcement. He is currently the Director of Tulane University’s School of Professional Advanced Information Technology where he has taught in both homeland security and information technology programs. Ralph holds a bachelor’s of Business Administration and a master’s degree in Information Technology. As an entrepreneur he has co-owned two startup technology firms. </p> Show Notes: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[1:01] - Ralph shares his current role at Tulane University and shares his interest in information technology.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[2:15] - As more people become dependent on online systems, the more valuable it becomes.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[3:50] - As an educator, Ralph engages students in the growing field of cybersecurity.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[4:42] - Ralph describes qualities of great cybersecurity students.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[6:32] - Cybersecurity can be compared to traditional security.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[8:48] - Using traditional security as an example, Ralph says that a single door just isn’t enough.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[9:41] - “It is so much harder to secure something when you have to retrofit it rather than designing it for security.”</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[12:02] - In some ways it is harder to bring older companies that work more traditionally on board with updated cybersecurity.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[13:12] - Ralph believes there is a misunderstanding that small and medium sized businesses may not believe they are a target.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[14:22] - Sometimes the target is not money, it’s data.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[15:53] - Now, there is cybersecurity insurance offered which Ralph believes is a good thing.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[17:01] - In the near future, Ralph believes that if you do not have the most updated software, you will be denied access.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[18:40] - At Tulane University, the program is designed to have graduates provide value to cybersecurity immediately.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[20:44] - The separation of tech and cybersecurity from a company’s team is over.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[22:35] - From a leader’s perspective, a data breach is also a loss of money.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[23:31] - If you lose your company’s server, can you afford to be down for a week? Likely not.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[25:08] - In the cloud does not always mean secure.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[27:40] - Hacking is now being done by massive criminal organizations.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[29:21] - Malware is coming from every direction.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[32:27] - Responsible disclosure is extremely important.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[34:05] - Your backup should not be in the same place as your primary location for stored data.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[35:45] - Ralph shares his ideas on what cybersecurity governance will look like in the future.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[37:33] - There are daily news stories of cyberattacks. Ralph shares an example.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[39:33] - Phishing is still a huge problem, but awareness is being raised constantly to help.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[41:06] - Cybercrime undermines a lot of the good that technology does. It reduces trust and introduces fear and confusion.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[43:40] - Courses and resources are available no matter where you are.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"> Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://sopa.tulane.edu/degrees-programs/programs-study/information-technology"> Tulane University Information Technology Program</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Forensic Accounting with Leah Wietholter</title>
			<itunes:title>Forensic Accounting with Leah Wietholter</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 01 Jun 2022 10:00:12 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1df7290a-1035-491a-87f1-35fefc002453]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/118]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Data entry may seem boring, but you never know the story behind the information being entered and the patterns that emerge. Some data has distinctive characteristics that point towards fraudulent activities. Today’s guest is Leah Wietholter. Leah is the CEO and founder of Workman Forensics as well as the host of the Investigation Game Podcast. After working for the FBI, she has served as the Senior Certified Fraud Examiner in Tulsa and she currently volunteers as a treasurer for the Tulsa Crime Stoppers. With over 15 years of experience and more than 100 cases worked, Leah has honed her industry expertise to create the Data Sleuth Process, a scalable data-first approach to forensic accounting engagement and fraud investigations. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:03] - Welcome to the show, Leah! Leah shares her background and current role as founder of Workman Forensics.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:08] - What sets Workman Forensics apart is their creative team and Investigation Games.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:26] - Forensics accounting started becoming more common, but Leah shares how she became a part of the FBI accounting team.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:13] - While in the FBI, she was heavily involved in data entry and also testified for grandy jury after Hurricane Katrina.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:58] - Many times, fraud is determined simply by entering data and seeing patterns.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:25] - Leah explains a tool developed by Workman Forensics to see anomalies within data that indicate fraud.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:41] - By building up from this information, categories for fraud risk can easily be seen.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:18] - Business owners need to know what money enters the business, what form of payment, who touches the money, and what money leaves the business.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:29] - Pay close attention to your payroll reports.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:04] - You need to also know what is normal for your business, then always look for things that look off.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:31] - Chris shares an unusual statement he received and why it looked odd.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:08] - People committing embezzlement typically pay themselves in even dollar amounts.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:57] - Indicators allow investigators a more defined set of data to look at more closely.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:46] - If the person in charge of your bookkeeping isn’t reconciling, you have a problem. Leah explains what reconciling is.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:57] - You don’t always know how much money you have if you aren’t reconciling.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:56] - Most scams have a lifespan of 18 months, but in these types of financial fraud cases, Leah says they last several years.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:58] - When it comes to financial fraud, Leah says it can’t always be prevented but it is important to detect it quickly.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:21] - When money comes into your business, a certain amount is already called for. The money stolen is the profit.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:11] - You can limit access to accounts through your bank.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:14] - Leah shares the story of the craziest case she worked on.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:12] - In this case, someone was using their own legitimate business to launder money through fake vendors.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:25] - Many people think that if a large sum is stolen that the money can be found somewhere, but in most cases, it has been spent.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[40:18] - In Tulsa, where Leah is located, there are a lot of casinos but the majority of the embezzlement cases she has worked on are by people with shopping addictions.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[42:31] - One of the suspicious behaviors for high risk is being loved by management but not by others.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[44:24] - The feeling of betrayal is the most emotionally charged in these events.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[45:13] - As the owner, make it a process to check things every month.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[46:50] - A red flag could be if bookkeepers or accountants are defensive when you want to check things.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.workmanforensics.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Workman Forensics Website</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.workmanforensics.com/the-podcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">The Investigation Game Podcast</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.workmanforensics.com/the-investigation-game"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> The Investigation Game</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>The Top 5 Scams of Last Year with Melissa Trumpower</title>
			<itunes:title>The Top 5 Scams of Last Year with Melissa Trumpower</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 25 May 2022 10:00:03 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[e001c116-77c7-46b7-acbb-9aa74ca02217]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/117]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">In 2020 and 2021, the scam that impacted the largest number of people was done through online purchases. Either you or someone you know may very well have been scammed. Today’s guest is Melissa Trumpower. Melissa Trumpower is the Executive Director of the BBB Institute for Marketplace Trust, the Educational Foundation of the Better Business Bureau. Melissa is the co-author of several research reports, including the BBB Scam Tracker Risk Report, the BBB Online Purchase and Employment and Small Business Scam Reports. She has more than 30 years of leadership experience working with not-for-profit, has a bachelor’s degree from Cornell University and a master’s from John Hopkins University.  </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:01] - Welcome to the show, Melissa! Melissa shares her current role with BBB and the mission of the organization.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:05] - Scam trackers from the BBB were created in 2015 to be really intentional and specific to track data on threats.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:30] - Melissa explains why she was drawn to this position with BBB.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:09] - Due to Covid, more people were online in 2020 and 2021 and online purchasing scams were the riskiest.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:25] - The BBB utilizes a risk index that looks at more than just the most prevalent of scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:23] - Online purchase scams don’t involve a lot of money per individual target, but they are riskiest because of how many of them are extremely believable.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:37] - Online purchase scams are simple. You purchase an item from a website or an ad and you never receive the item.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:45] - Be aware that you can come across fake websites in your web searches as well.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:46] - Melissa shares things to look for in sites that you have never purchased from before.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:56] - Don’t do anything rash especially if you feel like something is off.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:03] - The method of payment can be a red flag.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:21] - Crypto is also increasingly used in online purchase scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:43] - Be very careful even when sending crypto to someone you know and be certain you are sending it to the right person.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:04] - Employment scams are another top scam for the third year in a row.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:24] - Employment scams average a loss of over $900 per target.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:38] - Some job listings, especially on Craigslist, tend to be very vague and promising.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:55] - The other two top scams are home improvement scams and investment scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:24] - If you are investing money, do the research before making decisions. 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In 2020 and 2021, the scam that impacted the largest number of people was done through online purchases. Melissa is the co-author of several research reports, including the BBB Scam Tracker Risk Report, the BBB Online Purchase and Employment and Small Business Scam Reports. 			<title>Minimizing Damage From Cyberattacks with Stuart Madnick</title>
			<itunes:title>Minimizing Damage From Cyberattacks with Stuart Madnick</itunes:title>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Many use the internet considering it more like a walk in the park rather than realizing it is more like a trip down a dark alley. Today’s guest is Stuart Madnick. Professor Madnick has been a faculty member at MIT since 1972. He has served as the head of MIT’s IT group for more than 20 years. During that time, the group has been consistently rated number 1 in the nation among schools for information technology programs. Dr. Madnick is a prolific writer and author or co-author of over 380 books, articles, or technical reports and textbooks. He has a degree in Electronic Engineering, Management, and Computer Science from MIT. He has been a visiting professor at Harvard University and six additional countries.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:10] - Dr. Madnick shares his background and current role at MIT.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:53] - There were examples of cybersecurity attacks predating the internet through floppy disks.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:02] - In the late 90s and early 2000s, the internet experienced a boom of users.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:50] - In other industries, safety is a priority.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:53] - Everything, even toothbrushes, have computers in them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:30] - Most know of the common scams, but there are people who still fall victim to them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:18] - Some of the really poorly written scam emails are intentionally created this way to find the most gullible.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:15] - Dr. Madnick describes spear phishing and the rise in these cases.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:30] - In some cases, only a couple hundred dollars could be enough for a scammer and they add up quickly.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:03] - Don’t feel bad if you are hit by a believable scam.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:11] - Most people do not consider what to do to minimize damage.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:56] - If something bad happens to your computer and/or your data, what is your plan?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:54] - Dr. Madnick shares some corporate examples of cyberattacks.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:23] - We constantly have several subconscious decisions that we don’t consider the consequences of.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:16] - Maintaining certificates and security is a tedious and manual task.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:51] - Data is tracked by how attacks were successful rather than how many were unsuccessful.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:10] - Larger companies are starting to give more attention to cybersecurity but the progress is very slow.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:31] - Cybersecurity can be considered a catastrophe.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:30] - What does a cyber catastrophe look like?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:40] - Outages and malfunctions are possible and in catastrophes, a solution can take weeks or more.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:22] - It may not be likely that a catastrophe will happen, but it is possible, and we are unprepared.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:12] - You can’t avoid all risks, but you can minimize the damage done.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:31] - Cybersecurity tends to be a low priority.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[41:17] - What is a “zero-click vulnerability?”</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[43:12] - Cybersecurity education is outdated in most schools.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[44:43] - You can put a better lock on your front door, but if you put your key under the mat, are you any more secure?</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://cams.mit.edu/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Cybersecurity at MIT</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<itunes:title>Hackers Don’t Wear Hoodies with Lisa Plaggemier</itunes:title>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Everyone is at risk when they’re online. But there are simple security measures that you can implement that will make it more difficult to be hacked. Today’s guest is Lisa Plaggemier. Lisa is the Interim Executive Director for the National Cybersecurity Alliance. She has held executive roles with Ford Motor Company, InfoSec, and Media Pro. She is also a frequent speaker at major events and is a thought leader for innovative security trainings and awareness programs. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:05] - The National Cybersecurity Alliance has a mission to enable a more secure interconnected world.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:45] - Lisa was working in sales and marketing with Ford Motor Company, but shares an experience that changed her career trajectory.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:27] - Lisa created a series of videos that became popular with viewers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:58] - Security professionals are well intentioned, but when educating people who are not technologists, you want to give just enough to stay interested.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:21] - People use technology to enhance their lives. The internet was never built to be secure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:30] - Doing things securely doesn’t always mean that the user should be frustrated.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:04] - With keeping track of passwords, Lisa reveals the common misconception of password management sites.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:28] - Another problem is with business accounts and corporations where employees think the company handles security.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:23] - Unfortunately, there are some sites that don’t make using a password manager easy.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:31] - It really isn’t necessary to change your password every 90 days as was previously important to do.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:46] - It is important for people to research a company and their possible security breaches before doing business.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:57] - Part of many sites are requiring two factor authentication as a part of the setup process.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:27] - What if everyone did two factor authentication?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:46] - Lisa shares some stereotypes of hackers and phishing emails. Updates are usually security driven.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:47] - The language barrier between employees of a company and the IT department is something that needs to be bridged.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:31] - There are a lot of free resources available on the National Cybersecurity Alliance’s website.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey.
