		<item>
			<title>The Impact of Cyberbullying with Tina Meier</title>
			<itunes:title>The Impact of Cyberbullying with Tina Meier</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 04 May 2022 10:00:06 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[6d8dbcf6-7156-459e-b282-ea6cd93e6fe0]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/114]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400;">It is easy for people to create fake online profiles and say or do whatever they want as a cyberbully. They often don’t think through the possible consequences of their actions. Today’s guest is Tina Meier. Tina is the Executive Director of The Megan Meier Foundation. Her life was forever changed on October 16, 2006 when Tina’s 13 year old daughter Megan Taylor Meier took her own life after being cyberbullied by an adult neighbor posing as a fictitious boy named Josh Evans. Her belief is that if there is even just one child that struggles with bullying, cyberbullying, or self-harm, that is one too many and we must be there to help and support them.</span> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:08] - Megan struggled with self-worth and self-esteem. Tina shares Megan’s story of meeting a boy on MySpace.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:50] - The things that were being said online were not true and Megan began defending herself. She felt like her mother was not on her side.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:52] - Megan took her own life.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:45] - After Megan’s passing, the boy’s MySpace account was deleted. It turned out that it was a fake account created by the neighbor.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:03] - It is hard to fathom that an adult was behind this, however Tina does not believe that Megan would take her own life.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:27] - The FBI investigated and determined who was behind the fake account.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:50] - The court case was a first of its kind and Tina explains the process and results.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:15] - Tina took her focus to beginning the Megan Meier Foundation to help other kids.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:34] - In the early 2000s, there were really no restrictions or laws in place to help protect people.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:02] - When your child is young, talk to them about the rules and make sure they understand.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:32] - For adolescents, share stories like Megan’s story.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:20] - Who will your child feel comfortable coming to in a time of crisis?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:15] - Be aware of behavior changes.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:21] - Check in with teachers and school staff to see if behavior changes take place at school, too.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:24] - Listen to your child and validate their feelings. </span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:45] - There’s the concern of the other party knowing you’ve taken a screenshot. Tina advises getting another device and blocking them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:12] - Kids are smart and don’t want to see their parents upset so they pretend to be okay.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:18] - If your child has expressed thoughts of self-harm, stay calm.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:17] - When they’re young, parents tend to want to fix everything for them and protect them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:40] - Technology has made things easier for kids to create fake accounts. Schools can only do so much.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:31] - Bullying and cyberbullying are so complex because there are no quick fixes.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:30] - Learn social media platforms to see how kids are interacting on them. Tina shares several helpful links.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:31] - Some parents feel like they need to hack into their child’s social media account, but Tina explains that all you are doing is panicking.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:31] - As a parent, you will make mistakes.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[40:57] - The Megan Meier Foundation has tons of resources and their support does not cost anything.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.meganmeierfoundation.org/about-tina-meier"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Megan Meier Foundation</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/meganmeierfoundation"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Megan Meier Foundation Facebook</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= 			<title>Can You Protect Intellectual Property? with David Cooper</title>
			<itunes:title>Can You Protect Intellectual Property? with David Cooper</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 27 Apr 2022 10:00:25 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[bc297d36-9a3f-434c-9654-c11d82af0f4e]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/113]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">When buying from Amazon, you might think that all products come directly from the manufacturer to Amazon warehouses. But that is not always the case. Learn how to spot potential counterfeit products and protect yourself and your brand on Amazon. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is David Cooper. David is the CEO and founder of IPSecure, which is an innovative new way to protect your intellectual property on Amazon, control your sales channel, and ensure every purchase of your product on Amazon is a positive and reputable shopping experience. He has spent 20 years building and deploying brand protection solutions for hundreds of global brands such as the NFL, J&J, Apple, and Rolex.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:00] - David shares his background and information on his company IPSecure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:02] - eCommerce is huge, but is still only a fraction of the size of total retail.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:42] - Solutions in this space are almost always legal.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:35] - Finding counterfeiters has no impact but companies tend to measure how many are found. IPSecure measures everyone.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:28] - You can’t quantify how much risk was avoided.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:01] - When a counterfeiter is taken down, more pop up. </span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:30] - Brand protection is something David advises to add for customers.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:12] - There are some universal signs of counterfeit products, but there are also some signs that are specific to Amazon.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:43] - Amazon has a specific algorithm that chooses who sees what products. Check the store’s profile.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:32] - It is easy to be deceived on a marketplace site. David illustrates this with a Samsung camera purchase that was a parallel import.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:42] - There is nothing wrong with buying and reselling something, but there is a gray market problem.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:21] - These legal solutions are very expensive.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:02] - Amazon is proactive in some areas, but generally speaking, they do not monitor products belonging to specific brands.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:16] - For most brands, selling on Amazon is necessary.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:19] - Even if a brand pulls out of Amazon, their products are likely still being sold on Amazon and that could be a liability.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:49] - Instead of focusing on taking down other profiles and sellers, IPSecure focuses on building your own brand to be a successful one.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:45] - While challenging, Amazon does more than any other company to help brands with this concern.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:32] - People are much more aware of these concerns as Amazon has grown.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:18] - Congress is taking a look at how Amazon runs, but there have been many distractions from these issues with the current world climate.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:19] - It is very complex with a lot of moving parts. IPSecure integrates well with a lot of different platforms.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:52] - Smaller businesses cannot afford to lose a sale to a counterfeiter and likely cannot hire a lawyer.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[40:41] - David shares the story of a client whose business exploded after their product was on a reality show. Counterfeiters popped up very quickly.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[43:33] - As a trademark owner, you are responsible for monitoring.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[46:12] - Brand protection can actually increase revenue.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.ipsecureinc.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">IPSecure Website</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/contactdavidcooper"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">David Cooper on LinkedIn</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>7 Ways to Reduce Anxiety with Dr. Michele Borba</title>
			<itunes:title>7 Ways to Reduce Anxiety with Dr. Michele Borba</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 20 Apr 2022 10:00:04 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[b80c4d75-76a3-4419-a3b3-8158f6156886]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/112]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The CDC states that since the Covid-19 pandemic began, one in every three children has been diagnosed with a mental health disorder such as anxiety or ADHD. It is more important than ever to learn how and to teach techniques to help reduce stress and anxiety. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Dr. Michele Borba. Dr. Borba is an internationally renowned educator and award-winning author of 24 books. She is a motivational speaker having spoken in 19 countries on 5 continents and has served as a consultant to hundreds of schools and corporations like Sesame Street, Harvard, The US Air Force Academy, and the Royal Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi. Dr. Borba is an NBC contributor who has been on countless shows including Today, Dateline, Dr. Oz, Anderson Cooper, CNN, and more. Her work is featured in Time, Washington Post, Newsweek, Boston Globe, US News and World Report, and many others.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:30] - Dr. Borba started her career as a special education teacher and has learned how resilient kids truly are.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:03] - We can’t point the finger at one specific cause. We need to focus on what to do about it.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:07] - Dr. Borba describes a study done over the course of 40 years.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:25] - What are the things we need to teach to help manage anxiety or prevent it?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:35] - Connect with teachers. Kids act differently at school than they do at home.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:33] - Teachers see trends in behaviors in their class.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:16] - A major change in society is that getting mental health services is more acceptable.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:23] - Give kids a range of ideas to help your children.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:12] - When you suggest a hobby, it isn’t a sport or activity that you have to add to the agenda. It is something they choose to do.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:37] - Hobbies, pets, music, etc. can be tools that work for some kids.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:29] - Everyone has a different stress sign.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:18] - Dr. Borba shares a breathing technique great for both kids and adults.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:21] - By learning these strategies, kids can build muscle memory.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:21] - Thrivers have the tools to pull from to deal with stress.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:44] - Your voice and family mantra can become your child’s inner voice.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:00] - Volunteering helps build hope and empathy.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:03] - There are many ways to build empathy but be intentional.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:34] - Teach emotional literacy.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:50] - Many social skills are in dormant mode right now.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:03] - Kids can also feed off the stress of their parents.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:18] - Our society tends to focus on performance which can add levels of stress.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:32] - Kids are becoming ruder and civility needs to be retaught.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:10] - Empathy is a super power and is the glue that holds society together.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. She is a motivational speaker having spoken in 19 countries on 5 continents and has served as a consultant to hundreds of schools and corporations like Sesame Street, Harvard, The US Air Force Academy, and the Royal Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi. Dr. Borba is an NBC contributor who has been on countless shows including Today, Dateline, Dr. Oz, Anderson Cooper, CNN, and more. Her work is featured in Time, Washington Post, Newsweek, Boston Globe, US News and World Report, and many others.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[1:30] - Dr. Borba started her career as a special education teacher and has learned how resilient kids truly are.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[4:03] - We can’t point the finger at one specific cause. We need to focus on what to do about it.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[5:07] - Dr. Borba describes a study done over the course of 40 years.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[6:25] - What are the things we need to teach to help manage anxiety or prevent it?</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[8:35] - Connect with teachers. Kids act differently at school than they do at home.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[9:33] - Teachers see trends in behaviors in their class.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[10:16] - A major change in society is that getting mental health services is more acceptable.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[11:23] - Give kids a range of ideas to help your children.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[13:12] - When you suggest a hobby, it isn’t a sport or activity that you have to add to the agenda. It is something they choose to do.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[14:37] - Hobbies, pets, music, etc. can be tools that work for some kids.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[15:29] - Everyone has a different stress sign.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[16:18] - Dr. Borba shares a breathing technique great for both kids and adults.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[18:21] - By learning these strategies, kids can build muscle memory.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[20:21] - Thrivers have the tools to pull from to deal with stress.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[21:44] - Your voice and family mantra can become your child’s inner voice.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[23:00] - Volunteering helps build hope and empathy.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[25:03] - There are many ways to build empathy but be intentional.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[26:34] - Teach emotional literacy.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[27:50] - Many social skills are in dormant mode right now.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[29:03] - Kids can also feed off the stress of their parents.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[30:18] - Our society tends to focus on performance which can add levels of stress.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[33:32] - Kids are becoming ruder and civility needs to be retaught.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[36:10] - Empathy is a super power and is the glue that holds society together.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"> Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://micheleborba.com/">MicheleBorba.com</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Michele-Borba/e/B001JSDFKO%3Fref=dbs_a_mng_rwt_scns_share"> Books by Dr. Michele Borba</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/drmicheleborba/?hl=en">Michele Borba on Instagram</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-michele-borba-b4b5055/"> Dr. Michele Borba on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Don’t Miss Opportunities Created by AI with Howard Getson</title>
			<itunes:title>Don’t Miss Opportunities Created by AI with Howard Getson</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 13 Apr 2022 10:00:15 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[29657876-64a9-4ba0-bf75-5bc39a6e98f2]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/111]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are living in a world where AI can do many of the things people have been doing, thus creating an opportunity for us to create and do something new. Not understanding this transition can leave us unnecessarily exposed to risk. Today’s guest is Howard Getson. Howard is the President and CEO at Capitalogix. He runs an algorithm hedge fund and the data science company that powers it. Capitalogix created a revolutionary financial technology platform that uses adaptive AI to maximize performance with real time insights. His prior company, Intelligent Control which he founded in 1991, was an Inc. 500 company and won an IBM award for Best Business Application. Howard is currently on the advisory counsel over a bio ethics and research institute.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:16] - Welcome to the show, Howard! He shares his background and what he does currently with Capitalogix.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:00] - People are interested in things like AI and automation because they want to amplify intelligence.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:26] - This technology gives entrepreneurs amazing opportunities to provide value.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:20] - How did AOL change the technology landscape? People are good at knowing something is about to change.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:40] - Think about 3 pieces of technology that already exist that you know are going to change the landscape in the next few years.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:57] - It’s not a question about something being created but rather what implications it has.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:43] - Even though we knew the internet would be big, we didn’t think about the consequences or the role they themselves would play.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:05] - You don’t have to be the person to create the technology, but how can you find opportunities in the future?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:14] - What happens when AI gets smarter than us? Howard says it already is.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:04] - Howard shares a personal story that demonstrates how technology has gotten so good so fast that scams are moving quickly.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:44] - As we get these technologies, it frees people up to do more.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:40] - What impact do these technologies have on false information?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:24] - Technology is going to learn how to lie as a strategy.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:04] - Data is the biggest problem AI sees right now.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:47] - You want AI to create new opportunities not to relieve you of things you do so you can do nothing.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:46] - Howard doesn’t try to predict technology, but rather human behavior.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:22] - It’s not about what it does, but rather what it makes possible.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:20] - Current technology then becomes a prototype for something new.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:35] - With AI, the result is exponential results. There are 3 key drivers to make that happen.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:36] - Data science is about finding a profound truth hidden by noise. Discover is an important verb.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:49] - Build, scale, and refine. </span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:25] - Knowing something worked is different from knowing it is currently working.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:33] - Text “AI” to 972-992-1100 for a presentation on the methodology.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:50] - Howard believes that everyone will be able to leverage AI in the next 25 years.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:18] - We live in a world that gets faster and better everyday.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: style= "font-weight: 400;">Howard Getson on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/hgetson"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Howard Getson 		<item>
			<title>When Violence is the Answer with Tim Larkin</title>
			<itunes:title>When Violence is the Answer with Tim Larkin</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 06 Apr 2022 10:00:35 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[b0ffd53d-128f-4bd1-a09a-96c24536207e]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/110]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400;">Too often people seek training after they’ve had an encounter or violent situation. Criminals look to exploit us for one thing that we all possess. Listen on to find out what that is. Today’s guest is Tim Larkin. Tim is the founder and creator of Target Focus Training and is well known for self-defense and close combat training. During the last 20 years, he has trained not only law enforcement, the US Navy Seals, Army Special Forces, and the US Border Patrol, but also corporate clientele from around the world. He is an author and a public speaker in over 40 countries. </span> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:52] - Tim describes his background and how he found himself passionate about combat and combat training.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:43] - Initially, Tim’s goal was to become a Navy Seal.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:39] - Tim’s eardrum was busted during a dive with the Navy Seals, and he lost control of his body. This injury changed his career trajectory.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:02] - Because of his extensive training in hand-to-hand combat, Tim became involved in a different program.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:50] - At the time of 9/11, Tim began working with civilians.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:02] - You should always be proactive.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:58] -  Mentally, the injury was devastating for Tim.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:29] - None of the experiences he has had would have happened if he had the traditional Seal career he planned on.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:26] - Once someone experiences something challenging, they then become proactive to make it not happen again.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:49] - The biggest threat is the smartphone. </span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:18] - To demonstrate this danger, Tim shares the story of a bus robbery. You can watch the video</span> <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tmxq5G9D_Ik"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">here</span></a><span style= "font-weight: 400;">.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:49] - Behavior with your phone becomes second nature.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:04] - We spend our downtime on the smartphone, but Tim always keeps one ear out.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:03] - There are tons of positives about smartphone technology, but in public, it can be used against you.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:46] - Tim shows how to detect a possible predator with a personal anecdote.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:41] - We can’t pick out predators. It is impossible to tell as they blend in.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:15] - Tim interacts with everyone assuming they are violent to ensure safety.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[33:26] - As a society, we can get away with a lot of different types of social interactions, but anything you do or say can trigger someone else.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:33] - If you understand the predator's role, everything is backed up by the possibility of violence.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[38:10] - Highly recommended is Robert Green’s book</span> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Law of Human Nature</span></em><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:59] - Study human behavior and you’ll learn about others and yourself.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[42:00] - When is it okay to use the tool of violence? 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[Too often people seek training after they’ve had an encounter or violent situation. Criminals look to exploit us for one thing that we all possess. Listen on to find out what that is. Today’s guest is Tim Larkin. Tim is the founder and creator of Target Focus Training and is well known for self-defense and close combat training. During the last 20 years, he has trained not only law enforcement, the US Navy Seals, Army Special Forces, and the US Border Patrol, but also corporate clientele from around the world. He is an author and a public speaker in over 40 countries.  Show Notes: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[0:52] - Tim describes his background and how he found himself passionate about combat and combat training.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[2:43] - Initially, Tim’s goal was to become a Navy Seal.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[3:39] - Tim’s eardrum was busted during a dive with the Navy Seals, and he lost control of his body. This injury changed his career trajectory.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[6:02] - Because of his extensive training in hand-to-hand combat, Tim became involved in a different program.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[7:50] - At the time of 9/11, Tim began working with civilians.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[9:02] - You should always be proactive.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[10:58] -  Mentally, the injury was devastating for Tim.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[13:29] - None of the experiences he has had would have happened if he had the traditional Seal career he planned on.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[16:26] - Once someone experiences something challenging, they then become proactive to make it not happen again.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[17:49] - The biggest threat is the smartphone. </li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[19:18] - To demonstrate this danger, Tim shares the story of a bus robbery. The goal is to take the brain out of the equation.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[52:00] - For criminals, violence is their currency.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[53:51] - Tim explains what cause state is.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[56:12] - Your brain is incredible and if you give it permission, it will solve problems.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>Hostage Taking with Rachel Briggs OBE</title>
			<itunes:title>Hostage Taking with Rachel Briggs OBE</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 30 Mar 2022 10:00:55 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[0f08daf9-0a95-484f-8724-ab0ee86ded1e]]></guid>

			<description><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400;">Money is not the only reason somebody can be taken hostage. It’s important to know the other motives for how and why targets are selected. Today’s guest is Rachel Briggs. Rachel has spent the last two decades as a writer, analyst, and strategist working with corporations, governments, and international NGOs developing security. She was the first director of Hostage International and the founding executive director of Hostage US. Rachel co-chairs the European commission's group that is working on tackling online extremism. The report she wrote, “The Business of Resilience,” has become the blueprint for corporate security management. </span> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:03] - Rachel shares her background and how a personal experience of a family member being taken hostage impacted her future.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:50] - One type of hostage situation is political hostage taking.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:49] - Economical hostage cases are what happens most often.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:30] - Hostage diplomacy is a third type that creates negotiation pressure.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:19] - Latin America is more of a hotspot for kidnapping and Rachel points out Colombia and Mexico as predominant locations.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:26] - Political kidnapping is most common in Middle Eastern and African countries.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:24] - Common targets are those who are the ones who run towards danger such as journalists.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:50] - Rachel describes another type of target that applied to her family member who was taken in the 90s.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:27] - People on vacation being picked up as a hostage are not as common, but it isn’t unheard of.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:01] - The experience of being held against your will is never a pleasant experience, but the way you are treated varies.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:00] - Hostage takers operate as a business in some situations.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:07] - The statistics of hostage taking are very underreported.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:33] - These crimes prey on the desperation to get a person home.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:21] - Stopping the payment of ransoms is not the answer to stopping kidnappings.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:05] - There are many different ways to make an exchange of money for ransom.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:33] - It is rare and dangerous, but sometimes a hostage escapes their situation or is rescued by military operations.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:21] - There are resources that list dangerous locations.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:45] - Insurance for kidnapping and hostage is available.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:59] - After the events in Syria in 2014, groups have been created to provide this insurance to freelance journalists.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:33] - Every situation is different, but Rachel describes the commonalities in how families cope.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:37] - There are issues that families experience that we don’t think about being a problem.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:42] - There are now strategies being implemented in large corporations.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[39:18] - What is virtual kidnapping?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[42:27] - The psychological impact can be long lasting and significant.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[43:22] - While underreported, kidnapping and hostage taking are more common than we think.</span></li> </ul> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/"><span aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.clarityfactory.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">ClarityFactory Website</span></a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/rachelbriggsuk?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Rachel Briggs on Twitter</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Get Rich Quick Schemes Vs. Investments with Justin Donald</title>
			<itunes:title>Get Rich Quick Schemes Vs. Investments with Justin Donald</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 16 Mar 2022 10:00:27 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[b66b20ad-5da8-4904-82aa-eecaad8d95db]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/107]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<span style="font-weight: 400;">Many people have lost money trying to grow their wealth, but how do you know when an investment is too good to be true? Today’s guest is Justin Donald. Justin is the host of the Lifestyle Investor Podcast and author of the bestselling book</span> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Lifestyle Investor: The Ten Commandments of Cash Flow Investing for Passive Income and Financial Freedom</span></em><span style="font-weight: 400;">. He consults and advises entrepreneurs, executives, and successful media personalities on lifestyle living. Justin has also appeared on nearly 100 podcasts including Entrepreneurs on Fire, The Mike Dillard Show, Making Bank, The Accelerated Investor, and Unbecoming.</span> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:02] - Through his company Lifestyle Investor, Justin teaches others how to create a lifestyle that is compelling and purposeful.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:31] - Justin’s mission is to help people buy their time back.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:34] - In many cases, people have lost millions of dollars in poor investment decisions.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:51] - If you want to build wealth, you need to have a strong ecosystem.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:53] - A lot of people in financial services are not in alignment with their clients and the system is manipulative.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:40] - Justin didn’t start out asking specific questions and now he always asks those in financial services.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:02] - You have to do your own work and math to make sure things are not manipulated.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:10] - There are incredible opportunities to make money but also to lose money. Not all projects are the same.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:10] - ICOs are super high risk and Justin advises to avoid them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:11] - If something is guaranteeing returns, it’s a red flag. There’s always some form of risk.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:26] - Justin admits that he has lost money in situations where he didn’t see the signs in time.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:49] - There are some red flags to look for and Justin shares some examples.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[21:42] - Having cash flow is important first and then investing becomes safer.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:29] - Almost every business partnership is going to end at some time and 90% or more of them end poorly.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:58] - Always have open conversations and express concerns when making decisions.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:56] - Justin also advises to be careful that you aren’t buying another job and you are looking for passive income.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:51] - What is a targeted return?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:13] - Don’t be lured in by a good targeted return. Justin advises on what to look at instead.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:38] - You want to know how your investments will do if things don’t go according to plan.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:17] - Justin gives an example to illustrate how returns work.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[37:50] - Justin is offering his book free to listeners by going to his website</span> <a href= "http://lifestyleinvestorbook.com"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">LifestyleInvestorBook.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. </span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Justin advises on what to look at instead.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[34:38] - You want to know how your investments will do if things don’t go according to plan.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[36:17] - Justin gives an example to illustrate how returns work.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[37:50] - Justin is offering his book free to listeners by going to his website <a href= "http://lifestyleinvestorbook.com">LifestyleInvestorBook.com</a>. </li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"> Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://justindonald.com/">Justin Donald Website</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08RLMP6BF/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1"> <em>The Lifestyle Investor: The 10 Commandments of Cash Flow Investing for Passive Income and Financial Freedom</em> by Justin Donald</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-lifestyle-investor-investing-passive-income-wealth/id1541009357"> The Lifestyle Investor Podcast</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Negotiating with Chris Voss</title>
			<itunes:title>Negotiating with Chris Voss</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 09 Mar 2022 11:00:13 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[384a79a3-06c6-4b09-a4fc-a82950632129]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/106]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Negotiating doesn’t just take place in hostage situations or in big board rooms. You can end up in conversations exchanging the commodity of your time without even realizing you are in a negotiation. Listen on to learn how to be more aware of these interactions. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Chris Voss. During Chris’s 24 years of FBI experience, he was trained in the art of negotiation not only by the FBI but by Scotland Yard and Harvard Business School. He is the former FBI Lead International Kidnapping Negotiator. Chris is the author of the negotiating bestseller</span> <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/dp/B018FHCPDO/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1"> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Never Split the Difference</span></em></a> <span style="font-weight: 400;">and is the founder and CEO of The Black Swan Group. Chris has taught business negotiation in the MBA programs and has been an adjunct professor at numerous schools of business. He has used his many years of experience to develop a unique program and team that applies these globally proven techniques to the business world.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:20] - Chris Voss shares his background and how he got into understanding negotiation skills.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:38] - In his book, Chris presents strategies in specific actionable language.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:20] - There are times when you are negotiating and you don’t know it.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:22] - We often think that negotiations always include money, but time and implementation are also commodities.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:16] - The second you</span> <em><span style= "font-weight: 400;">want</span></em> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">something, you are in a negotiation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:11] - Chris explains the results of experimenting with changing the yes questions to no questions.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:08] - The skills in The Black Swan Method are neutral.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:50] - If you have a bad feeling, proceed with caution. The more you question, the stronger your instinct will be.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:31] - Chris Voss describes The Black Swan Method and its solid foundation of skills.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:20] - Your gut instinct is probably pretty good. Listen to your feelings and think about using the skills to test your gut instinct.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:30] - Your subconscious can process much more than your conscious mind.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:30] - Chris Voss demonstrates how anger impacts your decisions.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:05] - Strategic umbridge is when someone purposefully makes another person angry during negotiation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:01] - Dynamic silence is an appropriate response to bringing another’s emotions back down.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:20] - Decision fatigue is something that needs to be factored into negotiation.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:57] - What is the science behind responding to no-oriented questions?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:32] - There is a better solution than splitting the difference.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:02] - What is the craziest negotiation Chris was involved in?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[36:01] - 20% of the business deals presented are fake opportunities.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[38:57] - It is more impactful and profitable to have a relationship.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[40:11] - Chris Voss describes an impossible to fulfill request in a hostage situation in the early 2000s.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[41:01] - Stop using the term “pick your brain” when asking for something.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[42:06] - It is important to show empathy.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 			<title>Identity Theft of Children with Kelli Grant</title>
			<itunes:title>Identity Theft of Children with Kelli Grant</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 02 Mar 2022 11:00:26 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c0c3e6ac-63f9-4f1d-8d47-ec3cc06dfa14]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/105]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Would it shock you to know that over 1 million children under the age of 9 have had their identity stolen in the last year alone? It is important to be aware of how this can happen and what you need to do to prevent it from happening to your children. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Kelli Grant. Kelli is currently Senior Editor at CNBC and was the Senior Consumer Reporter at Marketwatch and Smart Money. Kelli has earned the certified financial planner designation which recognizes financial advisors who meet education, experience, and ethics requirements, and have passed tough industry exams. Her work has appeared in the Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, Kipplinger’s Personal Finance, Good Housekeeping, Family Circle, and other publications. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:15] - Kelli shares her background and expertise in the field. </span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:07] - What is the difference between identity theft and fraud?</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:12] - Identity theft of children happens mostly through forms and paper.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:56] - In some cases, organizations that need private information in records don’t know how to manage it safely.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:38] - In many cases, organizations that ask for a Social Security Number don’t even need it. Kelli advises leaving it blank first to see if they ask for it.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:42] - Double check the questions being asked that may seem unimportant.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:45] - Children are attractive targets of identity theft because it goes undetected for years.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:47] - A blank slate can be manipulated into anything.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:14] - Kelli lists some of the red flags that a child’s identity has been compromised.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:01] - Kelli explains the pros and cons of freezing your child’s credit until they need it.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:08] - Freezing credit is not fool proof and does not prevent all fraud and theft.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:01] - Experts say they see more frequent attempts at Familiar Fraud during times of economic distress.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:51] - Include your children in conversations about keeping private information safe and secure and how to spot a scam.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[28:42] - Children shouldn’t necessarily know their Social Security Number until they are teens applying for jobs or financial aid.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[29:41] - Be aware when data breaches take place and take the steps to keep your information safe.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[31:50] - Cleaning up identity theft is very messy and difficult. Kelli explains that there are some insurance policies that are good resources.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:01] - Insurance policies are easily available due to the high need.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:18] - Leave certain pieces of information off of forms and don’t even mention it unless the organization asks.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NNSYJH2/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1"> <em><span>The Less People Know About Us: A Mystery of Betrayal, Family Secrets, and Stolen Identity</span></em></a> <span>by Axton Betz-Hamilton</span></li> </ul>]]></description>
			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Would it shock you to know that over 1 million children under the age of 9 have had their identity stolen in the last year alone? It is important to be aware of how this can happen and what you need to do to prevent it from happening to your children. </p> <p>Today’s guest is Kelli Grant. Kelli is currently Senior Editor at CNBC and was the Senior Consumer Reporter at Marketwatch and Smart Money. Kelli has earned the certified financial planner designation which recognizes financial advisors who meet education, experience, and ethics requirements, and have passed tough industry exams. Her work has appeared in the Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, Kipplinger’s Personal Finance, Good Housekeeping, Family Circle, and other publications. </p> Show Notes: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[1:15] - Kelli shares her background and expertise in the field. </li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[3:07] - What is the difference between identity theft and fraud?</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[4:12] - Identity theft of children happens mostly through forms and paper.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[5:56] - In some cases, organizations that need private information in records don’t know how to manage it safely.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[7:38] - In many cases, organizations that ask for a Social Security Number don’t even need it. Kelli advises leaving it blank first to see if they ask for it.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[9:42] - Double check the questions being asked that may seem unimportant.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[11:45] - Children are attractive targets of identity theft because it goes undetected for years.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[13:47] - A blank slate can be manipulated into anything.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[16:14] - Kelli lists some of the red flags that a child’s identity has been compromised.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[18:01] - Kelli explains the pros and cons of freezing your child’s credit until they need it.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[20:08] - Freezing credit is not fool proof and does not prevent all fraud and theft.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[23:01] - Experts say they see more frequent attempts at Familiar Fraud during times of economic distress.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[26:51] - Include your children in conversations about keeping private information safe and secure and how to spot a scam.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[28:42] - Children shouldn’t necessarily know their Social Security Number until they are teens applying for jobs or financial aid.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[29:41] - Be aware when data breaches take place and take the steps to keep your information safe.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[31:50] - Cleaning up identity theft is very messy and difficult. Kelli explains that there are some insurance policies that are good resources.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[34:01] - Insurance policies are easily available due to the high need.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[35:18] - Leave certain pieces of information off of forms and don’t even mention it unless the organization asks.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"> Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://twitter.com/kelligrant">Kelli Grant on Twitter</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/kelligrantcfp/">Kelli Grant on LinkedIn</a></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NNSYJH2/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1"> <em>The Less People Know About Us: A Mystery of Betrayal, Family Secrets, and Stolen Identity</em></a> by Axton Betz-Hamilton</li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

Her personal blog Eco Frugal Living focuses on ways to save money and live green at the same time. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:51] - 			<title>Pet Scams with Jack Whittaker</title>
			<itunes:title>Pet Scams with Jack Whittaker</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 16 Feb 2022 11:00:43 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[12a4ba7c-b364-4874-9e18-b8331205cc06]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/103]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Once someone is emotionally invested in purchasing a new pet, it’s easier to be manipulated and defrauded. We want to share ways that you can be sure not to get scammed. Today’s guest is Jack Whittaker. Jack is a PhD candidate in Criminology with published works in the field of online fraud. He has presented at several fraud conferences as well as has done expert interviews for both national and international news outlets. Jack also helps run a voluntary counter fraud initiative called PetScams.com and occasionally teaches cybercrime awareness to school children.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[1:04] - Jack shares how he became involved with PetScams.com.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[2:00] - Pet scams are very unique to certain countries including the United States.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:25] - Pet scams originally come from Cameroon. </span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[4:46] - An offender will create a website and set up Google ads. They spend tons of money to start this sometimes with stolen cards and reinvestment.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:56] - There are fake sites listed on Facebook, Twitter, and Pinterest to generate more traffic.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[7:59] - Victims of these scams tend to be people who are very vulnerable.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:32] - After the victim pays a deposit, the offender then contacts them as a fake shipping company to charge them more.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:44] - These scams are social engineering at its finest.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[12:04] - If the person building the website is skilled, legitimate websites can be copied as a fake.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:02] - For now, the best advice is to video chat with the breeder to see the pet. And even better than that, visit the breeder in person.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:20] - Chris shares the story of almost being scammed when purchasing a pet.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:30] - Scammers use an address they find of a property that is for sale somewhere. It has caused problems for the buyers of that home later.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:50] - International scams make things very tricky.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[19:54] - Jack explains the different kinds of money mules.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:32] - Once things are figured out, scammers have adapted. Offenders are always two steps ahead.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[25:10] - There is a minimum threshold for crimes to be looked into.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:12] - Non-refundable payment methods are a huge red flag.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[27:49] - Pet scammers often run other types of scams simultaneously and typically follow trends.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[30:01] - There are scams that target victims who are in a place where they will not report the crime for fear of their own arrest.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[32:14] - Jack describes the hierarchy of scams.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[34:08] - Some scammers also torment their targets.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[35:43] - Once someone is scammed, their information is shared to other scammers.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href= And even better than that, visit the breeder in person.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[14:20] - Chris shares the story of almost being scammed when purchasing a pet.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[15:30] - Scammers use an address they find of a property that is for sale somewhere. It has caused problems for the buyers of that home later.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[17:50] - International scams make things very tricky.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[19:54] - Jack explains the different kinds of money mules.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[23:32] - Once things are figured out, scammers have adapted. Offenders are always two steps ahead.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[25:10] - There is a minimum threshold for crimes to be looked into.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[26:12] - Non-refundable payment methods are a huge red flag.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[27:49] - Pet scammers often run other types of scams simultaneously and typically follow trends.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[30:01] - There are scams that target victims who are in a place where they will not report the crime for fear of their own arrest.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[32:14] - Jack describes the hierarchy of scams.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[34:08] - Some scammers also torment their targets.</li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1">[35:43] - Once someone is scammed, their information is shared to other scammers.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey.
