			<pubDate>Wed, 09 Feb 2022 11:00:47 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[81e73732-ff6e-4646-8c85-1ad0b16dbba0]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/102]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">In today’s society, online dating is common. But what are the warning signs that you may be targeted by a scammer? Today’s guest is Joe Eweka. Joe is a criminal justice professional, security management specialist, project management professional, and the author of the book</span> <a href= "https://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/confessions-of-a-lonely-lover-joe-eweka-pmp/1140181368"> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Confessions of a Lonely Lover: An Exploration of Online Dating Scams</span></em></a><em><span style= "font-weight: 400;">.</span></em></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[0:40] - Joe shares his background as originally from Nigeria and attending college and graduate school in criminal justice and law in the United States.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[3:13] - Because of being long distance, Joe joined a social network to be able to better communicate with his brother and found himself in a scam.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[5:16] - Catfishing is another term for romance scams and Joe says they are the most dangerous.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[6:33] - One red flag is that the person you are speaking with tries to take your conversation off a dating app.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[8:13] - Scammers lie a lot and work in teams. Sometimes you may catch inconsistencies.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[9:00] - Watch the profile photo as well. If things look too good to be true, they probably are.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[10:20] - Be suspicious if you cannot find anything at all about a person.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[11:28] - Scammers often used borrowed text. Copy the suspicious text and paste it in a Google search.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[13:06] - Scammers avoid video calls.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[14:28] - Deep fake technology exists but is not commonplace in dating scams yet.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[15:35] - Strange steps in the process like money orders, money transfers, and the purchase of several gift cards are major red flags.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[16:34] - Do not accept friend requests from people you don’t know on social media and never send money to them.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[17:47] - Joe advises using a computer to check links because you can hover your cursor over it to see the URL before you click. You cannot do this on a phone.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[18:50] - Don’t assume that because you are the one to make the first contact that they are not a scammer.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[20:03] - If you use a dating app, limit your communication to just the app.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[22:10] - Do not rush and be sure to ask a lot of questions. Cut off all communication with anyone who seems suspicious.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[23:30] - If you are meeting someone in person, you should always meet in a public place and with other people you know.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[24:42] - Never go to another country to meet someone in person who you have never met before.</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">[26:35] - Always report scammers.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>Business Ethics with Scott Stratten</title>
			<itunes:title>Business Ethics with Scott Stratten</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 02 Feb 2022 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[d74c5967-0ed4-46a7-a9fb-da954cfde35b]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/101]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">No one enjoys being on the receiving end of a business that manipulates or pushes you into buying something. Good business is about relationships where you are authentic, engaged, and building trust. Today’s guest is Scott Stratten. Scott is an author, podcast host, and an award winning keynote speaker. He is known for his energy, passion, knowledge, humor, and his man bun. His live and virtual presentations bring UnMarketing to life, energizing attendees, and creating experiences audiences will remember and learn from.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:30] - Scott’s inspiration for starting UnMarketing was frustration. He explains his background and how he moved forward into entrepreneurship.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:58] - In business, Scott saw the “buy or bye” mentality and believes there’s a better way.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:27] - It isn’t about tactics. Strategies don’t take into account the human factor.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:53] - “I’m going to say what I think and I’m going to say it without a filter.” A lot of people are afraid of this for polarizing the market.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:13] - Scott shares the story behind the domain name for UnMarketing.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:01] - The kindness of the person who originally owned the domain name believed in Scott’s brand.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:04] - Many companies continue to manipulate people to buy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:04] - In marketing, if you lie, nobody knows.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:49] - Scott shares the story of catching a company in a lie.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:32] - The internet can’t work in a way without trust.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:09] - In over 300 episodes across six years on the Unpodcast, Scott has never run out of material.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:31] - Business decisions must be ethical and Scott calls people out for unethical decisions in their business.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:31] - If you have the endless pursuit of more, you don’t appreciate what you have now.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:38] - Scott has been presented with many opportunities but he couldn’t serve too many audiences well and authentically.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:39] - There is a difference between what is legal and what is right.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:13] - A lot of companies believe they own their employees. Employees are an asset, not overhead.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[37:18] - Scott shares the story of an experience when consulting and a technique called Stop, Start, Continue.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[42:04] - After 20 years in this field, Scott continues to be shocked that people don’t realize how they are supposed to treat others.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[45:01] - Scott recently revamped the UnMarketing website to better show what it is about and to ensure that it is presented authentically.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[46:29] - A newer phenomenon in business is that younger generations are coming in with better skills in tech.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[48:31] - Be wary of those who say something isn’t working anymore because they are likely selling an alternative.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[49:27] - Scott personally responds to newsletter email responses and you can sign up for his email newsletters from</span> <a href= "https://unmarketing.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">UnMarketing.com</span></a><span style= "font-weight: 400;">.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://unmarketing.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">UnMarketing.com</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://unmarketing.com/unpodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">UnPodcast</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

Just because someone looks good doesn’t mean that what they’re pitching is healthy or will even work. Watch out for unrealistic claims and results.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Natalia Petrzela. Natalia is a historian of contemporary American politics and culture. She is also an author and podcast host. She is a frequent media guest expert, public speaker, contributor to international domestic news outlets, including New York Times, Washington Post, and CNN. She is an associate professor of history and holds a BA from Columbia as well as a Masters and PhD from Stanford. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:56] - Welcome to the show! American fitness culture is very focused on an all-or-nothing mentality.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:40] - Because wellness and fitness is commercialized in the United States, consumers are targeted to buy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:02] - We equate appearance with health but not just anyone is an expert.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:32] - There are many people who take performance enhancing drugs casually that may make them appear as the picture of health.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:03] - Watch out for products being sold to you and extreme promises that are unrealistic.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:01] - It is so easy to become completely obsessed with health.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:39] - Many people say that their way is the only successful way to be healthy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:33] - Natalia discusses the difference in income and careers that impact views on health and fitness.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:53] - Any type of extreme promises should be looked at with a great degree of skepticism.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:57] - The whole weight loss industry is predicated on the reliance that you will gain it back.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:41] - It is great that more people are exercising regularly, but now there’s this pressure to sustain something that is stressful to maintain for many.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:53] - 			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Traveling can be a life-giving or a long lasting nightmare. Knowing what to research before you book your trip could have a significant impact on your experience and help you to be incredibly safe. Today’s guest is Asher Fergusson. Asher has been traveling around the world since 2004 when he left Australia to study in the United States where he received his undergraduate and master’s degrees. He has lived all over the globe, including in India, Europe, Hawaii, and the mainland US. He enjoys researching the travel industry and has been featured on CNN, USA Today, The New York Times, National Geographic, and many other publications.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:56] - Asher shares his background and how he got interested in travel.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:12] - On Asher’s website, he started sharing travel safety tips and the site has grown.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:44] - You will run into issues regarding cleanliness in hygiene and water. This can affect your body but is avoidable.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:57] - Asher shares several tips on eating and drinking in other countries.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:27] - When visiting another country, street food can be dangerous.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:20] - Every country has different cultural norms regarding food, water, shelter, and safety.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:31] - One of the major topics of research for Asher is regarding LGBTQ travelers.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:01] - Research laws in other countries because you could actually be imprisoned.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:24] - Another thing to consider is the dress code, especially for women in very conservative countries.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:37] - Some tourists feel that following stricter rules is a violation to their rights, but it is safer to follow the country’s laws and rules.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:17] - Americans tend to travel thinking that they don’t have to prepare and they are above the law.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:01] - America is a phenomenon as each state has different laws, a large population, and a lot of diversity.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:58] - Westerners tend to be targets for theft. Asher shares some things that might make you stand out.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:17] - There are other scams, but they are all about money.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:25] - It is always safer to go to the official site or location to buy tickets to something.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:43] - Asher shares the list of the top 10 worst locations to travel to as a solo female traveler. Do your research about your destination ahead of time.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:22] - Don’t be too nice. People might back off if you put up your boundaries.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:46] - When it comes to family traveling, accommodations are important.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:02] - Another hassle with traveling with kids in carseats and transportation upon your arrival.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:26] - Asher dug deep into Airbnb and customer horror stories.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:23] - Asher describes some of the issues found through this research.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[38:01] - It is probable that there is a money laundering scam happening in some listings and hacked accounts on Airbnb.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[40:56] - Never book a place with no reviews. The more reviews the better and only stay at the ones with a 4.8 or 5.0 rating average.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[43:17] - Look at all the properties listed by the same owner. Only stay with super hosts and make sure they have a verified ID.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[45:55] - Avoid the professional Airbnb landlords.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[46:46] - Only book with a credit card and if anything goes wrong, be sure to have photographic evidence.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[48:17] - Research is critical and real people’s experiences are at your fingertips online.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>How Secure is “In the Cloud?” with Randall Magiera</title>
			<itunes:title>How Secure is “In the Cloud?” with Randall Magiera</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 05 Jan 2022 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[3c8766f8-e1d9-48ec-a4c9-21f9f9322f69]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/97]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Just because something is in the cloud, doesn’t always mean that it is safe and secure and that you don’t play a role in keeping it that way. Those who move into the cloud need to understand cloud security best practices and how to implement them. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Dr. Randall Magiera. Dr. Magiera is a cybersecurity professional with over 15 years of experience in security management, change management, risk analysis, intrusion prevention and detection systems, and vulnerability assessments. He has a doctorate of science in cybersecurity, multiple advanced degrees in cybersecurity and technology, and certifications too numerous to list.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:00] - Randall introduces himself and his background in the field.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:05] - Things regarding cloud technology have advanced greatly in the last 15 years.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:09] - These cloud companies do go to great lengths to keep things as secure as possible.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:16] - The shared responsibility model is important to understand.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:44] - Large cloud providers do offer some education on best practices to users.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:01] - Breaches are causing the public to place blame on large companies like Amazon and Google, but it is more related to users not being familiar with how to use the product.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:47] - A lot of the time, the goal is speed in developing a program, app, or product and security sometimes gets pushed aside.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:33] - Chris shares a funny story about crypto-mining.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:48] - Randall explains a recent crypto-mining code placed in a javascript library.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:50] - Chris and Randall discuss the Colonial Pipeline Attack.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:00] - A CDN is great for organizations with employees all over the world working in the same program.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:31] - Ideally, the goal is to have everything stored in the cloud rather than on devices.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:00] - Malicious actors are motivated by money and they will use the cloud in creative ways as a means to an end.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:53] - Randall believes that we will be seeing the use of deep fakes more often in coming years.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:50] - Cloud computing gives users virtually endless capabilities which means that people who are malicious can use them for advanced attacks as well.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:51] - Per terms and conditions, if you delete data, it is on you.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[34:04] - Once something is deleted from the cloud, it is gone forever.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:21] - Randall describes how AWS works regarding backups.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[38:18] - When it comes to disaster recovery, especially for businesses, there is an option for data backup that will create a quick turn around if something happens.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[41:51] - Always test your backups and DR.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/rmagiera/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Dr. Randall Magiera on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://sopa.tulane.edu/about-sopa/advisors-faculty-staff/randy-magiera"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Tulane University - Randy Magiera</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Freelance Scams: Red Flags and Warning Signs with Ricardo Fayet</title>
			<itunes:title>Freelance Scams: Red Flags and Warning Signs with Ricardo Fayet</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 29 Dec 2021 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1ee28244-ffd6-4418-9d1e-c7fb9e0792ea]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/96]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">As a freelancer or someone who utilizes them, how can you spot an imposter from an actual business or genuine opportunity? Today’s guest is Ricardo Fayet. Ricardo is the co-founder of Reedsy, a community of over 150,000 authors worldwide and a curated network of 1500 handpicked freelance professionals from editors, cover designers, illustrators, book marketers, and publicists. They help bring over 500 books to life every month. Reedsy was named Book Tech Company of 2015 by UK Trade Magazine. Ricardo has been invited to speak at the Frankfurt Book Fair, London Book Fair, and dozens of other writing and publishing conferences.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:57] - Ricardo shares his background and what Reedsy is all about.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:10] - There are other freelance websites that are very general. This means they are not very curated. But now there are other sites popping up that are more specific.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:28] - Asking about work experience is really important.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:14] - You must trust the platform you are looking for a freelancer on.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:36] - When hiring a freelancer, you need to treat it as a hiring process.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:48] - Illustrators and graphic designers are usually easy to hire because you can see their work and choose the style you like. Other jobs are harder to hire.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:02] - One scam is companies hiring freelancers rather than hiring full time employees to avoid paying for benefits.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:32] - If a platform guarantees a certain amount earned as a freelancer in the first month or two, doubt it and look at the fine print.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:39] - There’s a tricky email scam that is designed to force you into creating a profile.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:28] - Create a profile, even if unused, to prevent other artists or freelancers from stealing the identity or your work. Well known platforms can also usually detect when there is a false profile.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:20] - Large platforms won’t be able to investigate until there are victims who have negative experiences with a freelancer.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:01] - It is highly recommended to charge for services at the beginning of a project.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:20] - A lot of freelancers on many platforms do not live in the United States and if there is a problem, the legal process becomes almost impossible.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:00] - Platforms may charge a freelance fee which actually protects both parties.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:01] - As a freelancer, you are very much at the mercy of the clients and their banks.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:45] - You have to strike the right balance between solid contracts and trusting people.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:05] - Don’t hesitate to say no to a contract if you feel like something is off.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://reedsy.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Reedsy</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/ricardofayet"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Ricardo Fayet on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/richardfayet/?originalSubdomain=es"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Ricardo Fayet on LinkedIn</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">When you own a business, your website represents you. Scammers can prey on your emotions for their gain by sending false claims of copyright infringement or even other lucrative opportunities that are fake. Knowing what to look out for prevents their negative impact on you and your business. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Liz Eisworth. Liz is the founder of SangFroid Web Design specializing in web design, custom WordPress themes, SEO, and digital marketing. She works with businesses to understand all aspects of their website.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:50] - Welcome to the show, Liz! Liz shares her background and business in web design, online presence, and SEO.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:21] - Liz describes the common scams that target website owners, starting with domain slamming scams.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:18] - The reason this happens is because once you register for a domain, your information becomes public.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:40] - Domain slamming is not an outright crime, but it is certainly unethical.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:12] - In combination with other things, the length of time a domain name has been owned can be a red flag.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:30] - Social engineering can also take place with the registrar that your domain name is registered with.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:20] - It is easy for scammers to set up a fake and flimsy online presence.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:09] - Phishing scams are often submitted through contact forms on a business’s website.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:36] - These phishing scams have gotten much more sophisticated in the last year and cause enough panic to have the owner click a dangerous link.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:07] - There are a lot of royalty free stock photo websites that you can find safe images to use on your website. This will help you avoid copyright infringement.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:26] - Chris shares an experience with registering a trademark that Liz confirms is very common.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:20] - Liz describes the third party payout scam.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:11] - In these scams, a detailed and simultaneously vague email will request a project be done.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:40] - If someone overpays you for a service, be skeptical.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:01] - The extra details in the initial email could be a red flag.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:40] - The use of details is intended to distract you.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:08] - Liz works primarily with small to medium sized businesses, but large companies are also very susceptible to scams.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:52] - Social engineering and preying on emotions are the common threads between all scams.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:41] - False authority in an email can also be a red flag.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>The Risks of Online Gaming with Eric R. Jones</title>
			<itunes:title>The Risks of Online Gaming with Eric R. Jones</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 08 Dec 2021 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[9391db4f-48fe-43f3-8091-837b63b5fad9]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/93]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Transparency in a family builds trust, but sharing information while gaming online can set you up for unnecessary risks. Your children may be sharing details that can impact not just them, but you.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Eric Jones. Eric is an experienced product manager and developer with over 20 years experience and more than 9 years in Agile Software Development. He is the founder and creator of All Knowing Parent focused on educating people on all avenues of technology and hardware.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:50] - Eric shares what he does as a career and about his startup.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:27] - As a father of two young girls, Eric is adamant about monitoring technology use.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:50] - Eric is a big believer in transparency.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:40] - Gaming is not just a casual hobby anymore.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:01] - On all gaming consoles there is some sort of communication with other players online available both as text and voice.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:10] - On some platforms, you have to be “friends” with someone to play together. Some games do a better job than others on safety.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:15] - Eric talks daily to his children about safety in gaming. These conversations started before they were even playing it.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:03] - Setting rules ahead of time is important to avoid cleaning up a mess.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:23] - Kids tend to give out so much information easily.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:48] - What are the pieces of information that you should make sure are kept private? Eric says everything.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:01] - Even giving out gamer handles from other consoles shouldn’t be shared.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:28] - Consoles protect your IP address better but gaming on servers do not.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:25] - Almost everything these days is connected to the internet. Unfortunately, a lot of pressure is put on the user.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:18] - When you’re playing online, you don’t see the type of people you play with through a username. Eric explains what swatting is.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:20] - People can also raid a streamer’s channel with obscenities and can piece together information through social engineering.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:03] - Don’t assume someone doesn’t want</span> <em><span style= "font-weight: 400;">your</span></em> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">information. 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Transparency in a family builds trust, but sharing information while gaming online can set you up for unnecessary risks. Your children may be sharing details that can impact not just them, but you.</p> <p>Today’s guest is Eric Jones. Eric is an experienced product manager and developer with over 20 years experience and more than 9 years in Agile Software Development. He is the founder and creator of All Knowing Parent focused on educating people on all avenues of technology and hardware.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li>[0:50] - Eric shares what he does as a career and about his startup.</li> <li>[2:27] - As a father of two young girls, Eric is adamant about monitoring technology use.</li> <li>[3:50] - Eric is a big believer in transparency.</li> <li>[5:40] - Gaming is not just a casual hobby anymore.</li> <li>[7:01] - On all gaming consoles there is some sort of communication with other players online available both as text and voice.</li> <li>[9:10] - On some platforms, you have to be “friends” with someone to play together. Some games do a better job than others on safety.</li> <li>[10:15] - Eric talks daily to his children about safety in gaming. These conversations started before they were even playing it.</li> <li>[12:03] - Setting rules ahead of time is important to avoid cleaning up a mess.</li> <li>[13:23] - Kids tend to give out so much information easily.</li> <li>[14:48] - What are the pieces of information that you should make sure are kept private? Eric says everything.</li> <li>[17:01] - Even giving out gamer handles from other consoles shouldn’t be shared.</li> <li>[18:28] - Consoles protect your IP address better but gaming on servers do not.</li> <li>[20:25] - Almost everything these days is connected to the internet. Unfortunately, a lot of pressure is put on the user.</li> <li>[22:18] - When you’re playing online, you don’t see the type of people you play with through a username. Eric explains what swatting is.</li> <li>[23:20] - People can also raid a streamer’s channel with obscenities and can piece together information through social engineering.</li> <li>[25:03] - Don’t assume someone doesn’t want <em>your</em> information. 			<title>How to Donate Wisely and Avoid Charity Scams with Laurie Styron</title>
			<itunes:title>How to Donate Wisely and Avoid Charity Scams with Laurie Styron</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 24 Nov 2021 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[a656a7e7-919f-49e3-a58a-ad668b8d9f4f]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/91]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Some organizations may use misleading language or pressure you as they solicit for a donation and this can cause distrust. Research is needed to make sure your money is going to the charity of choice and not a predator preying on your emotions.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Laurie Styron. Laurie was appointed the Executive Director of CharityWatch, American Institute of Philanthropy in 2020. She served as CharityWatch’s Senior Analyst for 16 years and thereafter as a Program Consultant through her nonprofit accounting and consulting practice. Laurie has been quoted in The New York Times, Los Angeles Times, The Wall Street Journal, NBC Nightly News, and by many other media outlets. She has also vetted charities for Good Morning America and has worked with 60 Minutes and many other news organizations on charity related investigations.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:53] - Laurie shares how she started with CharityWatch and why she was drawn to working in a nonprofit.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:31] - The founder of CharityWatch realized people were not making fact based decisions around donating to charities.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:04] - There has been some effort to regulate and enforce how donations are used.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:14] - Niche and very specific causes are harder to raise money for.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:14] - The funding for regulators is insufficient for them to adequately oversee.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:40] - Laurie explains how to vet a charity on CharityWatch and gives an example of how organizations are ranked on the site.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:50] - Sometimes organizations will use donations as their funds to continue marketing for more donations which causes an ineffective cycle.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:06] - A lot of donors get really focused on the salaries of charity executives.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:05] - It is actually a red flag if board officers are not paid enough.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:17] - There are not enough people in the United States with a masters degree that could work for a low salary.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:46] - Going into the season of giving, avoid high pressure tactics.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:12] - A lot of fundraisers have expert scripts that are designed to pressure you. Laurie gives tips on how to say no.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:01] - Laurie gives advice on how to use your emotions to choose a charity for a cause you are passionate about.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:33] - Laurie tells the story of a crowdfunding scam that was well intentioned but the money raised was not done by someone who could execute the result.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:41] - She shares another story of fake campaigns on GoFundMe as copycats.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:22] - You have the ability to check filings, tax information, and registrations for organizations. Crowdfunding sites do not vet their account holders.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:36] - Cut out the middleman. 			<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Some organizations may use misleading language or pressure you as they solicit for a donation and this can cause distrust. Research is needed to make sure your money is going to the charity of choice and not a predator preying on your emotions.</p> <p>Today’s guest is Laurie Styron. Laurie was appointed the Executive Director of CharityWatch, American Institute of Philanthropy in 2020. She served as CharityWatch’s Senior Analyst for 16 years and thereafter as a Program Consultant through her nonprofit accounting and consulting practice. Laurie has been quoted in The New York Times, Los Angeles Times, The Wall Street Journal, NBC Nightly News, and by many other media outlets. She has also vetted charities for Good Morning America and has worked with 60 Minutes and many other news organizations on charity related investigations.</p> Show Notes: <ul> <li>[1:53] - Laurie shares how she started with CharityWatch and why she was drawn to working in a nonprofit.</li> <li>[3:31] - The founder of CharityWatch realized people were not making fact based decisions around donating to charities.</li> <li>[5:04] - There has been some effort to regulate and enforce how donations are used.</li> <li>[6:14] - Niche and very specific causes are harder to raise money for.</li> <li>[8:14] - The funding for regulators is insufficient for them to adequately oversee.</li> <li>[9:40] - Laurie explains how to vet a charity on CharityWatch and gives an example of how organizations are ranked on the site.</li> <li>[11:50] - Sometimes organizations will use donations as their funds to continue marketing for more donations which causes an ineffective cycle.</li> <li>[14:06] - A lot of donors get really focused on the salaries of charity executives.</li> <li>[15:05] - It is actually a red flag if board officers are not paid enough.</li> <li>[18:17] - There are not enough people in the United States with a masters degree that could work for a low salary.</li> <li>[20:46] - Going into the season of giving, avoid high pressure tactics.</li> <li>[22:12] - A lot of fundraisers have expert scripts that are designed to pressure you. Crowdfunding sites do not vet their account holders.</li> <li>[32:36] - Cut out the middleman. Donate directly.</li> <li>[34:02] - It is advised to only donate on crowdfunding sites to those you know.</li> <li>[35:04] - It is not logical for a charity to use 100% of all donations on the cause.</li> <li>[37:24] - Laurie describes how charities are rated on a grade scale on CharityWatch’s website.</li> <li>[38:35] - There are other sites that rate and rank charities but not all are reliable.</li> <li>[40:57] - When you are doing your research, ask yourself what the site’s process is.</li> <li>[43:00] - Sometimes, third party platforms will hold on to the money for longer than necessary and Laurie says to donate directly.</li> <li>[45:47] - If you send small donations across multiple charities, your donations will be much smaller due to fees.</li> <li>[49:42] - Make that little bit of research you do before you donate part of your giving.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. But there is something to be done about it. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Kenton Hutcherson. Kenton is an attorney and owner of Hutcherson Law. He and his team focus on a very specific niche of law: helping people, professionals, and businesses who have been attacked on the internet. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:11] - Kenton explains the three types of cases he works with - internet defamation, copyright infringement, and invasion of privacy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:20] - Kenton shares his background and journey as an educator and lawyer.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:15] - The pandemic in particular caused a lot of interesting problems that Kenton has worked to solve.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:36] - Defamation encompasses libel and slander. Kenton explains the difference.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:00] - Written posts on the internet can harm people many years later.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:27] - When does it make sense to see a lawyer for internet defamation?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:50] - Is the damage being caused worth the cost of a lawyer? He shares Yelp’s policy for defamation.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:01] - Sometimes people will use throw away accounts that they can’t access again in order to change their review or post.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:01] - You can also hire a reputation manager who can help bury negative false claims.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:01] - Kenton shares an example of a case and client he has had.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:03] - The case Kenton shares demonstrates how people can truly destroy a business.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:12] - In this case, the convict broke out of prison. 			<title>Women’s Safety Tips with Jessa Russell</title>
			<itunes:title>Women’s Safety Tips with Jessa Russell</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 10 Nov 2021 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c670e86e-fb1d-44a3-9f51-c3a3abedba46]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/89]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Safety in public spaces can be complex. There are things that you can do to be prepared and alert in all situations. Techniques can be used to distract someone long enough to escape, no matter the size of the attacker. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Lieutenant Jessa Russell. Lieutenant Russell serves as the Community Relations Officer for Highland Park Department of Public Safety. In this role, she assists with crime prevention, safety education presentations, crime watch, community welfare concerns, and is the liaison to the Highland Park ISD. Lieutenant Russell began her career with Highland Park DPS in August 2008 and has served as a field training officer, defense tactics instructor, and operations supervisor. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:01] - Welcome to the podcast, Lieutenant Russell! Jessa explains how she got into law enforcement.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:40] - Every department has different norms. Jessa describes the more common problems her department responds to.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:10] - What is jugging? Jessa describes this crime and what to do to avoid it.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:06] - There are more fire stations than police stations and if you are being followed, pulling into a fire station could cause them to stop.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:01] - Always be skeptical. The world is a good place but there are bad people in it.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:12] - Restaurants and bars are places to have a heightened situational awareness.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:14] - If you are on a walk or run, only use one earbud.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:51] - You have to be assertive. Political correctness will hamper you when safety is a concern.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:30] - Park close to lights and the closer to the store the better. You can also request security officers or employees to escort you to the car.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:49] - There are different mindsets regarding an attack.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:12] - RAD is a program that Jessa educates through. It stands for Rape Aggression Defense. She explains the program and the training involved.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:58] - Some women are taught to be so submissive that they don’t realize they have power, which can simply be your voice.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:54] - Training does not mean you are a fighter. The techniques are designed to escape.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:20] - Most attackers are known to the victims, but random attacks can happen as well.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:28] - Assertively yelling “stay away” instead of screaming for help will catch someone’s attention more.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:33] - Chris shares a story to demonstrate how bystanders may not know if the situation is serious.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:47] - Jessa gives tips on how to help someone in danger.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:50] - Noticing clothes is great, but noticing shoes is even better.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:00] - Jessa explains what is important to note in describing an attacker.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[34:18] - Remembering the first few characters of a license plate is often enough to help. Remembering all is very challenging.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:50] - You need to know what to do if you are ever pulled over.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[39:43] - If someone is trying to rape you and you are not fighting back, you are not at fault at all. </span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[41:24] - Every department has a victim liaison.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[43:18] - Don’t be afraid to report something and work with the police.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[44:40] - Always lock doors and keep valuables in the house.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[47:41] - Jessa discusses carrying a gun and the importance of knowing how to properly use it if you want to have it.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><em><a href="http://www.rad-systems.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">RAD Systems Website</span></a></em></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">For most people, figuring out how our credit score is calculated is a black box. Learning what impacts your credit score gives you flexibility to change it. Here are twenty ways you are ruining your credit. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Steve Snyder. Steve is an author, speaker, and one of the top personal finance commentators in the country trained by the Fair Isaac Corporation, the firm that created the score that credit reporting agencies use to calculate a consumer’s credit worthiness. FICO Score is widely recognized as the industry standard for lenders. Steve has been quoted in the US News World Report, The Wall Street Journal, Newsweek, The Washington Post, and many others. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:03] - Welcome to the podcast, Steve! Steve describes what he does in his career and what got him interested.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:43] - Steve recovered from bankruptcy in less than eight months and realized that most people have no idea how to manage their credit.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:34] - The biggest mistake is not knowing that you have three credit scores.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:50] - The three scoring companies from Equifax, Experian, and TransUnion.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:41] - Not all lenders report to your credit reports which is why scores can be different.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:05] - There’s a system in place to correct things that are wrong with the large scoring companies.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:01] - Most people purchase the wrong scores. You can have too much or too little.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:01] - Having a credit card is the first step. If you have an issue, take it to small claims court.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:41] - Most people do not understand how credit works because we are not prepared early in life.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:21] - Steve is not going to ever risk his perfect credit scores by co-signing anything even with his own children.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:00] - Co-signing student loans can be detrimental.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[34:11] - It is wise to freeze your children’s credit until they are ready to use it.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:26] - Steve explains the meaning of “thickening a thin credit file.”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[37:46] - People think that because they make a lot of money that money will take care of everything else.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[39:25] - Allowing collections to show on your credit is a huge mistake but is easily rectified.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[40:51] - Steve explains the difference between a charge off and a settlement.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[42:00] - Too many credit inquiries lowers your score but will also “spook lenders.”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[43:16] - You could be paying off the wrong things. Your credit score is heavily weighted on your personal credit balance.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[45:01] - Business and personal finances should be separate.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[46:55] - No interest business credit cards are a great way to get started, but you have to be disciplined with a real business idea.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[49:25] - The best time to apply for credit is when you don’t need it. Don’t wait for the emergency.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>7 Ways You Are Being Influenced with Dr. Robert Cialdini</title>
			<itunes:title>7 Ways You Are Being Influenced with Dr. Robert Cialdini</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 27 Oct 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[87d158bc-3a33-41b9-9622-cc4ead525a9b]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/87]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">There are methods used to influence us to either buy or do something. We may even be persuaded to participate and only later on wonder how they got us to join. It is beneficial to know these seven principles that compel us to react. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Dr. Robert Cialdini. Dr. Cialdini is an author and keynote speaker as a leading expert on influence and persuasion. His books are published in 44 different languages and have sold over 7 million copies. He’s a New York Times, Wall Street Journal, and USA Today best-selling author. He’s also been elected to membership in the National Academy of Sciences. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:10] - Dr. Cialdini got into this field because he was easily persuaded in the past.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:05] - Incognito, Dr. Cialdini answered as many ads and training programs he could get into to see how advertisers convinced people to buy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:40] - In his research, he found that there are seven principles to persuasion.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:44] - The first principle is the principle of reciprocation. This is present in every culture.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:57] - First someone gives you something and then you feel obligated to give back.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:03] - Chris shares an experience at a restaurant to receive something for free that actually required him to do something first.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:37] - Is something genuinely giving you something or trapping you into compliance?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:19] - The second principle is the principle of “liking.” You will be influenced more by those who you like.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:48] - One way to get people to like us is to give them something which ties right into the principle of reciprocity.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:12] - Step back from the situation and separate the salesperson from what he or she is offering.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:18] - The next principle is the principle of social proof. If a lot of people are choosing or favoring something, it seems like something you should do, too.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:28] - We recognize when there are fake reviews. 5 star reviews generally make us skeptical.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:04] - Dr. Cialdini describes a study done in McDonald’s that boosted sales of one menu item by 40%.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:48] - The next principle is similar to social proof and decreases someone’s uncertainty. It is the principle of authority.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:58] - The problem with assuming someone is an expert is the appearance of actors and influencers being paid to promote.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:34] - Ask yourself, “Is this person an authority on the topic at hand?”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:32] - Also ask if the person is being unbiased in their testimonial.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:19] - The next principle is the principle of consistency. </span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:01] - Dr. Cialdini shares why he no longer signs petitions. The pressure to be consistent can motivate us to do things we don’t want to do.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:28] - Sometimes sales sites will list an item or booking that there are only two left at this price and list a number of people also looking at the listing.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[37:38] - We don’t know all the time if something is legit.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[39:55] - Dr. Cialdini added a seventh principle to his book called the principle of community.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[41:17] - Dr. Cialdini demonstrates how this works with a personal example.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[43:11] - Be wary of promotions within your “tribe.”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[44:12] - Some companies will ask for collaboration to create unity and produce customer loyalty.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[47:09] - Dr. Cialdini shares a story about letting people into one’s house.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[50:55] - Check out Dr. Cialdini’s website for a Harvard article to help prevent digital attacks on your organization or business.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.influenceatwork.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Influence at Work Website</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Influence-New-Expanded-Psychology-Persuasion-ebook/dp/B08HZ57WYN/ref=tmm_kin_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=1632707226&sr=8-2"> <em>Influence, New and Expanded: The Psychology of Persuasion</em> by Dr. Robert Cialdini</a></li> </ul>]]></description>

The pressure to be consistent can motivate us to do things we don’t want to do.</li> <li>[35:28] - Sometimes sales sites will list an item or booking that there are only two left at this price and list a number of people also looking at the listing.</li> <li>[37:38] - We don’t know all the time if something is legit.</li> <li>[39:55] - Dr. Cialdini added a seventh principle to his book called the principle of community.</li> <li>[41:17] - Dr. Cialdini demonstrates how this works with a personal example.</li> <li>[43:11] - Be wary of promotions within your “tribe.”</li> <li>[44:12] - Some companies will ask for collaboration to create unity and produce customer loyalty.</li> <li>[47:09] - Dr. Cialdini shares a story about letting people into one’s house.</li> <li>[50:55] - Check out Dr. Cialdini’s website for a Harvard article to help prevent digital attacks on your organization or business.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. The number one red flag is that criminal organizations are not regulated firms.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:52] - Cryptocurrency is a big trend in scams currently.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:18] - 			<title>Surveillance and Student Privacy with Jason Kelley</title>
			<itunes:title>Surveillance and Student Privacy with Jason Kelley</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 13 Oct 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[e99efbc3-301d-4f8b-81fa-fcc006bfd94c]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/85]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Surveillance cameras and other student monitoring tools are becoming more and more common in schools today. Laptops are distributed to the students and software is installed on them for their own protection, but it is important to know what is being done with the data collected outside of classroom use and if your students or your own privacy is being invaded. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Jason Kelley. Jason is the Associate Director of Digital Strategy at the Electronic Frontier Foundation, focusing on how privacy and surveillance impact digital liberties. Before joining EFF, Jason managed marketing strategy and content for a software company that helps non-programmers learn to code, and advertising and marketing analytics for a student loan startup.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:53] - Jason describes his current role at Electronic Frontier Foundation.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:32] - Big tech companies who offer devices to schools collect data from them.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:17] - Physical surveillance has increased due to the continuous problem of school shootings.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:01] - Surveillance cameras can be accessed directly by local police. Jason explains how this can be controversial.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:34] - Jason and Chris discuss the reason for using school-issued devices only for education purposes.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:53] - Surveillance cameras do have blind spots. Facial recognition also has some issues.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:03] - When devices are provided, parents, young people, and even administrators don’t always know the capabilities.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:22] - Jason shares an example of one of the pitfalls of student monitoring apps that are on school issued devices.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:07] - Schools can take screen captures from issued devices which isn’t done out of malice but does raise questions about privacy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:12] - We have to choose which is more important: safety or privacy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:37] - Students and parents need to know that school issued devices have features that will impact privacy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:32] - Jason describes some of the differences between the types of alerts school administrators receive.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:12] - Sometimes software blocks things that are safe and doesn’t block things that could potentially be inappropriate.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:50] - Teachers cannot have their eyes on every student’s computer at all times and often rely on software to help.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:04] - Teachers shouldn’t be expected to know how surveillance software works.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:01] - Jason describes a recent problem at Dartmouth with Canvas logs.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:27] - This issue at Dartmouth was very serious and could have impacted the students’ careers drastically.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:21] - There is an epidemic of misunderstandings of technology.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:24] - EFF offers guides for students on what to do and expect with school-issued devices.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:42] - There have been a lot of successful petitions in recent years about data tracking in universities. Parents have some leverage here as well.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:00] - Sometimes, there’s not anything you can do about student surveillance.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[34:20] - The Covid-19 pandemic made things very challenging as students needed access to education remotely very quickly.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:50] - Jason describes some of the features of remote proctoring programs.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[38:33] - This vastly impacted thousands of students who took the BAR exam.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[40:36] - EFF has been pushing back on proctoring and Jason explains a recent win.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[42:18] - Jason is hopeful that the pandemic has made it more clear where technology fails us.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 			<title>Gaslighting with Dr. Deborah Vinall</title>
			<itunes:title>Gaslighting with Dr. Deborah Vinall</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 06 Oct 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[fbc1f560-aab1-45fe-88d2-a6cc05c56895]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/84]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The term “gaslighting” is becoming more commonly used as people come to understand the psychological impact. It is important to identify the techniques used by someone to maintain an unhealthy relationship so you can avoid it or change it. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Dr. Deborah Vinall. Dr. Vinall is not only a licensed marriage and family therapist, but also a doctor of psychology. She is a certified trauma therapist that uses EMDR and brain spotting. Dr. Vinall is the author of</span> <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Gaslighting-Step-Step-Emotional-Relationships/dp/1648766498"> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Gaslighting: A Step by Step Recovery Guide to Heal From Emotional Abuse and Building Healthy Relationships</span></em></a><span style= "font-weight: 400;">. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:18] - Dr. Vinall explains why she wrote her recent book as gaslighting is something a lot of people experience but don’t understand.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:42] - What is gaslighting? Dr. Vinall gives an example.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:18] - Gaslighting can happen anywhere and with anyone.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:06] - There are different types of gaslighting that range from fully calculated to more defensive in nature.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:01] - Many people exhibit gaslighting at some point in their lives, but patterns are when things get problematic.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:19] - Insecurity is one reason many people tend to gaslight.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:29] - What are some signs for pattern gaslighters?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:22] - Pattern gaslighters are often very charming in public but are much different behind closed doors.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:00] - What is “normal” and what is problematic? Look inside and see how you feel around this person.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:03] - Dr. Vinall gives tips on how to manage situations where it is a co-worker that you can’t make a break from.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:53] - When confronted, pattern gaslighters may dismiss accusations or could “fly off the handle.”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:49] - In relationships, gaslighters tend to move very fast.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:22] - In cases where relationships are deeply connected, Dr. Vinall suggests reaching out to a lawyer. She also discusses the impact of violence escalation.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:02] - There is a distinction between occasional gaslighting and chronic pathological gaslighting.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:39] - Try some different strategies in the workplace and think of an exit plan in case a change is needed.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:12] - Journaling is an excellent tool to help you release and sort through your thoughts and can also be used later to confirm to yourself that you are not crazy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:58] - A red flag of gaslighting is someone trying to pull you away from your support system and external relationships.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:11] - It’s important to grieve the loss of a relationship and all the things that go with it.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:26] - Notice your self-talk. You can start internalizing the negative talk that you hear from someone who gaslights you.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:19] - Being a gaslighter may be difficult to overcome as there’s something deeper going on and you must want to heal.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:07] - Take your time in a relationship and listen to your intuition.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:49] - Figuring out your boundaries for those in your life who you don’t want to cut out.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Gaslighting-Step-Step-Emotional-Relationships/dp/1648766498"> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Gaslighting: A Step by Step Recovery Guide to Heal From Emotional Abuse and Building Healthy Relationships</span></em></a> <span style="font-weight: 400;">by Dr. Deborah Vinall</span></li> <li><a href="https://www.tamarcounselingservices.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Counseling Services with Dr. Deborah Vinall</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-deborah-vinall-9205041a/"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Dr. Deborah Vinall on LinkedIn</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>
