			<title>Securing Your IoT Smarthome with Amanda Fennell</title>
			<itunes:title>Securing Your IoT Smarthome with Amanda Fennell</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 29 Sep 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1249256c-480c-4d00-a9c1-b366a28dd8c4]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/83]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Home technology can be hacked. Anything from a coffee machine or LED light to a TV or a doorbell. We understand the risk of being vulnerable on our tablets and phones, but you’ll be shocked to realize how much data is collected from our other smart devices and how those very same devices can lead to a much wider compromise. Many of us don’t even know how many devices are on our connected networks, so we better listen up.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Amanda Fennell. Amanda is the Chief Security Officer and Chief Information Officer at Relativity. In her role, she is responsible for championing and directing their tech and security strategies including risk management and compliance practices. She has a Master’s degree in Forensic Science and over 15 years of experience in Forensics and Cyber Security. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:12] - Amanda explains Relativity, her roles in the company, and how she was drawn to this field.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:35] - Many people assume Amanda has all the new and greatest technology but knowing the risks of exploitation, she is selective.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:25] - There are a multitude of devices that people don’t even realize they connect to their network.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:23] - Because of the sheer volume of devices, hackers can do a sweep and use the information gathered.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:32] - The number one security problem is keeping things up to date.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:16] - Amanda walks through the simple steps of hacking smart devices.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:40] - Amanda demonstrates how hacking something seemingly inconsequential can lead to accessing more.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:23] - You need to know what’s connected to your network. You have more than you think.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:41] - Surprisingly, there are connected lightbulbs that people sacrifice security for ease of access.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:02] - When guests come over and you share your password, did you take their access back?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:15] - Amanda is a big fan of segregating your network. She describes what this means.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:29] - How can you segregate your network?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:08] - Amanda suggests using WireShark.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:39] - Many people hang on and use old routers because they still function, but most are not supported with updates after just a few years.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:18] - It is also common practice to use identifying information as passwords and device names.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:33] - Even Direct TV can be hacked. How can this be used against you?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:30] - Amanda shares an investigation and how she used a printer spool file.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:06] - Medical devices, printers, and copiers can be hacked.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:29] - Amanda describes the differences between two security companies and what she advises doing to stay secure.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:40] - How can you implement ongoing monitoring and detection in your home network?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:52] - Implement updating devices into your monthly or weekly routine.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:03] - You can do a scan on your network and even ask a friend for help.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[37:28] - Smart coffee and smart fridges seem simple but can be used for targeting phishing and even when you are leaving the house.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[39:33] - Just making yourself a little less accessible could deter a hacker because others will be easier.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[41:43] - Amanda shares how false donations were used in fraud.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[43:25] - We all deserve to have our information private and secure but it also needs to be personally accessible. That’s the risk.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://relativity.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Relativity Website</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://relativity.com/podcasts/security-sandbox/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Security Sandbox Podcast</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.relativity.com/blog/author/amanda-fennell/"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Amanda Fennell on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/RelativityHQ"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Relativity on Twitter</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

		<item>
			<title>Preventing Identity Theft with Adam Levin</title>
			<itunes:title>Preventing and Resolving a Compromised Identity with Adam Levin</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 15 Sep 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[d5de1a7c-452c-4d90-8c48-335012f65537]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/81]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">At some point in our life we will encounter a cyber intrusion, either through somewhere we have done business or because we are targeted as an individual. It is important to know how to prevent identity theft as well as how to respond if you’ve already been compromised. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Adam Levin. As a graduate of Stanford University and the University of Michigan School of Law, Adam Levin is a nationally recognized expert on cybersecurity, privacy, identity theft, fraud, and personal finance. He is an author and the former director of the New Jersey Division of Consumer Affairs. Levin is the chairman and founder of Cyber Scout and co-founded Credit.com. He has been featured in the New York TImes, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, The Los Angeles Times, USA Today, and The Chicago Tribune. In addition to that, he has appeared on The Today Show, Good Morning America, CBS Evening News, CNBC, MSN, and many others.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:14] - Adam shares his background and education in law and politics.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:29] - In 2003, Adam created an Identity Theft company that later became a global business called Cyber Scout.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:49] - Adam believes that security breaches are a certainty of life these days.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:35] - While hacking has been around for a long time, Adam shares how he got into the business of identity theft protection.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:36] - Over time, insurance companies have come to be support in identity theft.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:01] - Chris shares a scenario of a friend that had their identity stolen.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:23] - Many victims feel like they were in the wrong when in reality they may not have done anything wrong at all.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:56] - In recent years, the IRS has been a lot more proactive.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:02] - What is Adam’s definition of identity theft?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:01] - Adam explains why you should be vetting your vendor as well.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:13] - There are four kinds of threat actors - state sponsored, for-profit, cause-related, and “because I can.”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:29] - Social engineering is the most successful method of identity theft.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:42] - Adam wrote the book</span> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Swiped</span></em> <span style="font-weight: 400;">and explains that there needs to be a new framework around mitigating the threat of identity theft.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:32] - How do we minimize your risk of exposure? This is very difficult.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:46] - Two factor authorization is extremely helpful in protection.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:41] - Always verify that the person you’re speaking to is who you think they are.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:12] - How can you monitor everything on your accounts and reports?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:37] - One of the ways credit card numbers are sold on the dark web is by zip code which causes many banks to miss fraudulent use.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:51] - The third “M” is to manage the damage. What can you do after an incident?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[34:05] - Identity theft protection programs are relatively inexpensive.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[37:01] - You can set the threshold for when you are notified. But you should choose to be notified of any purchase, even the really small ones.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[38:50] - How do banks know when there’s a fraudulent charge?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[40:38] - There are features where you can lock the use of your card before having to change account numbers.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[42:33] - The best protector of your portfolios, including your identity, is you the consumer.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[44:37] - Adam describes his new podcast called What the Hack.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[50:23] - Remember that many people are not who they claim to be.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://adamlevin.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Adam Levin Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://adamlevin.com/what-the-hack/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">What the Hack Podcast with Adam Levin</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://twitter.com/Adam_K_Levin?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Adam Levin on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://cyberscout.com/en"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Cyber Scout Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/CyberScout"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Cyber Scout on Twitter</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Social Engineering and Pick-Pocketing with Chris Kirsch</title>
			<itunes:title>Social Engineering and Pick-Pocketing with Chris Kirsch</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 01 Sep 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f9d2f82b-71fb-497b-b535-53fd09230832]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/79]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Gifted pick-pocketers can use social engineering skills to choose their victims. Many times as we travel, we may not realize that our body language makes us an easy target. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Chris Kirsch. Chris is the CRO and co-founder of Rumble. With a background in product marketing and technical mindset, he has helped formulate go-to marketing strategies at PGP, Rapid7, and Veracode. In 2017, he earned the black badge for winning the social engineering capture the flag competition at DEFCON. He has a passion for InfoSec, OSINT, and is a volunteer advisor for the National Child Protection Task Force.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:05] - Welcome Chris! Chris shares his background.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:20] - Chris co-founded Rumble, an asset discovery company to help clients secure their network.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:48] - Pick-pocketers are masters of misdirection.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:34] - Chris explains why he got into the social engineering side of DEFCON.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:18] - When in Paris, Chris’s father was pick-pocketed which prompted him to start researching.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:18] - After meeting a magician at a convention, Chris then became interested in open-source intelligence (OSINT).</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:51] - Chris defines the difference between the two schools of thought on pick-pocketing.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:29] - Some pick-pocketers can steal without interacting with people while others utilize social interactions.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:31] - Chris shares in more detail the story of his father being pick-pocketed.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:38] - This experience showed Chris and his family a way that teams of people can work together to fool a target.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:03] - There are some unusual laws that limit consequences for theft.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:50] - Chris shares tips on where to place your wallet when traveling and demonstrates a scenario.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:18] - Escalators are areas where pick-pocketing teams can be very successful.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:17] - Placing your hand in your pocket to intentionally keep your belongings safe might actually make you a target.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:31] - When something else is on your mind, you are an easy target. It is hard to always be aware.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:19] - Chris uses an example of a phishing scam that demonstrates social engineers move you from rational thinking to emotional.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:20] - Many people take these scams personally when in reality, scammers have no idea who you are.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[38:27] - Chris references a documentary from the point of view of a social engineering target.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[40:51] - Darren Brown on YouTube and Netflix has several videos and shows that demonstrate the psychology of many scams and manipulation.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[43:59] - The sample you are seeing is what the person wants you to see.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[45:12] - Chris gives actionable steps to take when feeling suspicious.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[47:09] - Chris describes a time when he was able to use social engineering strategies that would have been shot down if the target had done something simple.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[49:21] - For the “long con” scammers, Chris has advice about trust.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[51:42] - Search for Kirsch Identity Fraud and you find free resources on identity theft.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>School Safety and Security with Jason Stoddard</title>
			<itunes:title>School Safety and Security with Jason Stoddard</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 25 Aug 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[fc710143-3edb-49e5-bff2-2818449a8030]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/78]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">You cannot separate community and school safety from each other. They simply go hand in hand. We’ve seen adults displaying lack of impulse control on airplanes and as kids go back to school, we cannot underestimate the challenges that may arise. It’s important to be prepared to know how to respond. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Jason Stoddard. Jason is the Director of School Safety and Security for the Charles County Public Schools. He is responsible for sustaining a safe learning and work environment for over 27,000 students and nearly 4,000 staff members. He is a retired police commander with over 24 years in law enforcement. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:51] - Jason describes his job and what he is responsible for.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:40] - Because of everyone’s experience in school, everyone has their own opinion of what things should be like even though things have changed.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:00] - In recent years, ransomware and hacking has been a threat to schools.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:41] - School issues have not been seen as what they really are: community issues.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:50] - Jason shares ways he builds relationships within the community for school safety.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:10] - Handle With Care is a program that is implemented in Jason’s county.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:52] - Instead of asking what’s wrong, ask the kid what has happened.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:14] - We can never over communicate what is going on. Honest conversations are necessary.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:53] - What could be the ramifications of early experiences with the criminal justice system?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:40] - When the police arrest a child that could affect their safety, Jason shares that in his county, they are required to report it to him and his team.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:01] - Jason’s county is also committed to working with law enforcement regarding gangs.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:24] - There are some services that provide social media monitoring but there are some problems with using this.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:48] - Kids need to feel comfortable bringing information forward.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:17] - Jason believes that this school year is set up for tragedy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:22] - Any school system is built on layers. It can never be just one plan.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:58] - How do we get kids to the services they need to help them with impulse control?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:08] - School safety programs cannot force kids into mediation programs.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:10] - When students are suspended, they are missing out on their education and sometimes can’t get caught up. This creates a cycle for more misbehavior.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:15] - School systems see all the same problems everyone else sees but with the added kid component.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:19] - Malware and ransomware are huge problems right now with the increase in virtual learning.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:54] - Valuable information can be sold on the dark web.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[37:27] - Swatting is where someone will call into 911 to get law enforcement to respond.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[40:11] - Sometimes kids also hack to change their grades but are usually easily fixed.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[41:00] - Teachers will also sometimes write their passwords on a post-it for students to see.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[42:01] - Covid-19 continues to be incredibly challenging.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[44:57] - Stay connected with what is going on locally, nationally, and from the CDC.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[45:56] - The fact that this situation has been so polarizing has made policy very difficult to enforce.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[49:53] - Jason explains some of the issues that arose through virtual learning last year.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[50:55] - There are so many layers to security and a positive school climate is the key.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/jason-stoddard-08767312a/"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Jason Stoddard on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.ccboe.com/index.php/safety-and-security"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Charles County Public Schools Safety and Security Web Page</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<title>Situational Awareness with Robert Montgomery</title>
			<itunes:title>Situational Awareness with Robert Montgomery</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 18 Aug 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1f4ac053-f032-4bb4-90aa-519fb7443fb5]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/77]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">When seconds count and freezing isn’t an option and lives are at stake, how do you prepare to know what to do? Even our bodies have natural reactions. But what can you do to stay calm, level your breathing, and be alert?</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Robert Montgomery. Robert was an operations officer in the CIA for 34 years and served in some of the most dangerous places in the world. He is also a former Marine and the founder of Guardwell Defense. Robert is an author and teaches training courses such as Combat for Women, Improvised Weapons, and Street Smarts for Students and Businesspeople designed to help anyone mitigate and deal with unexpected violence.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:53] - Robert shares his background, experience, and how he shifted into training civilians for personal defense.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:46] - Using security cameras that he can access on his phone, Robert shares the story of seeing people on his property while he was in Afghanistan.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:29] - Through this experience, Robert realized why his wife was able to stay calm in the moment.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:13] - Referencing Chris’s website and podcast, Robert explains the common scams that he has seen come up.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:26] - “If you find yourself in a fair fight, you didn’t plan properly.” </span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:27] - There is a correlation between your heart rate and ability to control fine motor skills.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:12] - Controlling your breathing is the key to lowering your heart rate.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:37] - Practicing breathing in non-stressful situations can help you in the moment.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:18] - Chris shares a story that connects to the discussion on adrenaline and fear.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:51] - You cannot be alert all the time. Being hyper alert can lead to PTSD and often does in members of the military.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:23] - With situational awareness, you have to stay level headed and make decisions quickly.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:51] - It is okay to “be rude” if you feel uncomfortable.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:10] - There are many signals you may notice if approached by a predator.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:13] - A common situation many people find themselves in is walking or jogging outside with headphones on. This affects their awareness.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:46] - Situational awareness will mitigate many problems.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:47] - Robert gives some tips on what to do when beginning to travel again, especially overseas.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:21] - Maintaining a lower profile to lessen your chances to be targeted for crimes as a tourist can be challenging, but Robert gives advice.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:28] -</span> <a href= "https://edsontiger.com/news/edson-tiger-launches-a-new-online-blended-learning-platform-for-travel-risk-training/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Edson Tiger</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">offers an excellent online course for training for travel.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[38:27] - Paper copies of things are important in case things are lost.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[39:54] - Every citizen should learn the basics of first aid.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><em><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Seconds-Live-Die-Life-Saving-Lessons/dp/1544509480"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Seconds to Live or Die: Life-Saving Lessons from a Former CIA Officer</span> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">by Robert Montgomery</span></a></em></li> <li><a href="https://www.guardwelldefense.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Guard Well Defense Home Page</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://edsontiger.com/news/edson-tiger-launches-a-new-online-blended-learning-platform-for-travel-risk-training/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Edson Tiger Training for Travel Course</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">There are many ways your network can be accessed, not just remotely but physically. How equipped are you and your coworkers to prevent intrusions? Today’s guest is Jayson E. Street.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Jayson is the author of</span> <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Dissecting-Hack-F0rb1dd3n-Network-Revised/dp/1597495689"> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Dissecting the Hack: The F0rb1dd3n Network Series</span></em></a><em><span style= "font-weight: 400;">.</span></em> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">He is the DEFCON Groups Global Ambassador and the VP of InfoSec for SphereNY. He has also spoken at DEFCON, DerbyCon, GRRCon, and at several other cons and colleges on a variety of Information Security topics. Jayson was also featured in The National Geographic series Breakthrough Cyber Terror.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:00] - Jayson explains how he hacks to help.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:59] - People want to see how Jayson can get into their facility and rob them.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:39] - Jayson shares how “being the bad guy” can get the information needed to educate users and clients on preventing more.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:51] - Jayson has been known to rob banks and shares the story about how he robbed the wrong bank because he had to go to the bathroom.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:24] - The devices Jayson uses emulate keyboards and code. </span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:03] - Some employees for big companies like Microsoft have posted their badge on social media from which Jayson prints and uses as his own.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:08] - How did Jayson get caught in robbing the wrong bank?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:21] - He found out later that the bank he robbed by mistake wound up wiping their machines which cost them a lot of money even though Jayson’s procedure was harmless.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:01] - Jayson has a 100% success rate which shows how employees trust anyone who looks official.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:13] - What is the yellow method and why does Jayson use it?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:18] - Jayson describes the facility that took the longest amount of time to get into in Jamaica.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:17] - In one instance, Jayson did not go back to talk to the client after conducting the pen test for a charity.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:30] - When these tests happen, it isn’t about winning and losing. Jayson makes sure he is caught so he can provide education and training.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:08] - “The biggest thing that people can do to protect themselves is to listen to the voice in the back of your head saying that something is odd or unusual. Realize when you’re at work, part of your job and responsibility is to think that something bad may happen.”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:25] - Companies need to give a proper avenue for employees to feel comfortable in reporting something strange.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:39] - Jayson shares some of the techniques he uses that have a 100% success rate in penetrating the company’s network.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:06] - At events, oftentimes there are company USB drives loaded with giveaway items. These could be dangerous to use.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:39] - There is no way to completely eliminate threats. The important piece is how you respond to a threat.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:10] - Network security is great, but physical security of a network is just as important.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:01] - Jayson explains that the users of the programs in a network are the people that need to have the proper education.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[37:45] - Jayson has a program where he gamifies security education.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[39:50] - Many people don’t realize how easy it is for an official looking badge to be recreated.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[41:41] - Jayson describes his most boring and simple robbery he completed in 15 seconds.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[42:29] - What was Jayson’s most successful interaction?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[43:51] - After obliterating a company one year, management took the lessons to heart, educated their team, and had him come back the next year.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[46:19] - If pen testers are not rooting for the client, they are in the wrong business.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking with Kevin Metcalf</title>
			<itunes:title>Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking with Kevin Metcalf</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 04 Aug 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[33c67be9-454c-49b3-9dcd-2f2a3fed2cc8]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/75]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Children go missing, exploited, and trafficked everyday. It takes investigators, prosecutors, and private sector technology specialists to help them. Misinformation and TV portrayals can impact our resources that are directed to help.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Kevin Metcalf. Kevin is a former federal agent turned prosecutor and the founder of The National Child Protection Task Force which brings together recognized experts in the field such as strategic legal applications, open source intelligence, cellular mapping analysis, dark web investigations, and cryptocurrency to help law enforcement agencies everywhere. He has undergone training provided by the National Computer Forensics Institute, the National White Collar Crime Center, and the FBI Cellular Analysis Survey Team, among others. Kevin developed a system for working with cell phone related data in criminal cases that developed into a mobile device foundational course that focuses on the integration of legally-derived information with open source information. Kevin has also published a series of instructional books available on Amazon.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:26] - Kevin shares his background and how starting the National Child Protection Task Force was not something he initially thought he’d do.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:20] - As a single parent, Kevin left his job in law enforcement, went back to school, and became a prosecutor.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3:58] - As he was led into working in social media and cell phones, Kevin realized how often he was working on cases that had to do with children.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:11] - Kevin describes the case that got him national attention and how it led to him working with experts that wanted to come together to help more kids.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:01] - Chris notes the gap between law enforcement and the technology that is available. Kevin is trying to bridge that gap.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:00] - How does Kevin deal with the “CSI Effect”?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:57] - There is a lot of misinformation regarding human trafficking. </span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:52] - It is very challenging to convict someone for human trafficking due to little information and the victim not being forthcoming with details out of fear.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:19] - Most of the time they are able to convict for something else, like drugs or gun charges, which does at least get the person in jail without putting the victim through testifying again.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:34] - There are a lot of psychological factors involved for victims even years afterwards.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:55] - Kevin’s organization works with missing, exploited, and trafficked children. He explains the difference between exploitation and trafficking.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:49] - Children who are missing and runaways are at higher risk of being exploited and trafficked. </span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:51] - There is a huge problem with missing children investigation or lack thereof. Predators are aware of this and take advantage.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:21] - There are so many problems with statistics that Kevin doesn’t know what questions to ask.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:18] - Kevin feels that there are two categories for children, missing or not.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:04] - Kevin lists some of the things that put children at risk, including parents trying to control everything.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:35] - During the grooming process, predators are looking for the weaknesses in a parent-child relationship. Mental health issues also add another level of vulnerability.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:10] - The NCPTF is composed of active duty law enforcement. Kevin explains following the rules of the jurisdiction they’re working in.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:51] - Although there are some controversial tools used to investigate these cases, Kevin describes how to prevent breaches in privacy.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:04] - “You have to understand the limitations of technology. If you don’t, you’re going to misuse it, screw up an investigation, and arrest the wrong person.”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:19] - Kevin explains the algorithms used for facial recognition, especially using the face of a child.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[38:43] - An investigator needs to follow up on every hit used with facial recognition.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[39:59] - Kevin describes how the NCPTF hones their technology skills.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[41:38] - Predators are using information willingly posted on social media to harm others.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[42:51] - It is difficult to make politicians and policy makers understand how bad the situation is and what is needed to prosecute a predator.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[45:00] - Newer privacy laws make it difficult to use technology to identify a human trafficker.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[46:51] - Using these technological resources for minor infractions is a waste of time and money. They should be used for the major things.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[49:27] - It is important to not tip predators off with what they are using to identify them. Sometimes photos and videos will allow investigators to determine their location.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[51:14] - A lot of people don’t realize how easy it is to find their information.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Kevin is trying to bridge that gap.</li> <li>[8:00] - How does Kevin deal with the “CSI Effect”?</li> <li>[9:57] - There is a lot of misinformation regarding human trafficking. </li> <li>[10:52] - It is very challenging to convict someone for human trafficking due to little information and the victim not being forthcoming with details out of fear.</li> <li>[12:19] - Most of the time they are able to convict for something else, like drugs or gun charges, which does at least get the person in jail without putting the victim through testifying again.</li> <li>[13:34] - There are a lot of psychological factors involved for victims even years afterwards.</li> <li>[14:55] - Kevin’s organization works with missing, exploited, and trafficked children. He explains the difference between exploitation and trafficking.</li> <li>[16:49] - Children who are missing and runaways are at higher risk of being exploited and trafficked. </li> <li>[17:51] - There is a huge problem with missing children investigation or lack thereof. Predators are aware of this and take advantage.</li> <li>[21:21] - There are so many problems with statistics that Kevin doesn’t know what questions to ask.</li> <li>[23:18] - Kevin feels that there are two categories for children, missing or not.</li> <li>[24:04] - Kevin lists some of the things that put children at risk, including parents trying to control everything.</li> <li>[27:35] - During the grooming process, predators are looking for the weaknesses in a parent-child relationship. Mental health issues also add another level of vulnerability.</li> <li>[31:10] - The NCPTF is composed of active duty law enforcement. Kevin explains following the rules of the jurisdiction they’re working in.</li> <li>[32:51] - Although there are some controversial tools used to investigate these cases, Kevin describes how to prevent breaches in privacy.</li> <li>[35:04] - “You have to understand the limitations of technology. If you don’t, you’re going to misuse it, screw up an investigation, and arrest the wrong person.”</li> <li>[36:19] - Kevin explains the algorithms used for facial recognition, especially using the face of a child.</li> <li>[38:43] - An investigator needs to follow up on every hit used with facial recognition.</li> <li>[39:59] - Kevin describes how the NCPTF hones their technology skills.</li> <li>[41:38] - Predators are using information willingly posted on social media to harm others.</li> <li>[42:51] - It is difficult to make politicians and policy makers understand how bad the situation is and what is needed to prosecute a predator.</li> <li>[45:00] - Newer privacy laws make it difficult to use technology to identify a human trafficker.</li> <li>[46:51] - Using these technological resources for minor infractions is a waste of time and money. They should be used for the major things.</li> <li>[49:27] - It is important to not tip predators off with what they are using to identify them. Sometimes photos and videos will allow investigators to determine their location.</li> <li>[51:14] - A lot of people don’t realize how easy it is to find their information.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<title>The Dangers of Seeking Enlightenment with Caroline Slaughter</title>
			<itunes:title>The Dangers of Seeking Enlightenment with Caroline Slaughter</itunes:title>

			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[bea57781-45ef-4dcc-8a36-2a886949eba4]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/73]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Many people have gone or plan to go somewhere to seek deeper connection and enlightenment. But what are the dangers to be conscious of before taking such a trip?</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Caroline Slaughter. Caroline is a filmmaker and global voiceover talent. Most recently, she was supervising producer on Racket: Inside the Gold Club which is ranked as one of 2020’s top true crime podcasts. Caroline’s multifaceted experience in the entertainment industry has prepared her for the role of curating auditory stories to provoke, impact, and entertain. She is the host of the popular Astray Podcast where she investigates those who pay the ultimate cost in search for spiritual awakening.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:00] - Caroline shares how and why she started her Astray podcast.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:41] - There’s an idea that this happens in India, but Caroline points out that people seek out enlightenment all over the world.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:00] - During a difficult time, Caroline chose to go to Bali. She was prepared but a lot of people don’t go in with a plan.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:18] - There seems to be a draw to Asian countries for this and Caroline suggests some reasons why.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:19] - Caroline briefly tells the story of a guest on Astray Podcast who had a breakdown while on his journey and would have disappeared without his parents.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:50] - The biggest problem is that many people who fall victim to scams and traps are looking outside themselves for answers. </span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:22] - Caroline did some research on some of the reasons that could have caused psychotic breakdowns through drugs.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:31] - Some who experience a psychotic break while on this quest for enlightenment, feel that it was meant to happen for their experience.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:50] - People want a fast track to spirituality and it can be addictive.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:40] - Mental illness plays a role in the need for a fast track to spirituality.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:37] - Caroline defines and explains India Syndrome.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:02] - Caroline tells the story of The Beatles seeking enlightenment and a theory surrounding John Lennon never leaving the place of trauma.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[18:44] - India Syndrome can put you in a very fragile state if you don’t go prepared.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:52] - We tend to let our guard down because of the authority the spiritual guides hold over us.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:32] - You have to trust your inner guidance especially when you look outside yourself for guidance.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:40] - It is tricky to vet the guides in other countries. It is easier to do in the United States; to find others who have worked with them.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[23:55] - This industry is massive and brings in billions of dollars a year.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:32] - Caroline explains why she thinks the industry needs to be regulated.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:44] - Going with a buddy is key and bouncing ideas and plans off of friends is important to keep up the voice of reason.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:42] - Don’t make major decisions when experiencing grief or trauma.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:01] - We give away our own power when we hit rock bottom.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:45] - There are tragic stories that Caroline shares through Astray of people who have vanished or been killed.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[32:17] - The problem is not India Syndrome, it is “Seeker Syndrome.”</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:26] - What do you sacrifice for the risks you take?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[35:18] - When seeing those traveling in a new country, there are those who will prey on someone new and unfamiliar.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.carolineslaughter.com/about"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Caroline Slaughter Home Page</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/astray/id1552069504"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Astray Podcast</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.instagram.com/cslaughters/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Caroline Slaughter on Instagram</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>

She was prepared but a lot of people don’t go in with a plan.</li> <li>[6:18] - There seems to be a draw to Asian countries for this and Caroline suggests some reasons why.</li> <li>[7:19] - Caroline briefly tells the story of a guest on Astray Podcast who had a breakdown while on his journey and would have disappeared without his parents.</li> <li>[8:50] - The biggest problem is that many people who fall victim to scams and traps are looking outside themselves for answers. </li> <li>[10:22] - Caroline did some research on some of the reasons that could have caused psychotic breakdowns through drugs.</li> <li>[11:31] - Some who experience a psychotic break while on this quest for enlightenment, feel that it was meant to happen for their experience.</li> <li>[12:50] - People want a fast track to spirituality and it can be addictive.</li> <li>[14:40] - Mental illness plays a role in the need for a fast track to spirituality.</li> <li>[15:37] - Caroline defines and explains India Syndrome.</li> <li>[17:02] - Caroline tells the story of The Beatles seeking enlightenment and a theory surrounding John Lennon never leaving the place of trauma.</li> <li>[18:44] - India Syndrome can put you in a very fragile state if you don’t go prepared.</li> <li>[19:52] - We tend to let our guard down because of the authority the spiritual guides hold over us.</li> <li>[21:32] - You have to trust your inner guidance especially when you look outside yourself for guidance.</li> <li>[22:40] - It is tricky to vet the guides in other countries. It is easier to do in the United States; to find others who have worked with them.</li> <li>[23:55] - This industry is massive and brings in billions of dollars a year.</li> <li>[24:32] - Caroline explains why she thinks the industry needs to be regulated.</li> <li>[25:44] - Going with a buddy is key and bouncing ideas and plans off of friends is important to keep up the voice of reason.</li> <li>[27:42] - Don’t make major decisions when experiencing grief or trauma.</li> <li>[29:01] - We give away our own power when we hit rock bottom.</li> <li>[30:45] - There are tragic stories that Caroline shares through Astray of people who have vanished or been killed.</li> <li>[32:17] - The problem is not India Syndrome, it is “Seeker Syndrome.”</li> <li>[33:26] - What do you sacrifice for the risks you take?</li> <li>[35:18] - When seeing those traveling in a new country, there are those who will prey on someone new and unfamiliar.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. 			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Education can help people to be prepared without paranoia, but how do you teach safety without causing fear? There are specific things to be aware of in an extraordinary situation like an active shooter that can fundamentally change the outcome. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Dr. Kathleen Kiernan. Dr. Kiernan is the founder and CEO of Kiernan Group Holdings, Chair of Emeritus and the Intelligence and National Security Alliance, and an adjunct faculty member of the Center for Homeland Defense and Security at the Naval Postgraduate School. As a 29-year veteran of Federal Law Enforcement, Dr. Kiernan serves as a subject matter expert in strategic thinking, strategy development, and facilitating critical incident management exercises for senior leaders across government and private sector organizations. She is the founder of Preparedness Without Paranoia which provides an opportunity to use a lifetime of service and earned experience at the extremes of human behavior to help others invest in their own security and preparedness. When they teach skills early, they can last a lifetime and can literally save lives.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:21] - Dr. Kiernan has spent her entire life in or supporting law enforcement. Preparedness Without Paranoia uses current and recent events to educate.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:33] - The program is written by parents and educators</span> <em><span style= "font-weight: 400;">for</span></em> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">parents and educators of primary school aged children.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:58] - Dr. Kiernan’s program teaches a preparedness mindset that applies to many different types of events.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:01] - You are responsible for your own security.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:20] - Communication is the first major teaching point for children in Preparedness Without Paranoia.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:41] - Although active shooters are statistically rare but devastating, there are more common events in domestic violence and abuse that children learn to communicate about.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:19] - To build trust with kids is to be part of their adventure. Communication is key.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:27] - Some of the educational resources on Preparedness Without Paranoia’s website surround good decision making and thanking community heroes.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:20] - Preparedness Without Paranoia runs on donations. 			<title>Cryptocurrency Exit Scams with Aaron Lammer</title>
			<itunes:title>Cryptocurrency Exit Scams with Aaron Lammer</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 30 Jun 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[d4891ce2-eb67-40f0-9691-8174d1118414]]></guid>

			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We often make the assumption that if something is the biggest or the oldest, it should be trusted or it wouldn’t have grown so large. But when it comes to cryptocurrency, this may not always be true. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Aaron Lammer. Aaron is the founder of Treats Media which produces original podcasts and work for clients. Original works include the critically-acclaimed mini-series Exit Scams and multiple seasons of Stoner and CoinTalk. Aaron is also the co-founder of Longform.com and host of the Longform Podcast.</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1:16] - If you’ve heard about a large amount of cryptocurrency being lost, you have heard about hacking. But Aaron shares how it could be a false narrative.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:56] - There’s not as much risk when internally stealing cryptocurrency.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:04] - Aaron tells the story of Quadriga and its founder, Gerald Cotton.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[5:03] - The estimated amount of cryptocurrency lost in 2018 was $250 million. But that money scales up over time.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:21] - The people who were brought in to help with this case found a lot of things using the only clues they had: financial records.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[7:36] - People who knew Gerald Cotton were convinced by him. Bitcoin also appeared more trustworthy than newer companies.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:39] - Why do people trust the company that has been around the longest?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:40] - Aaron explains how Cotton simulated fake volume.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:05] - There is a lot of discrepancy on Cotton’s death, but regardless, Aaron explains how his fraud and Ponzi Scheme played out.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:58] - When the exchange started to crash, Cotton likely feared being found out.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[14:20] - For a long time, there was a lot of smoke and mirrors surrounding where the actual money was.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:30] - There is an unaccounted for amount of money missing from the money taken by Cotton which has created doubt that he is deceased.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:02] - Chris and Aaron discuss common themes in Ponzi Schemes.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:24] - Just in the last week since recording this episode, there have been huge drops in cryptocurrency exchange. Aaron believes two of them are exit scams.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:37] - Aaron shares a recent report about Afri-crypt and how he is suspicious of the figures.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[22:19] - Often in Ponzi Schemes, there are inflated daily or monthly returns.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:32] - The common theme is “otherworldly returns” that leads people down the path of falling victim to an exit scam.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:47] - What is a safe way to invest in cryptocurrency exchange?</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:02] - There is a difference between “guaranteed” returns and returns over time.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:20] - There is an issue with panic in cryptocurrency exchange.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:58] - Aaron recommends going with larger companies regarding cryptocurrency and lists some red flags to look for.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[33:27] - Any setting where it is obviously easy for someone to run away with tons of money is problematic.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[34:39] - If you have a lot of investment in crypto, tell your partner and family how to access it in a will.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:10] - Be careful and don’t put all your eggs in one basket. If something happens to one wallet, it isn’t catastrophic.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[36:57] - Cryptocurrency is not necessary to invest in. It is risky.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Bitcoin also appeared more trustworthy than newer companies.</li> <li>[8:39] - Why do people trust the company that has been around the longest?</li> <li>[9:40] - Aaron explains how Cotton simulated fake volume.</li> <li>[11:05] - There is a lot of discrepancy on Cotton’s death, but regardless, Aaron explains how his fraud and Ponzi Scheme played out.</li> <li>[12:58] - When the exchange started to crash, Cotton likely feared being found out.</li> <li>[14:20] - For a long time, there was a lot of smoke and mirrors surrounding where the actual money was.</li> <li>[15:30] - There is an unaccounted for amount of money missing from the money taken by Cotton which has created doubt that he is deceased.</li> <li>[17:02] - Chris and Aaron discuss common themes in Ponzi Schemes.</li> <li>[19:24] - Just in the last week since recording this episode, there have been huge drops in cryptocurrency exchange. Aaron believes two of them are exit scams.</li> <li>[20:37] - Aaron shares a recent report about Afri-crypt and how he is suspicious of the figures.</li> <li>[22:19] - Often in Ponzi Schemes, there are inflated daily or monthly returns.</li> <li>[25:32] - The common theme is “otherworldly returns” that leads people down the path of falling victim to an exit scam.</li> <li>[26:47] - What is a safe way to invest in cryptocurrency exchange?</li> <li>[28:02] - There is a difference between “guaranteed” returns and returns over time.</li> <li>[30:20] - There is an issue with panic in cryptocurrency exchange.</li> <li>[31:58] - Aaron recommends going with larger companies regarding cryptocurrency and lists some red flags to look for.</li> <li>[33:27] - Any setting where it is obviously easy for someone to run away with tons of money is problematic.</li> <li>[34:39] - If you have a lot of investment in crypto, tell your partner and family how to access it in a will.</li> <li>[36:10] - Be careful and don’t put all your eggs in one basket. If something happens to one wallet, it isn’t catastrophic.</li> <li>[36:57] - Cryptocurrency is not necessary to invest in. It is risky.</li> </ul> <p>Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</a> and leave a nice review. </p> Links and Resources: <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/">Podcast Web Page</a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast">Facebook Page</a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/">whatismyipaddress.com</a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Instagram</a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast">Easy Prey on Twitter</a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"> Easy Prey on YouTube</a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/">Easy Prey on Pinterest</a></li> <li><a href="https://longform.org/podcast">Longform Podcast</a></li> <li><a href="https://medium.com/s/cointalk">CoinTalk Podcast</a></li> <li><a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/podcast/id1565845318?app=podcast&ls=1&mt=2"> Exit Scam Podcast</a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/exitscampod">Exit Scam on Twitter</a></li> <li><a href= "https://twitter.com/aaronlammer?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor"> Aaron Lammer on Twitter</a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/aaron-lammer-97946420/">Aaron Lammer on LinkedIn</a></li> </ul>]]></content:encoded>

			<title>Resilience and Security with Kris Coleman</title>
			<itunes:title>Resilience and Security with Kris Coleman</itunes:title>
			<pubDate>Wed, 23 Jun 2021 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[6ef3cb99-2444-4b8c-a8f3-637cb9d1aacb]]></guid>
			<link><![CDATA[https://www.easyprey.com/69]]></link>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">What does it look like to be resilient? Many of us have lost our edge after a year in our homes and many have become unprepared to handle the unexpected. Listen on to find out about five pillars of resilience from our guest’s book</span> <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08PDRD4JG/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1"> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Raise Your Resiliency</span></em></a><em><span style= "font-weight: 400;">.</span></em></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Today’s guest is Kris Coleman. Kris has served with the CIA conducting threat and vulnerability assessments and for the FBI as a special agent. He is also an author and the founder and CEO of Red Five Security, which provides state of the art security and protective intelligence services. </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">What are you prepared for and what can you do to be more resilient in any scenario?</span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Show Notes:</span></h3> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[0:54] - Kris shares his background and the many paths he has taken on his career which includes everything from minor security to protecting against terrorists.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2:44] - When Kris was hired by a private family to redo their entire security platform, he realized what Red Five should be.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[4:31] - There are some misconceptions regarding what Kris does with Red Five Security.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[6:24] - Some affluent families that Kris works with are very public facing and some never leave the house. Kris explains the spectrum his clients are on.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[8:10] - “The more you can stay off the radar, the better off you’re going to be.” </span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[9:18] - Kris takes a look at a client’s digital footprint and looks at some things that can be done to help keep below the radar.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[10:01] - Kris shares common sense tips for security. For high profile clients, this can get tricky.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[11:37] - Under stress, fine motor skills are hard to execute.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[12:44] - Chris shares an experience about being in a different country and they did not have ambulances.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[13:56] - Even when clients travel to another state within the US, it is crucial for Kris’s team to know the environment they’re headed to.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[15:38] - Even the best neighborhoods can easily turn into a dangerous place.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[16:37] - Chris illustrates this with a news story of a private party being misunderstood as a huge organized event. Even something seemingly harmless can turn.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[17:58] - Kris shares a story about an extremely successful businessman feeling completely helpless.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[19:26] - We need individual resiliency on a national scale. This need created Resiliency for Executives and Leaders (REAL).</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[20:41] - Once Kris has worked with executives and leaders, they have a whole new sense of confidence.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[21:56] - REAL isn’t just for the wealthy. This program teaches people skills needed to be prepared for anything, especially natural disasters and storms.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[24:11] - For business owners, is your business ready for anything? Kris shares that his company had a plan for a pandemic prior to Covid-19.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:00] - Kris is the author of</span> <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08PDRD4JG/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1"> <em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Raise Your Resiliency</span></em></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. He planned on writing a book about security, but Covid changed his direction.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[25:56] - The three units that need to survive and thrive are the individual, the family, and the business.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[26:31] - The Five Pillars of Resilience are: awareness, mindset, fitness, skills, and relationship.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[27:54] - Regarding mindset, when it comes to resilience, you need to have a positive, growth, and survival mindset.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[28:53] - Kris gives examples of a catastrophic mindset that many people had during the pandemic. Mindset and awareness are a choice.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[29:24] - Fitness applies to physical, mental, and emotional strength in the three units (individual, family, and business).</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[30:14] - Kris lists many skills that a lot of people are not ready for, specifically now after a year of being stuck at home.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[31:13] - The fifth pillar is relationships. This applies to your neighbors and community and not just your immediate family.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[34:37] - In a lot of cases, things can be problematic for people in just a couple of hours due to lack of planning and preparedness.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[37:40] - Things may sometimes feel redundant when preparing for anything.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[38:33] - Your geographical location makes a difference in the type of things you need to prepare for. Take a risk assessment of your environment.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[40:23] - Make the situation work for you when preparing for different events. Look at the likelihood of things to prepare for.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[41:25] - Kris shares how the risk of civil unrest is higher in certain parts of the country over others.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">[43:03] - Prepare for an emergency and if something doesn’t happen, practice using it and restock it. Cycle the emergency food and supplies every few months.</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Thanks for joining us on Easy Prey. Be sure to</span> <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/easy-prey/id1488678905"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> subscribe to our podcast on iTunes</span></a> <span style= "font-weight: 400;">and leave a nice review. </span></p> <h3><span style="font-weight: 400;">Links and Resources:</span></h3> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.easyprey.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Podcast Web Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/EasyPreyPodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Facebook Page</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://whatismyipaddress.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">whatismyipaddress.com</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.instagram.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Instagram</span></a></li> <li><a href="https://twitter.com/easypreypodcast"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Twitter</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/company/easy-prey-podcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on LinkedIn</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCgy_xKrjiXghSgGFEAFdTQ"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Easy Prey on YouTube</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.pinterest.com/easypreypodcast/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Easy Prey on Pinterest</span></a></li> <li><em><a href= "https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08PDRD4JG/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">Raise Your Resiliency: You, Your Family, and Your Business Can Achieve Resiliency in an Uncertain World</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">by Kris Coleman</span></a></em></li> <li><a href="https://red5security.com/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Red Five Security Home Page</span></a></li> <li><a href= "https://www.linkedin.com/in/kris-coleman-5359466/"><span style= "font-weight: 400;">Kris Coleman Red Five Security on LinkedIn</span></a></li> </ul>]]></description>
